column8:
[h1] Profundamente an√™mico ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ [/h1] 
Tenho uma certa m√° vontade com Visual Novels, mas muita boa vontade com o universo de Vampiro: A M√°scara, e mesmo sem curtir o g√™nero, dei uma chance a Coteries of New York, tanto por se tratar de uma das cidades mais cl√°ssicas do cen√°rio de RPG quanto por tentar achar um substituto moderno √† altura do sensacional VTM Bloodlines. Mesmo insistindo em investir no jogo, vejo que Coteries of New York √© um tremendo mar de possibilidades perdidas. A alta expectativa que tinha foi transformada diretamente em decep√ß√£o, que s√≥ n√£o foi intensificada devido ao valor bem modesto que paguei.

Tudo aqui √© limitado, restrito, insuficiente, desde as op√ß√µes dispon√≠veis para cl√£s at√© as op√ß√µes para di√°logos. O que n√£o necessariamente quer dizer que a trama e os personagens sejam ruins. H√°, de fato, uma equipe competente entregando personagens marcantes e interessantes, mas que n√£o se destacam al√©m de uma p√°gina de ideias legais para personagens em um dos livros do RPG. As tramas da sua Coterie e as outras sidequests dispon√≠veis s√£o bem superficiais e mal aproveitadas. O final do jogo, principalmente, foi extremamente frustrante, cada escolha que fiz parece ter significado algum.

Analisando os outros aspectos que comp√µem essa experi√™ncia, tamb√©m se percebe a mesma qualidade pobre. Com exce√ß√£o da trilha sonora, que realmente se destaca, todos os elementos art√≠sticos s√£o bem limitados. Desde as artes dos cen√°rios, que s√£o comumente repetidas, at√© os designs de personagens, que parecem reaproveitados (h√° pelo menos tr√™s pares de personagens no jogo que, se n√£o aparecessem os nomes deles, eu certamente os confundiria, o que √© muito estranho).

Talvez o ponto que mais me irritou tenha sido a simplifica√ß√£o das compuls√µes e das perdi√ß√µes dos cl√£s, que s√£o pontos fundamentais no RPG, mas aqui s√£o meros detalhes com impacto narrativo quase nulo, quase uma caracter√≠stica exc√™ntrica do personagem, que s√≥ √© poss√≠vel ver em di√°logos muito espec√≠ficos. Talvez seja a parte de n√£o curtir tanto Visual Novels falando, mas creio que um sistema aleat√≥rio, onde di√°logos pudessem ser afetados pelas compuls√µes e perdi√ß√µes, seria bem mais interessante se implementado. Algo que realmente simulasse o sistema do RPG e n√£o focasse apenas na narrativa com momentos chaves pre-determinados, mas ao mesmo tempo, se afastando do proposta que √© ser uma VN. 

Coteries of New York est√° longe de ser ofensivo de t√£o ruim. Enquanto escrevia esta review, me ocorreu a possibilidade de estar sendo muito exigente com o jogo, mas me pego pensando que ele √© fundamentalmente uma imagem semi-est√°tica com texto rodando; as possibilidades s√£o basicamente infinitas, e, em perspectiva, o que este jogo entrega √© quase nada. As 6 a 8 horas que ele dura seriam melhor investidas lendo um cap√≠tulo dos livros dos cl√£s ou fazendo mais uma run alternativa em Bloodlines.

C'est un jeu narratif qui immerge tr√®s bien dans l'ambiance du jeu de r√¥le Vampire : Mascarade. On peut cependant y jouer m√™me si on ne connait pas le jeu de r√¥le.
Le texte est de qualit√©, le niveau de jeu exigent (pas de retour en arri√®re possible).

Dieses Spiel ist ein toller Einstieg in die Welt von Vampire - The Masquerade.

Die Storys sind sehr interessant, wobei sie sich nur in bestimmten Phrasen unterscheiden. 
Insgesamt bleibt bei allen 3 Charakteren die Grundstory gleich. 
Die Nebenquests waren f√ºr mich alle wesentlich spannender als die Hauptquest.

Als Charakter sind 3 spezifisch vorgegeben. 
Man erstellt keinen eigenen. Ausschlie√ülich den Namen darf man hier selbstst√§ndig geben.

Man kann durch das Glossar gut Hintergrundwissen lernen. Man bekommt einen sch√∂nen √úberblick √ºber Fragen und Antworten. Durch die Antworten beeinflusst man dann die weiterf√ºhrende Story. 
Auch hat man sowas wie verschiedene "Trink - Gelegenheiten", in der man seine F√§higkeiten nutzen oder auch unterlassen kann. Insgesamt ein sch√∂nes Gimmik, vor allem wenn man es nicht am Pc, sondern regul√§r mit Pen & Paper spielt =D

Die Grafiken sind echt sch√∂n und haben ihren ganz eigenen Charme. 
Ich pers√∂nlich mag genau diesen dunklen, malerischen Gothik und Vampir Stil.

Die Musik passt sehr gut und untermalt gerade die Antworten und Szenen oft passend. 

Die Errungenschaften kann man nur komplett machen, wenn ihr wie ich, alle Charaktere und Wege mit den jeweiligen Antwortm√∂glichkeiten gebt. In einem Durchlauf sind sie nicht schaffbar.

Insgesamt ist die Novel mit ihren Antworten, Fragen und Grundstory sehr gut. 
Zumal hier auch die Grundbegriffe erkl√§rt werden und man sie im Glossar nachschlagen kann. 

Das Game ist f√ºr alle Vampir, Novel und gezielt Vampire the Masquerade Fans ein tolles und sehr empfehlenswertes Spiel. Auch kann ich es jedem Einsteiger ins Vampire Universum nur ans Herz legen =D

It's a pretty nice VN with beautiful art and great soundtrack to elevate the experience. My biggest complaint is the saving system and no way (that I can find) to skip through dialogue or sections. I'm looking forward to try the next game.

column8:
Vampire: The Masquerade - Coteries of New York is a narrative-driven visual novel set in the Vampire: The Masquerade universe. It offers rich storytelling, atmospheric visuals, and tough moral choices.
The art in this Game is atmospheric and dark, perfectly capturing the mood of the game's gothic, vampiric world. 
The three main characters each have distinct backgrounds and personal stories, reflecting their unique vampire clans. Their narratives explore different aspects of the vampiric world, from Toreador's artistic struggles to Brujah's rebellion and Ventrue's pursuit of power.
I‚Äôve also played Shadows of New York, and it had just as strong a story and choices. I‚Äôll definitely play Reckoning of New York in the future as well.
6.5/10

column8: Decent stuff if you're into WoD or Vampire: The Masquerade. However, the first game in this trilogy struggles to hide the fact that its story is highly streamlined. If you're looking for the freedom found in Bloodlines or Night Road, this won't be the game for you. That said, if moody visuals (that perfectly fit the WoD), a straightforward VtM story (with some nice easter eggs), and a cool soundtrack appeal to you, then you should enjoy it.
column9: Decent stuff if you're into WoD or Vampire: The Masquerade. However, the first game in this trilogy struggles to hide the fact that its story is highly streamlined. If you're looking for the freedom found in Bloodlines or Night Road, this won't be the game for you. That said, if moody visuals (that perfectly fit the WoD), a straightforward VtM story (with some nice easter eggs), and a cool soundtrack appeal to you, then you should enjoy it.

column8:
Good at times but it gives too many meaningless choices that take away from what could be better writing and the choices do nothing interesting plot wise or with your abilities.

Coteries of New York is a visual novel where you start out by choosing between three characters who get a different short intro but after they basically all behave the same way apart from a brief later meeting with someone from your past. You are a newly turned vampire that spends each night following a short and linear main story that your actions do not allow you to alter or branch from and a series of side stories with different characters that you can choose to interact with one or two each night before needing to rest for the day. Some of these are just side stories but four characters are ones you are looking to add to your Coterie, a group of vampires together for the same goal or who at least trust each other enough to protect one another. Some of these side characters are enjoyable to interact with and your time with the Prince's Sheriff or the Nosferatu detective D'Angelo is often the game at its best. The artwork for the characters and backgrounds is good enough, nothing too interesting and frequently reused though.

The problem is that none of your choices really matter or effect anything, other than removing plot from your playthrough. While each of the three playable characters is part of a different clan, all this leads to is minor differences in what vampire disciplines they can use, and these abilities, while completely different, are essentially used interchangeably just giving you access to the one your character has that in the same situation would be one that another character has if you were playing as them. You need to feed to keep access to your abilities but this is more of an afterthought and if you don't feed you might find the "beast" taking over and waking up to a drained corpse, which would think might effect things but doesn't. There is one ending to the game and while who you get to join your Coterie will see you getting a brief moment of help from two of them, this is a quick thing that does not change no matter who helps you, and if you didn't gain the trust of any character you will just be helped by someone else. Each playthrough will allow you to fully complete about 2/3 of all the events and it really might as well have just allowed you to do everything since the story wouldn't change anyway. Because you can't diverge from the main plot no matter how stupid you act your choices don't really matter because something will just happen to get events on track anyway, it would honestly have been better to just have no options except for brief moments to instead just have the writers able to focus on more content and better character development, the same with character selection where they really might as well have just had one main characters.

The ending seems to be considered the worst part of the game for a lot of people and if it was able to give more closure or bring more people into it if it was a better and more linear narrative it could have been a solid story in the setting. As it is it has some good moments but is lacking in almost every area to keep it from being anything great, but it can make for a decent short playthrough if you enjoy the setting.

Screenshots: https://x.com/Legolas_Katarn/status/1843512735222640654

column8:
Jouez-y. Si vous √™tes un fan de Vampire la Mascarade, vous allez adorer. Si vous ne connaissez pas Vampire la Mascarade, c'est une excellent introduction √† l'univers du jeu. 

Le jeu offre le choix de 3 personnages, et au cours de la partie vos choix affectent l'histoire, pouvant vous mener √† l'une des mauvaises fins si vous ne faites pas attention. Vous rencontrez un cast de personnages vari√©s, et vous ne pourrez pas tous les rencontrer (ou du moins, pas finir toutes leurs qu√™tes) en un seul run. 
L'histoire est tr√®s bien √©crite, le lore de New York y est d√©velopp√© (et si vous connaissez d√©j√† le lore de NYC dans Vampire, vous retrouverez des personnages que vous connaissez, les d√©veloppeurs se sont vraiment bas√©s sur le lore d√©j√† existant). 

Il n'y a qu'une seule "bonne" fin mais les diff√©rentes routes √† faire pour y arriver permettent une certaine rejouabilit√©. Alors vous passerez pas 100h dessus hein, mais ce n'est pas le but non plus. 

En somme une tr√®s bonne histoire qui donne envie de jouer √† la suite (et √† raison).

[B]Vampire: The Masquerade - Coteries of New York[/B] ist ein textbasiertes Rollenspiel in der bekannten [B]World of Darkness.[/B] Dieses Spiel ist zurzeit das einzige mit deutschen Untertitel aus dem WoD-Universum & ich kann mir tats√§chlich nicht erkl√§ren weshalb. Das Franchise ist hierzulande neben den Klassikern wie D&D & DsA eines der Beliebteren. Aber nun zum Review.

[H1]Die Geschichte...[/H1]
... handelt zun√§chst von unserer Erweckung zum Vampir & unserer Orientierungslosigkeit. Danach zieht sich nur so ein semi-roter-Faden durch das Spiel, da uns als K√ºken nat√ºrlich nicht alles Wichtige gesagt wird.
Im Verlauf treffen wir viele verschiedene Charaktere, vier davon k√∂nnen wir als unsere "Freunde" gewinnen & eine pers√∂nliche Quest mit ihnen erleben. Macht definitiv Spa√ü, da die Charaktere alle sehr unterschiedlich sind, sowohl von ihrer Aufgabe als auch von ihrer Kommunikation her.
Auch hat man das [b]"politische-Intrigen-alle-hassen-sich-Gef√ºhl"[/b] sehr gut in das Spiel transportiert bekommen. Man f√ºhlt sich durchgehend wie der Schubs- & Scho√ühund der Camarilla & das nervt, ist aber gleichzeitig eben auch das, was das Spielen eines Vampires in der Camarilla eben so ausmacht.
Ich wei√ü schon, warum die [B]Banu Haqim[/B] mein bevorzugter Clan sind, diese werden im Spiel aber nicht einmal namentlich erw√§hnt.

[H1]Aber apropos Clan:[/H1]
Wir k√∂nnen einer von [B]drei portagonisten[/B] sein. Ein Brujah, ein Toreador & ein Ventrue. Meinen ersten Durchlauf habe ich als Brujah gespielt & das nat√ºrlich auch an den Vampirf√§higkeiten, die ich zur Auwahl hatte, gemerkt (Pr√§senz, St√§rke, Geschwindigkeit). [B]Pr√§senz[/B] hat nat√ºrlich jeder dieser Clans, einfach damit man einen sozialen L√∂sungsnasatz f√ºr Probleme hat. 

[H1]Nur f√ºr Kenner von VtM?[/H1]
Nein, definitiv nicht. Obwohl ich die WoD schon aus dem dazugeh√∂rigen TTRPG kenne und selbst gerne gespielt habe, ist mein Wissen durch lange Abstinenz und das Wechseln in andere Systeme etwas eingerostet.
Dies l√∂st das Spiel aber sehr gut: Da der Spielcharakter ebenfalls neu in der Vampirgesellschaft ist, wird ihm alles nach & nach erkl√§rt - teils wirklich sehr ausschweifend. Sollte der Spieler etwas vergessen, kann alles in einem √ºbersichtlichen [B]Glossar[/B] nachgelesen werden. Schlagw√∂rter im Text, die nachgelesen werden k√∂nnen, sind rot markiert & daher f√ºr jeden ersichtlich.

[H1]Die Grafik...[/H1]
... besteht aus 2D Artworks. Sowohl die einzelnen Charaktere als auch die Hintergr√ºnde (Szenerien) sind sehr gut umgesetzt. Jeder einzelne Charakter hat gro√üen Wiedererkennungswert. Man kann erkennen, dass da ein K√ºnstler angeheuert wurde, der schon mindestens seine 10 Jahre Erfahrung auf dem Gebiet hat.
Auch die "Animationen" wie Lichteffekte, Rauch & √§hnliches sind gelungen & stimmungsvoll umgesetzt.
Das Artbook werde ich mir k√ºnftig definitiv noch holen.

[H1]Die Soundkulisse...[/H1]
... ist hervorragend & untermalt das Geschehen immer perfekt. Der Soundtrack ist ebenfalls wunderbar & ich empfehle einen separaten Kauf davon, um die Entwickler zu unterst√ºtzen. Nebenbei eignet sich die Musik auch wunderbar f√ºr eure hauseigene TTRPG Session, egal ob in der WoD angesiedelt oder nicht.

[H1]Kritik[/H1]
[B]1-[/B] Der Speicherstand zerst√∂rt sich sobald man das Spiel 'beendet', das hei√üt, es entweder tats√§chlich durchspielt oder stirbt. Das hei√üt, man muss komplett von vorne anfangen und das empfinde ich als nicht sonderlich Nutzerfreundlich.
[B]2-[/B] Das Ende kommt [B]VIEL(!!)[/B] zu pl√∂tzlich & ohne jegliche Vorwarnung. Nach (ich glaube es waren) 7 N√§chten endet die Geschichte n√§mlich automatisch. Die Hauptquest geschieht auch von selbst, wir k√∂nnen  diese nicht aktiv ausl√∂sen. So haben wir zahlreiche Nebenmissionen, die am Ende des Spieles noch offen sind & die wir nur mit einem zweiten und Speicherstand erledigen k√∂nnen. Das ist vor allem dann bl√∂d, wenn das vorher nirgendwo kommuniziert wird & man mehrere Gef√§hrtenquests quasi vollst√§ndig erledigt hat, aer eben noch nicht ganz.
Das Spiel ben√∂tigt mindestens 3 Durchg√§nge um alle Errungenschaften freizuschalten.
[B]3-[/B] Man kann nur 2 Aktionen pro Nacht vollf√ºhren. Nicht nur, dass oftmals eine davon f√ºr die automatisch ausl√∂sende Hauptmission genutzt wird, nein, selbst kurze Gespr√§che von wenigen Minuten (z.B. weil dich jemand besucht), entziehen eine von zwei n√§chtlichen Aktivit√§ten. Und das ergibt leider gar keinen Sinn, vor allem, dann, wenn du f√ºr das Gespr√§ch nicht einmal deinen Ort wechseln musst.
[B]4-[/B] Die Bluttrinken-Mechanik finde ich nicht so gelungen & das aus zwei Gr√ºnden: Der Charakter kann nicht bei einem Nachtspaziergang spontan ein Opfer suchen, nein, wir haben diese Option nur zuf√§llig an bestimmten Abschnitten der Geschichte. Also keine M√∂glichkeit, bewusst & willentlich zu trinken.

[H1]Fazit:[/H1]
Ich habe es im Sale f√ºr 2‚Ç¨ erworben & muss im Nachgang sagen, dass das f√ºr die Qualit√§t definitiv zu wenig war. Der erste Durchgang hat mich rund 5 Stunden Zeit gekostet. Das Spiel hat definitiv einen Wiederspielwert, eben weil es nicht m√∂glich ist, alles in einem Durchgang zu schaffen. Dennoch muss ich anf√ºgen, dass das abrupte & eher aufgewzungene Ende mich mit einem etwas unzufriedenem Gef√ºhlzur√ºckgelassen hat - Aber vielleicht wird dies in einem zweiten Durchgang anders.

It's hard to recommend this game, not cause its bad but because it just not worth 20 bucks.
If you're a speed reader you could probably beat it fast enough to refund it.
If you are interested I could only recommend it on sale.

The art is probably the worst part, most of the character portraits feel lacking in personality and expressiveness. 
They also don't have any expression portraits or unique full screen images, just one generic standing pose per character which is cheap and lazy. I've played free VNs with dozens of portraits per character, c'mon. Also the Nossies are supposed to look like such terrifying monsters that a normal person would see one and start screaming their head off. D'Angelo and Kaiser just look like normal guys, okay maybe Angelo has a broken jaw and Kaiser is bald but compared to the designs in Bloodlines these are just lame.

The writing is usually  great. Lots of personality, good sense of character voice, excellent pacing and the cast are all well realised and quite enjoyable "people". By in large though its quite good, except for all the Communist fugazi. 
Nobody, and I mean NOBODY hits on a girl at a rave by telling them "yeah I read Communist theory" or "Yeah, I watch Breadtube" its just silly. Inserting Communist lingo and concepts into your dialogue does not make your protagonist into a punk who wants to fight the system, it comes across like they are an unfortunate victim of one system raging against another.
You wanna write punk? You gotta *be* punk. Not just another jackbooted politically minded library geek.

Outside of that the rest of the writing is fantastic.
The writers have a great grasp of the VTM setting and lore, which they express through a cast of unique and very memorable characters. A Malkavian channelling her multiple personalities into a fake internet echo chamber, the Sheriff who all about the Mets baby, the weird hipster vampire obsessed with God, a nossie noire detective. I love them all, even if they're a bunch of manipulative parasites who just want me to serve their dubious agendas.

column8:
6'5/10
Me compr√© este juego como por 2 euros o as√≠ en Instantgaming y nada mal.
S√≠ que es verdad que el hecho de que no tenga romanceito y salseito le hace perder puntos, porque ya que es un juego sencillito y corto, qu√© menos que meter alg√∫n meneo, digo yo (o m√°s de uno). Pero el arte del juego est√° chulo, las misiones son entretenidas, los personajes me encantan (D'Angelo, Qadir y Larson que me hagan un sandwich (de tres pisos, s√≠, qu√© pasa)). 
Vamos, que bastante bien. He tenido alg√∫n bug que otro. S√≠, parece imposible, pero ha pasado: im√°genes que cargan en algunas runs y en otras no, todo lo que es la rama de Tamika (s√≥lo me dej√≥ reclutarla, no volvi√≥ a salir, se ve que era t√≠mida).
A√∫n as√≠, bastante mejor que el Vampire The Mascarade Swansong, que madre m√≠a, me dej√© 9 pavos y he jugado 15 minutos porque es infumable a todos los niveles. No lo compr√©is, chavales, de nada.

J'ai beaucoup aim√©.
1er chapitre de la trilogie de New York (Coteries - Shadows - Reckoning), c'est un visual novel aux artworks dynamiques et classes, servi par une √©criture soign√©e, dans ses tournures et r√©f√©rences culturelles.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3337968016
L'ambiance est prenante, les situations, les sc√®nes palpitantes, et les choix peuvent mener au game over ou √† diff√©rentes alliances.

Excellente introduction au monde de Vampire : the masquerade, jeu de r√¥le cr√©√© en 1991, et qui se joue encore sur table (√©dition 5 quand j'√©cris ces lignes). Un dictionnaire int√©gr√© permet de d√©couvrir sans lourdeur, sans aller sur le net, et de savourer l'histoire, dont on devine qu'elle se pose dans un large contexte de clans, factions, dissensions, et cette fameuse "mascarade".

Toute la partie sonore est grandement travaill√©e, et le main theme a quelque chose de sombre, moite et addictif :
https://youtu.be/I_1hpXHnuvc?si=HmlMrk4SD6IaZ1Sn
On peut regretter que le jeu s'arr√™te l√†, car on tenait quelque chose de fort : malheureusement, une seule comp√©tence par personnage, et bien souvent les options de dialogues sont b√™tes (notre personnage √©tant un novice). On aurait souhait√© un vrai JDR/RPG, ou des √©l√©ments de point n'click peut-√™tre, mais le voyage est d√©j√† beau.

Le vrai reproche sera l'absence de relecture de la tradution fran√ßaise, farcie de fautes d'orthographe et grammaire, ce qui est difficile √† admettre dans un jeu si textuel. J'aurais corrig√© avec plaisir.

Recommended; with the caveat that you're either a fan of Vampire the Masquerade and want to experience the entire New York trilogy, or you get it on sale. On it's own merits the game is not worth the price point otherwise. 

The art is lovely. Out of the entire trilogy I actually prefer the art direction and style of Coteries. It has more of a hand-painted look than the later titles, which suffer from an appearance of looking slightly AI-generated, especially the character portraits. 

The quality of writing ranges to the extreme in some cases. Some characters are truly interesting, and the story can take some surprising turns. At other times however, characters can be completely flat, and bland - With the story becoming nonsensical, relying on hand holding to a large degree in the later parts. The main characters have very little personality, if any at all. Ultimately the game suffers from you having little agency throughout, making replaying as another character feel like a chore. 

It's very much a situation where you have a momentary appearance of choice, that doesn't effect much at all in the end.

[h2][i]"...What are you even talking about?"[/i][/h2]

This is more like a sideways-thumb review. All in all, I enjoyed my time.

Coteries of New York is a solid VN introduction the vampire side of the World of Darkness universe. It throws you right into the thick of it as a know-nothing fledgling trying to navigate the fatalistic shadowy unlife of being a godless monster. The tone of the setting is applied with all its necessary tensity. It's well written, and the cast of characters are definable and likable (or detestable, but intentionally so). 

There are very few actual mechanics to manage. You may be rightly punished for saying dumb shit at the wrong time. Otherwise the only other thing is tracking the amount of Blood you have, which is the second weakest aspect of the game‚ÄîYour lifeline and (and certain dialogue options) use Blood, but the only indication you have of how much or how little you currently possess is vaguely determined by the intensity of the bloody portrait around the screen. Stylish, but hardly helpful.

Lastly, the end. Oh, god, the ending is so rushed. I dare not spoil the disappointment but you'd think a game that emphasizes Coteries would make them have a larger impact on the turnout at the end.

So, yeah, I appreciated the experience prior to that point, but I don't think I'd actually recommend it.

column8: The game has it's issues (both in terms of being buggy and consistency of storytelling/lore), but still offers a nice dip in the VtM universe. Also contains one of the best-written characters I ever met. In my entire gaming "career" I never felt so much like hugging an NPC...

I was enjoying the story so far, but what is the point in allowing us to save and exit before making a choice in the game if an incorrect choice will lead to the save file being deleted anyway? This seems punishing to players who want to explore various outcomes without having to start a new play through each time. I don't know if I'll have the patience to complete this.

column8:
Good game, good twist, some replayability. The blood management system (you need to keep track of how much blood you suck and how many times you've used your abilities) adds some nice gameplay to what you'd expect to be just another VN.
But it has all the problems you'd expect from a WOD V5 game made in the current era. But I don't think any of these problems bring the game down, is just a matter of different tastes.

column8:
[h1]An engaging visual novel that sells the setting and tells several enjoyable stories within it.[/h1]

I don't play a lot of VNs.  Once I started this one, I was hooked very quickly, and was mildly surprised by the end that I enjoyed it thoroughly.

If you don't know anything about Vampire: the Masquerade, this is a great primer.  Your protagonist is plunged into the setting very abruptly, but not unnaturally, providing immediate and believable engagement in the story.  The exposition introduces critical concepts with equal seamlessness, drip feeding them over time as you struggle with your first few decisions, and adding more bits throughout the game instead of trying to dump it all at once as some games do.  I was reminded very much of the tutorial from the timeless [i]Vampire: Bloodlines[/i] - this game shamelessly steals Bloodlines' "you are a newly awakened vampire who doesn't know what's going on" but walks you through first steps much more smoothly, without hitting you over the head with "this is a game tutorial".

The main plot feels unfocused at first, without much story pressure beyond "wander around and try to make friends".  While not exactly thrilling, it's a nice way to give the player some agency, and there are a wide range of storylines you may choose to pursue (or not).  You will not have time to see it all, which ironically gives you the power of positive choice.

Moment to moment writing is not always prizewinning.  There is good and mediocre, which is fine with me.  None of it is actively bad and I never rolled my eyes nor was tempted to stop playing.  On the positive side, I found several moments genuinely chilling or charming and I cared about every character I met.

The subplots you choose to pursue are interesting and filled with both "cosmetic" (unimpactful) conversation options and substantially meaningful decisions.  These side stories can have bad outcomes depending on your choices, which means every decision demands attention, even when you're not sure whether they affect anything.  Perhaps more importantly, this is good noir, meaning the protagonist doesn't always get to win.  The story keeps going even when you make mistakes along the way and it's important to note that your playthrough will have a single rolling save.  No quicksave/quickload to try every dialogue option and choose your favorite result.  This is a good thing.

Overall plotting and structure are impressive, beginning with "do what you want" and slowly building the groundwork for a focused, fast-paced, and sensational climax by the end.  Regrettably, there is only a single ending to the main story; however, I was surprised to find that this didn't bother me, as the journey to get there gave plenty of opportunities for me to make a difference in the (un)lives of those I met along the way.

When the credits rolled, I found I wanted more.  I'm looking forward to moving on to [i]Shadows of New York[/i] which I hear is even better, and assuming no disappointments there I'm likely to pick up the finale, [i]Reckoning[/i].

You can definitely get this very cheap on sale.  In my opinion it's certainly worth a couple bucks and 8-10 hours of your time.

A visual novel where you play a newly created vampire in New York City in the World of Darkness setting, and try to find allies and get caugh up in schemes. I think the fact that there's no option to automatically skip already read passages, or the ability to save or reload if you die are a bit problematic, but the game isn't too difficult and as long as you don't do something obviously suicidal or ignore feeding altogether you'll be okay. Also I found it feels very much like playing a tabletop Vampire: The Masquerade game including having the game master kill your character in frustration when you refuse to go along with their plot

Also I found it feels very much like playing a tabletop Vampire: The Masquerade game including having the game master kill your character in frustration when you refuse to go along with their plot

I really want to like this game, the atmosphere, characters, and plot are all enticing at times but having a feed mechanic were you're forced into game over screens if you don't pick the right missions at the right time, causing your save game to get deleted, because there are no manual saves is just baffling.

Es un juegazo con todas la letras, me gusto mucho su mundo, primera vez que tengo contacto con la franquicia de Vampire: The masquerade, y debo de aceptar que fue muy buena experiencia, tiene unos secundarios simplemente geniales e unicos y su historia me gusto bastante, a ver si juego mas de esta franquicia a futuro :)

The VN is fine, really. I enjoyed my time aplenty, even if it's just because of my love for VtM.
But I don't see the point of it. It's not great enough of an introduction to the world. But it seems to be written entirely only as an introduction, to a point where 70% of the game can be skimmed by anyone who knows VtM already. It takes its sweet time with setting up the basics that it's hard to find a reason for enthusiasts to jump in.

What it does have in store is a cast is just vibrant enough to pique interest, but they don't have any depth to pay it off. The characters seem to be set up to tell some cool stories, or at least be entertaining (though unfortunately mostly in caricature). The story, however, is done so fast that none of the intrigue a character might have goes anywhere. In fact, you barely get to interact with most of them, and the ones that you are supposed to interact with don't factor into the story at all.
That might not be the worst, but the story is just pushed onto you suddenly. The few pieces I managed to find that would be leading up to it are hard to piece together until the game just decides to come out with it, and even with those pieces it feels out of the nowhere. In a game where most time is spent pursuing side-quests with main story interruptions that themselves feel like forced side-quests, it's ridiculous that the "grand finale" (as the achievement calls it) just hits before you get a chance to scratch deeper than the surface of what was offered. The narrative design on this game is beyond atrocious.

The game design itself is even worse. I understand the want to make all choices permanent for a VtM story. But with how the game is set-up, it seems to beg thorough playthroughs to actually get anything out of it. Having save points like in a normal visual novel would be great not to waste time. 
But instead the only option is starting a new game and hold down a skip button. That's mildly annoying already. What's inexcusable is that the 3-choice system of the game manages to have consistently awful and misleading wording. Along with hunger mechanic that is barely telegraphed and unsure feeding opportunities, it's hard to skip through the fluff and remember which choice it was that you made last time so you can actually follow through with the quest to the end or change something to see new content (which ends up being 2 lines, unless you failed the storyline completely). It's like the game is designed for the player to get nothing out of the first playthrough and then painstakingly make route maps to get the bare minimum that was written. But the bare minimum isn't even that enlightening, even if it's pretty alright.
All for what? So a couple of characters you don't know can have a climax to a story that wasn't told. In a way, that tells the story of a pawn fledgling that everybody sees as a dirty rug. But in a game that's set-up as "seriously consider your choices", you'd like to have at least an illusion of agency instead of acting basically as a characterless nobody who can barely do anything while the one-note story creeps up and happens around you rather than with you in it. It's beyond unsatisfying, and it would be even if the ending wasn't boring. It feels like an insult to the reader, like a bad fan-fiction to a linear VtM novel that didn't have this game's MC in it. Only this theoretical novel that this would be a fanfiction is also dogshit.

It all feels like a first chapter to a mediocre story that was rushed out when someone realized that they set-up too many pieces to do anything with them.

column8: Senza pretese, se vi piacciono le novel interattive. Storia carina che rispetta i mood di Vampire The Masquerade, ottima intro per il GDR da tavola. Forse pochi clan giocabili e scelte che non sembrano cambiare troppo il corso degli eventi, nel complesso ottimo gioco se vi piace il mondo ^^

Vampire: The Masquerade - Coteries of New York is an exquisite blend of narrative brilliance and atmospheric immersion that truly captures the essence of the World of Darkness. As a long-time fan of the Vampire: The Masquerade universe, I approached this game with high expectations, and it surpassed every one of them.

From the moment you start the game, you are thrust into a dark and seductive version of New York City, where every choice you make carries weight and consequence. The storytelling is masterful, weaving a rich tapestry of intrigue, politics, and personal struggle. Each character you encounter is meticulously crafted, bringing depth and authenticity to the narrative. Whether you're interacting with fellow Kindred or navigating the treacherous social dynamics of your coterie, the dialogue is sharp, engaging, and often thought-provoking.

The art direction is nothing short of stunning. The moody, gothic visuals perfectly complement the game's dark themes, creating an atmosphere that is both beautiful and unsettling. The detailed backgrounds and character designs are a feast for the eyes, drawing you deeper into the shadowy underbelly of New York. The haunting soundtrack further enhances this ambiance, with its eerie melodies and ominous undertones lingering in your mind long after you‚Äôve stopped playing.

What truly sets Coteries of New York apart is its emphasis on player choice. Every decision you make shapes the story and affects your relationships with other characters. This branching narrative structure ensures that no two playthroughs are the same, offering immense replay value. The moral ambiguity of many choices forces you to carefully consider your actions and their potential repercussions, staying true to the essence of Vampire: The Masquerade.

The game‚Äôs pacing is superb, maintaining a delicate balance between moments of quiet reflection and intense action. The writing is consistently strong, with well-crafted plot twists and compelling character arcs that keep you hooked from start to finish. The developers have done a fantastic job of capturing the complexities and nuances of vampiric existence, making you feel both the power and the curse of being a Kindred.

In conclusion, Vampire: The Masquerade - Coteries of New York is a must-play for fans of narrative-driven games and the World of Darkness. Its immersive storytelling, stunning visuals, and impactful choices make it a standout title that leaves a lasting impression. Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned fan or new to the series, this game offers an unforgettable journey into the dark heart of New York‚Äôs vampire society. Highly recommended!

SIMPL√ÉO mas serve pra n00bs entenderem a merda desse cen√°rio do RPG original.
Bons gr√°ficos, mas sem muita variedade de recompensas. Muito sandbox.
Ficou faltando m√©tricas de penalidades, e n√£o s√≥ textinho flavor pra descrever atos bizarros como, por exemplo, sair estrucidando mortais durante a narrativa.

Essa com certeza √© uma √≥tima recomenda√ß√£o para quem que se iniciar no universo de Vampire The Masquerade.

Com uma base s√≥lida para os principais termos do universo de Vampiro a M√°scara, ele n√£o apresenta tudo que o universo oferece, mas voc√™ consegue entender a briga principal entre a Camarilla, os Anarchs, o que √© a M√°scara, alguns cl√£s e seus poderes, as pol√≠ticas internas, e como o mundo vamp√≠rico √© complexo, antigo, e poderoso. Algumas quest√µes levantadas s√£o extremamente interessantes para f√£s do g√™nero.

Como disse, √© uma entrada s√≥lida no universo de Vampiro, mas sinto que pare por a√≠. Foi divertido jogar suas diversas rotas e experimentar com algumas respostas diferentes, mas ele n√£o d√° muito espa√ßo para seu genero visual novel. As escolhas se tornam quase que sem peso em alguns pontos do jogo. Em nenhum momento senti que o personagem que estava jogando possu√≠sse alguma personalidade √∫nica al√©m daquela que o cl√£ providenciava ou se era mais tranquilo ou psicopata. N√£o me incomoda muito pois o jogo n√£o se vendeu assim. √â uma hist√≥ria para ser experimentada.

Dito isso, um 8/10 bem s√≥lido e pra quem gosta de vampiro tem um prato muito bom aqui.

If "interactive fiction" means non-choices that mean nothing but at least you can use a mouse to navigate pages, then an epub about the fabulous vamp scene in NYC nightclubs is the same experience. I guess it's a visual novel because there are pictures but, then, a comic book is that too. Since this is basically just a book that takes up hard drive space, the writing better be good... it's not. In fact, nothing in this new deluge of V:TM content has proven to be anything but SBI-infected drivel with no respect for people who just want to have fun, cloying for the attention from a youth that only reads YA novels and Riverdale fanfic. Glad I got this for free but, even then, not really since the person who gifted me this and Shadows turned out to have full blown TDS and only talks to his cat now. That's the audience this is for.

column8:
Not a fan of text rpgs but a fan of World of Darkness.
So I was surprised that I really enjoyed this. Solid 8/10 game.

The music and atmosphere are 10/10. And it felt like the writing really catered to Vtmb in a good way. Like it's not a copy for example when I read D'Angelo's lines I could sort of hear Bertram Tung's style of voice like a small nod to the Nosferatu community. 

Somewhat disappointing was that all three characters were kind of the same. I was expecting that there would be at least one unique companion for every clan or special side mission - apart from the ''person of a past''. So the replayability wasn't great. 
Having played Shadows of New York now I understand why there is no extra companion but I feel like it could have been done. 

The writing was overall really solid but the ending was a bit odd. You can always expect some twist like that in the vampire political power play but as a player, I would like to get some clues along the way and not just play the whole game for this one 'Ha! Got ya!' moment.

column8: had a few more typos than I expected from such a well known series, and it was shorter than I thought it'd be, but the story was good and the multiple characters were just different enough to make all my play throughs interesting in their own ways! The fact that it's timed by the main story happening to your character while you try to gain allies was fun and less stressful than when games are usually timed, too. Worth the sale price for sure~

Well this is...  I actually rather liked it.  ^^

I especially like the soundtrack when the start Menu shows up.  It fits right in.  :D

Otherwise hmm...  Vampire stuff.  At first I couldn't really make myself read it.  After witnessing a certain part that is.

Then I decided that a good story was worth it and here were are!

Problem?  It all ends in a cliffhanger and I made sure to ask "is this where it really ends?" a few times outloud to ensure if that was really the case or not.  It was.

Even if you do all three characters (Aka ALL MC Routes)...  There is no secret ending.  D:

The creepiest guy was Kaiser...  And the most interesting one at the same time.

I think this one doesn't have a follow-up...  Not that I have found yet...  Which means that all that's in here...  That's all we get.

Too bad.  Some of these were pretty good...

Thank you and may you be on your merry way.  But before you leave...  Can you please direct me to the guy with the pipe who was one of the mysterious sires?  I have a few words to exchange with him...  Heh heh.

:D :3 =>

column8:
This is a fantastic game if you are looking to get into Vampire: the Masquerade the Masquerade. The atmosphere is immaculate and it really gets the Camarilla Fledgling experience down. Most of the characters are very memorable and the artstyle is super unique and looks incredible. The soundtrack is also amazing.

I also like that none of the endings are completely perfect. Everything comes at a cost, and even if you do succeed you may not get what you wish for. The personal horror aspect of V5 is definitely there.

Now for my critiques. The game is simply too short. I want more. The time limit is annoying, only got to finish one storyline before I was forced into the ending. 20 euros for a 4-5 hours experience is a lot of money, but if you manage to grab the game on sale it's absolutely worth the money.

column8:
[h1]Rese√±a de \Vampire: The Masquerade - Coteries of New York\[/h1]

[h2]Resumen[/h2]
¬°Bienvenidos, aspirantes a vampiros y aficionados a pasar malas noches! Hoy nos hundimos en las sombr√≠as calles de Nueva York con \Vampire: The Masquerade - Coteries of New York\. Si pensabas que lidiar con tr√°fico y peatones ya era dif√≠cil, espera a sumar vampiros y sus dram√°ticos conflictos pol√≠ticos a la mezcla.

[h2]Aspectos importantes e interesantes[/h2]
Uno de los grandes logros de este juego es su habilidad para hacerte sentir como un verdadero vampiro sin necesidad de beber sangre realmente... aunque qui√©n sabe, tal vez te anime a probarlo (¬°Bromaaa!). La historia te atrapa con sus colmillos bien hondos, ofreci√©ndote intrigas a nivel de \Game of Thrones\, pero sin dragones y con m√°s colmillos. Las elecciones que haces realmente moldean el terreno de juego, lo que le a√±ade ese saborcito a \mi destino est√° en mis manos\ que tanto nos gusta.

[h2]Aspectos por mejorar[/h2]
Mi querido equipo de vampiritos electr√≥nicos, el juego tiene un ritmo m√°s irregular que mi abuelita en la pista de baile. A veces todo va viento en popa y de reprete, pum, caes en un agujero de ritmo lento que te hace pensar si no ser√≠a mejor salir a caminar (aunque sea de noche). Adem√°s, algunos di√°logos parecen escritos por alguien que solo conoce vampiros por telenovelas turcas, necesitamos m√°s mordida y menos ch√°chara.

[/table]

[h3]¬øComprar o no comprar? Esa es la cuesti√≥n...[/h3]
Si la puntuaci√≥n total es <80 y >=50: [b]C√≥mpralo con descuento[/b] porque, aunque es m√°s inconsistente que el clima, tiene sus momentos fascinantes para los fan√°ticos del g√©nero vamp√≠rico que gusten de los dilemas morales con un toque sanguinolento. No es la joya de la corona pero con un descuentito, ¬øqui√©n se resiste a un buen mordisco?

column8:
You play a vampire that have to feed regularly on blood or the bestial nature of the vampire will take over and cause you to break the Masquerade which will lead you to get killed and a game over screen. The game‚Äôs GUI have a meter that show you have hungry the vampire is, it has cut scenes that show the vampire desperately needing blood.
BUT THE GAME DOESN‚ÄôT HAVE ANY MECHANIC TO ACTUALLY FEED.

All it has is feeding opportunities inside some, not all, but some missions. So, you just have to hope that when you start a mission it will give you a feeding opportunity, and that choosing to feed inside a mission won‚Äôt have any bad consequences for the mission. 
Because, if you‚Äôre unlucky and end up with a couple missions in a row without feeding opportunities, the game will just kill you as punishment for not feeding, which it doesn‚Äôt allow you to do in the first place.

It is mind boggling that the devs included a game mechanic that require you to feed or the game will kill you but didn‚Äôt include a corresponding mechanic to actually allow the player to do something about it and avoid dying. 
It's like making a Mario game without a jump button. Just plain stupid.

column8:
6/10
Not bad, not great.
Idk why this awesome universe never seems to get the adaptation, budget and commitment it deserves.
Only approach this if you're a Vampire: the Masquerade lore fan (or love Bloodlines) as there's something here for you, from the gothic tone, the beautiful drawings, captivating soundtrack and vampire politics. Obviously it's a visual novel which means the writing is the main reason why you're here. It's not terrible and I've enjoyed my time with it more or less. There's some characters which are memorable such as Hope and Sophie and most have really simple but great designs. The problem is that there's many plotlines that open up but that don't have time to close and strangely enough some extremely pivotal characters just disappear by the time the finale rolls in, making the ending unsatisfying at best and completely gutted at worst. Basically, the start and first half are much better than the conclusion. Too many interesting characters are just left in limbo and, while you can and have to do several playthroughs to see everything and meet everyone, I doubt the ending changes much. It's a shame as the setting and potential was there but something probably happened in development.
A nice way to get your Vampire fix but nowhere near a complete, satisfying experience.

Night 14 seems to have a notorious game-breaking bug that leaves your save hanging perpetually. I was really enjoying the story until I hit that and am not willing to spend another few hours getting back to there. The developers knew about the problem and said they were fixing it a few years ago, so my guess is they aren't coming back to it and NEITHER AM I.

Lo compr√© en pack pensando que ambos juegos estaban en espa√±ol, Resulta que el segundo no lo est√°, pero espero, que como el primero, saquen su parche a espa√±ol.

La traducci√≥n est√° lograda, salvo el fallo de g√©nero. Es un buen gui√±o para que no se use el masculino por defecto.

El gran fallo es que autom√°ticamente a la x noche de juego el final se precipite y tome un √∫nico camino sin importar las decisiones que tomaste durante el inicio e intermedio.

Es entendible que quieran hacer del juego una saga, pero no a golpe de tijera literalmente.

Estropean un gran juego que bien podr√≠a seguir valiendo el precio inicial durante m√°s tiempo si no lo hubieran decapitado.

column8:
[i]Coteries of New York[/i] is a visual novel where you navigate NYC's dark underbelly as a new vampire. You make choices affecting the story, relationships, and power dynamics, with the option to join one of three vampire clans: Brujah, Toreador, or Ventrue, each with unique traits.

The game shines with its compelling branching story and impactful choices, strong character development and relationships, and high replay value with different clans and choices. It also boasts rich lore and atmosphere of the World of Darkness. Additionally, the game features 28 achievements, encouraging exploration of different aspects, including clan-specific, story-based, and challenge achievements.

However, the gameplay is primarily story and dialogue-focused, with a pre-defined character that limits customization. There are only 3 out of 13 possible clans from the tabletop game, and the clan choice has a minor impact on gameplay.

[i]Coteries of New York[/i] is ideal for fans of visual novels and the World of Darkness setting who enjoy choice-driven narratives, but it may not satisfy those seeking traditional RPG mechanics and deep character customization. Multiple playthroughs are suggested to fully experience the game.

Coteries of New York absolutely nails the atmosphere, vibe, and tone of a VTM product. It's writing is thought provoking, mature and at times, incredibly charming. I liked doing the 'quests' for the companions, and some of the side content I did was pretty enjoyable.  

Sound design's surprisingly great (not sure if its a gold standard for VNs, not much experience in this genre so.) Soundtrack's great, main theme feels very evocative of Rik Schaffer's work with Bloodlines. 

Sadly couldn't finish the game due to a game breaking bug nearing the end (around night 14 for me.) so I have to abandon my playthrough, would advise caution on that side of things - seems to be a bug from launch that never got fixed. Would recommend the experience outside of that though, enjoyed my time with what I got to experience.

Vampire: The Masquerade - Coteries of New York ist ein textbasiertes Spiel mit Bildern, in dem man gegen seinen Willen ein Vampir geworden ist und daraus eine Story ensteht und wie man sich im weiteren Verlauf entscheidet. Nach 2,4 Stunden war es mir langweilig. Ansonsten ein sehr gutes Spiel f√ºr den, der gerne Texte liest und Entscheidungen trifft und generell Vampire mag. 

"Vampire: The Masquerade - Coteries of New York" is a text-based game with visuals where you involuntarily become a vampire and a story unfolds based on your decisions. After 2.4 hours, I found it boring. Otherwise, it's a very good game for those who enjoy reading texts, making decisions, and generally like vampires.

"Vampire: The Masquerade - Coteries of New York", kararlarƒ±nƒ±za baƒülƒ± olarak bir hikaye geli≈üen g√∂rsellerle desteklenmi≈ü bir metin tabanlƒ± oyun. ƒ∞stemediƒüiniz halde bir vampir olursunuz ve bundan sonra hikaye ≈üekillenir. 2.4 saat sonra, sƒ±kƒ±cƒ± buldum. Aksi takdirde, metinleri okumayƒ±, kararlar vermek ve genel olarak vampirleri sevenler i√ßin √ßok iyi bir oyun.

La atmosfere sono veramente fantastiche, con quegli sfondi dinamici che fanno la loro degna figura, la trama principale invece lo √® un po' meno. Sembra tutto abbastanza confusionario di primo impatto. Il fatto che non ci siano combattimenti poi, anche solo testuali, sembra un'occasione sprecata. Per concludere, una traduzione italiana realizzata malissimo, pienissima di errori elementari.

N√£o gosto de escrever analises, mas para esse jogo senti uma profunda necessidade. O inicio √© muito bom, os personagens s√£o interessantes, os gr√°ficos s√£o bonitos e chamativos (claro que para uma visual novel), efeitos sonoros e musica te deixam super imersivo, a tens√£o e suspense s√£o palp√°veis e te deixa com medo de errar nas suas escolhas. Como uma introdu√ß√£o ao universo do RPG de ‚ÄúVampiro: A M√°scara‚Äù esse jogo brilha bastante, principalmente pelas historias paralelas dos personagens secund√°rios, pois eles s√£o muito cativantes.

Entretanto, o final foi t√£o ruim, mas t√£o ruim que sinto que perdi meu tempo atoa jogando essa bomba. O final pegou tudo que constru√≠ durante a minha jornada e tacou na lixeira, simplesmente as escolhas n√£o tiveram impacto nenhum, isso para um visual novel √© p√©ssimo, afinal a √∫nica jogabilidade que temos √© fazer as escolhas, se as escolhas n√£o importam era melhor escrever um livro, assim eu n√£o teria perdido meu tempo com isso. Al√©m disso, o final joga de escanteio os personagens secund√°rios, eles viram pe√ßas completamente irrelevantes para a trama principal, trama essa que √© fraqu√≠ssima, nossa o vil√£o final chega a ser pat√©tico. Enfim, DECEP√á√ÉO √© a palavra chave para descrever esse jogo.

column8:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

Es un buen juego si te gusta WoD/MdT y Vampiro. La ambientaci√≥n y el trasfondo de los personajes de NYC sigue la historia canon y se percibe bien hilado con el manual de Nueva York Nocturno, la traducci√≥n es decente y la trama principal y secundarias son todas interesantes.
S√≠ es cierto que es un juego bastante limitado en la toma de decisiones, donde las decisiones apenas importan y apenas se abren algunas ramas hacia las que dirigir la acci√≥n, pero el juego lo salva bien a trav√©s de la idea de una Estirpe vamp√≠rica mucho m√°s poderosa que cualquier neonato con 2 semanas de no-muerte a las espaldas.

En 20 horas, deber√≠as poder ver todas las historias y detalles y, realmente, el cambio de clan del PJ jugador apenas afecta en el recorrido, por lo que puede incluso llegar a hacerse un poco repetitivo si pretendes rejugarlo m√°s de 3 o 4 veces. Pero... no son pocas veces. 

Sobre la traducci√≥n, hay algunos conceptos (g√©neros y palabras como Childe, en vez de chiquillo) que rechinan, pero ojal√° tradujesen los otros dos VTM que han sacado a continuaci√≥n.
Divertido, parece um livro. recomendo para quem gosta de ler (em ingl√™s)

column8:

La narrativa es lo principal, tiene un arte bastante bonito y la m√∫sica da una excelente ambientaci√≥n.

I was really digging this game for awhile but it just ruined itself.It's basically a choose your own adventure visual novels and it really kind of does that well. The plot is good. Writing is pretty good. It keeps you invested. The thing I liked most of all was that...I have known about VtM for decades and never really knew how it worked and what it was. And this game absolutely showed me. It frequently gave me glossary words explainging what all the terms are which is nice. Okay the bad thing about it is what I expected. I mean the fact that there are SO many fancy words for everything that you need a running flossary shows how pretentious the world is. And a real question mark is that the characters are all so unappealing. I mean vampires are supposed to be beyond human. Beyond gorgeous at times. Heightened looks and appearance. And all the character art sucks. Everyone is totally unappealing. Even your mentor who is supposed to be so goreous is...just a but off. Instead of smooth figure she is mostly angular which is weird. They reuse art assets too so you get the same look for different characters. So my previous encounter with CtM was at cons with fat nerds in costumes having live action events where they pose and talk down to each other and alk around the con trying to "eat" people that aren't playing. It's weird. The worstof it is everyone is pompous and arrogant and tries to one up each other. Basically act terrible to other pepole and you fit right in. And that's what characters in the world are like. They are highly political and try to get eachother killed or overthrow each other or whatever. And that is what you experience here in this story. YOu begin as a newly turned vampire and must make your way learning what you are, what you do, and all the poilitical machinations of the society. That's fine and fanfy and there is lots of intrigue lots of fighting lots of damage, etc. I likeld being the new kid on the block really. And I liked having a mentor. But then the end is really terrible. It ruined THE ENTIRE GAME for me. There are already twists in the game....and then the end twists the twist like an extremely bad M Night Shamalan movie. It really fails to capitalize on the character relationships too. You spend time getting to know and helping various other vampires in the world and once you do...um that's it....you don't get to spend more time with them actually liking you. And another thing that's extremely annoyinhg is that some choices aren't choices at all. You are usually choocing what you say each time. And...frequently you are choosing between saying 3 awful things which are basically the same. Sometimes it does that annoying thing where you choose an option and you go on to say something you don't even WANT to say. Like wait I didn't mean to do that! Other side quests are REALLY interesting and they just kinda die and stop. Without really doing much but talking a lot....no further development because you don't get an option. Other times it TELLS you how you are supposed to feel. LIke there was a case where there was a rogue vampire that was killing people and the game thinks I should feel sorry for her. No I didn't I was actually happy that I delivered her to the sheriff to face punishment immediately. But the game decided I had failed the quest.  LIke I said I really like the questlines and intrigue of this game....It just fails to follow through fully on those writing concepts and does its best at the end to avoid letting you like the story and characters you grow to love. Oh yeah....they OVER explain blood at every turn. I would worry that devs of the original game and even of this game are dexter like serial killers the way they go on in detail about blood in really gross ways. Summary: Let me enjoy the powers, the world, being the underdog, and especially furthering my reliationships with characters that I want to instead of just leaving everything a dangling thread or immediate end.

If you're a fan of the World of Darkness and games like The Vampire Masquerade: Bloodlines, I would recommend playing this. And I say that while being fairly certain that my choices didn't make a huge impact into how the story played out, though I could replay as the two other characters and focus on befriending other characters for variety. At the end of the day, I quite enjoy spending time in the atmosphere of the World of Darkness, the writing, the music, the images - this story delivered in that regard.

N√£o zerei o jogo pois o mesmo me fez o favor de dificultar as coisas. Por algum motivo, minha vers√£o est√° bugada e simplesmente n√£o carrega os backgrounds, deixando toda a parte visual resumida apenas as caixas de di√°logo, o HUD e aos modelos dos personagens. Tentei instalar e reinstalar, mas n√£o funcionou. Tentei verificar a integridade dos arquivos, mas tamb√©m n√£o funcionou. Muito frustrante isso, pois literalmente remove metade do que o game √© e do que se prop√µe a oferecer. N√£o sei se os desenvolvedores ainda lembram deste t√≠tulo, mas caso sim, espero que lancem uma atualiza√ß√£o que corrija logo isso.

PS: Na base da teimosia resolvi continuar e terminar a campanha. Devido ao problema mencionado, o game se resumiu a uma tela preta acompanhada de textos e ocasionalmente um personagem. Como disse, isso foi muito frustrante pois complicou a imers√£o do jogo e removeu um de seus aspectos mais importantes, pois √© algo que contribui e muito para a formula√ß√£o de sua est√©tica e de seu clima sujo e pesado. De qualquer maneira, n√£o enxergo a resolu√ß√£o disso como a salva√ß√£o de Coteries pois este √© um t√≠tulo chato, que aposta na intera√ß√£o do jogador para com a est√≥ria mas que n√£o apresenta peso nenhum sobre isso com rela√ß√£o ao que acontece. Chega um instante em que o jogo parece n√£o saber mais aonde quer chegar, e quando chega, √© de forma brusca, atropelada e sem emo√ß√£o. Enfim, gosto dos primeiros instantes e de como h√° um esfor√ßo not√°vel de se dar vida a um contexto macabro aqui, mas essas qualidades v√£o perdendo seu efeito frente a experi√™ncia enfadonha que √© este jogo.

Vampire: The Masquerade - Coteries of New York creates a great atmosphere with atmospheric images and very fitting music. The story captivated me, you get to know lots of interesting characters and make difficult decisions.

And then, after what felt like half the story, the game suddenly ends. Just like that...

Long, carefully constructed characters either just disappear from the story, or are simply killed off.
One even runs away during the showdown and jumps into the water in a bizarre, Simpson-esque manner.

And even worse, all the choices you've made simply don't matter for the ending.

[b]I can't remember the last time the ending of a game disappointed me so much.[/b]

It destroys everything it has built up beforehand and I just can't understand that.

I'm a long time VTM fan and this game is actually pretty good except for one fatal flaw, so it pains me to give it a negative review, but here it is.

This game is a visual novel based on the Vampire: the Masquerade RPG. The atmosphere is good, and although it starts out clich√©d (in fact, it's the exact same scenario as Bloodlines) and slow, it picks up with some pretty interesting characters.

The game follows a branching structure where you can choose to follow different paths at your leisure. Each path consists of multiple segments of narrative, and you can switch between the paths freely.

Unfortunately, you will not have the time to explore all of the paths as there appears to be a hidden timer and you are forced into the ending, and unfortunately, it's THE ending, not AN ending.

Therein lies the fatal flaw of this game: there is only one ending, and a really shitty one at that. First, narratively, the ending makes everything you've experienced previously to be completely irrelevant. It doesn't matter what choices you make, how you go through the different paths, what friends you make or don't make, it all ends up in the same shitty ending. Structurally, it is dumbfounding why you would make a game that has zero replayability (because there's only one predetermined ending), but don't give players enough time to explore the entire game. I can't imagine what was going on in their heads when they decided this was a good way to make a game.

Note: recommended, but only if you're interested in VTM and don't mind a shallow story.

The characters you play are bland, like stock modern characters. There could have been more illustrations of scenes and characters. Some plot points feel very similar to VTMB. The choices don't feel that impactful.

It's not all negative, though. I still liked my first run and spotting some of the differences in dialogue among characters and choices. I did expect to enjoy the game from the beginning, so there's that.

It's a decent game if you don't expect more than it can offer.

I love the Universe of Vampire the Masquerade. Because of this universe, this Game has some interesting Characters and cleverly constructed politics.
But for my taste, the story is a little bit too complicated, it doesn't help that most characters keep you in the dark completely about their plans (which is part of the Vampire The Masquerade - Thing, but I hoped you can form some kind of a true ally).
And please, tell me what you did program into this text-adventure that makes my gaming-laptop nearly melt... it SHOULD be just pictures and text, right? beautiful artwork though

The control in this game is very inconvenient. Usually in visual novels, there are default buttons for controlling the game. I mean, when you scroll up the mouse wheel, you can see old text, but here you need to open a special menu in the top-left corner. Also, to skip to the next slide, you need to click on a specific place on the screen, which is annoying as well. There are not endless save points here, only a maximum of 3.

And if you think it's not a problem then just think. It's a main part of the game where you will be the most time.
I haven't checked the plot yet. Then I'll check, I'll add the text.

This game starts off strong with an interesting and compelling story, then throws it all away with choices that dont matter and a jarring and rushed ending that feels completely out of place and still unresolved. If and ending can completely ruin a game, this is the one that managed it.

column8: Conheci o universo de Vampire: The Masquerade atrav√©s do BloodLines e me apaixonei por ele. Esse estilo, visual novel, casou muito bem que com a narrativa dos vampiros controlando a sociedade humana pelas sombras.

I love Vampire: The Masquerade and have been reading various novels and playing various games (both tabletop and PC) within this world for years now... I thought I'ld give this Visual Novel a go, and it is fun to read, and gives you some choices now and then... While nothing is voiced over, there are decent visuals now and then as well as sound effects, nothing spectacular, but at least it adds production value to what is mostly a text based experience...

The story does draw you in, and after completing one play through, I can now see that it allows for variations leading to varying outcomes... And while I applaud that, the one downside which left me a bit perplexed was how my play through ended... I had not actually played into all the various side stories in their entirety, which I suspect is intentional... Before I reached an ending that was surprising, and interesting, but did leave me with quite a few question marks above my head... While not wanting to spoil too much, my ending seemed to wrap itself up far too quickly, and was a bit confusing as it seemed to play out as though I was a unwitting pawn out to get the better of my patron, and yet at no point during my play through did I ever see anything that would lead me to suspect that or feel as though I was being used by anyone other then my patron until the surprise, yet short lived, ending I experienced... Also, I felt as though most of the side content that fills up a majority of my play through, didn't have much bearing on the ending I experienced... So, while fun and interesting to read and "play", it ended far too abruptly and tied up very few loose ends... It left me feeling like I had messed up somehow, even though I didn't feel like that during the content leading up to the end...

All in all, it has fun and interesting characters... It was fun to read and had an interesting story... Although, it was rather short, and appears that play through's are time gated (so be selective on what side content you wish to experience), I would still recommend it to folks who are into Vampire: The Masquerade content... Would I pay full price for the game? Probably not... Better to wait for it to go on sale, like I did...
column9:
I love Vampire: The Masquerade and have been reading various novels and playing various games (both tabletop and PC) within this world for years now... I thought I'ld give this Visual Novel a go, and it is fun to read, and gives you some choices now and then... While nothing is voiced over, there are decent visuals now and then as well as sound effects, nothing spectacular, but at least it adds production value to what is mostly a text based experience...

The story does draw you in, and after completing one play through, I can now see that it allows for variations leading to varying outcomes... And while I applaud that, the one downside which left me a bit perplexed was how my play through ended... I had not actually played into all the various side stories in their entirety, which I suspect is intentional... Before I reached an ending that was surprising, and interesting, but did leave me with quite a few question marks above my head... While not wanting to spoil too much, my ending seemed to wrap itself up far too quickly, and was a bit confusing as it seemed to play out as though I was a unwitting pawn out to get the better of my patron, and yet at no point during my play through did I ever see anything that would lead me to suspect that or feel as though I was being used by anyone other then my patron until the surprise, yet short lived, ending I experienced... Also, I felt as though most of the side content that fills up a majority of my play through, didn't have much bearing on the ending I experienced... So, while fun and interesting to read and "play", it ended far too abruptly and tied up very few loose ends... It left me feeling like I had messed up somehow, even though I didn't feel like that during the content leading up to the end...

All in all, it has fun and interesting characters... It was fun to read and had an interesting story... Although, it was rather short, and appears that play through's are time gated (so be selective on what side content you wish to experience), I would still recommend it to folks who are into Vampire: The Masquerade content... Would I pay full price for the game? Probably not... Better to wait for it to go on sale, like I did...

[h2]AVIS EN BREF[/h2]
Pour un jeu de type roman graphique, je trouve qu'il manque un certain nombre de choses pour en faire un "bon" jeu. Cela √©tant dit, ce n'est pas un mauvais jeu. Disons que je le trouve "bof" et pour cette raison je ne le recommande pas.

 [h2]POINTS POSITIFS [/h2]
-L'univers de Vampire : the Masquerade est respect√©.
-Les dessins, bien que peu nombreux, sont jolis.
-L'ambiance sonore est cool, mais peut mieux faire.
-Le "dictionnaire" pour avoir les d√©tails du vocabulaire sp√©cifique de cet univers.

 [h2]POINTS N√âGATIFS [/h2]
-Trop peu de choix dans nos actions/dialogues. Je n'ai pas vraiment eu l'impression que cela allait cr√©er un changement dans le cours des √©v√©nements. A c√¥t√© de √ßa, les romans papiers de type "Livre dont vous √™tes le h√©ros" sont plus mouvement√©s par rapport √† nos choix.
-Seulement 3 personnages au choix pour jouer.
-La partie gameplay n'est pas vraiment intuitive.
-Impossibilit√© de sauvegarder quand on veut : il faut arr√™ter la partie pour sauvegarder.
-C'est pauvre en dessin. Exemple : certains lieux sont montr√©s de l'ext√©rieur alors que l'histoire se d√©roule √† l'int√©rieur. Donc nous, joueur, on voit la fa√ßade d'un b√¢timent pendant tout le temps o√π l'action se d√©roule √† l'int√©rieur du b√¢timent. Pourquoi ne pas avoir dessin√© l'int√©rieur du b√¢timent dans ce cas ? Ca n'a aucun sens de nous laisser avec le visuel de l'ext√©rieur.
-Les dessins (oui, encore) manquent cruellement d'animation. Je m'explique : les personnages ont toujours la m√™me t√™te, peu importe leurs √©motions (il y aurait pu avoir un minimum d'effort et mettre 4 expressions [neutre, col√®re, tristesse, surprise] pour chaque personnage... mais non !), ils ont √©galement toujours la m√™me "pose". Je trouve √ßa assez honteux.
-Des coquilles dans les textes de la version fran√ßaise.
-Le dictionnaire n'a pas de classement par ordre alphab√©tique...

Good writing, good story.
The animations, music and sound effects are great. With all that, it doesn't feel like a visual novel. It feels much more 'alive' than that.

I've played the Vampire the Masquerade paper RPG for years, and this game is spot on. I loved my first playthrough, so much that I'm going to replay it a few times to explore everything that you can do in the game.

I've already bought Shadows of New York, and I'll buy any other new one that they make in the future. I loved every second of it.
