column8:
[b] Disclaimer: I received this game as a gift. [/b]

[h1] First Tradition: The Masquerade [/h1]
[b] Thou shall not reveal thy true nature to those not of the Blood.[/b]
[b] Doing such shall renounce thy claims of Blood.[/b]

... this VN tries to be ambitious but unfortunately fails in a few areas. I can safely say that the more you are into The World of Darkness or Vampire the Masquerade in general, the less value this VN is going to bring to you. 
I am not that deep into either, for me it was a short, (mostly) pleasant experience with an underwhelming ending and questionable narrative decisions (there's also part 2, Shadows of New York).

We can choose three characters from three different clans at the start of the game. There's the vanilla beginning with all of them, that someone sired you and you don't know who it is. From there onward you're supposed to make allies and learn the ways of the unliving. Once you get past the two possible early "game over" endings, there's just one ending no matter what you do, no matter who you recruit to your coterie (there's secondary ally quests, no matter what you do you cannot recruit all of them in a single playthrough because the game will auto trigger to the ending before you had the chance).

It's not difficult to 100% this game on achievements, doing so made me realise that the idea of "choices" or "different protags" holds little to no significance. 

As for the positives, the atmosphere overall is ensnaring, the environments/ characters really set the dark tone even though the same backgrounds/ poses are used most of the time. The characters themselves have ok progression as far as writing goes, some of them are easy to like while some of them are at least intriguing enough to leave the player asking questions. They also bothered to add a glossary of terms, in case a complete newbie picks up this game they won't be stuck asking what core terms mean (clan names, Camarilla, Elysium etc.).

I'd give this a so-and-so rating if I could, if you already have it from bundles give it a try, otherwise wait for a sale.
It also doesn't do it justice that, at the time of writing this review, VtM: Bloodlines 2 has been stuck in development hell for a while and that's what most people are waiting for.

column8:
Re-review after finishing it once, recommendation changed from "buy it!" to "buy it on sale:"

Well, the story was enjoyable and the characterization was excellent, great use of the setting, fans of Vampire: The Masquerade and newcomers alike will enjoy parts of this very much.

But I have to say, the ending was abrupt, jarringly abrupt and it felt like nothing I did in the entire story mattered at all even a little. My game lasted about 7 hours, and I'd say almost all of that was engrossing and enjoyable, but the ending has somewhat soured my perspective here. The whole thing feels rushed and unfinished if that's how it has to end.

I'm still going to cautiously recommend the game because the immersion into the setting is top notch, prior to the sudden, unexpected and - in my opinion - unsatisfying conclusion.

column8:
First- I am not a member of the VtM fanbase.
This was my first time playing any of the games in the franchise, and TBH, I only bought because I wanted something more interesting than an idle clicker while recovering from a medical condition. At the price for the New York bundle, it seemed like it would work.
It did. Enough that I am looking forward to playing through with the other 2 starting characters to see what might be different with their stories, if anything.

I played Brujah through to the end. The writing is good enough to give the characters and the overall story enough depth to have kept me engaged and interested in what came next, seeing how characters and the stories evolved and developed.

[b]Accessibility[/b]- The game can be played with one hand.  There is no voice acting- everything is delivered via text, so it is suitable for Deaf and HoH players.  The flashing lights in some scenes may be bad for people with light sensitive seizure disorders or migraines- you can disable them by making sure "Dynamic Backgrounds" is unchecked in the settings menu. For Hearing players- there are some *LOUD* and sudden sounds that emphasize things that are happening- some of those really blew my eardrums out- adjust audio settings (will take some trial and error to find the right settings for your level of tolerance).

There are politics in the game, to a degree if you are a snowflake from either side- this may be an issue for you. It may not. It's a generalized "politics" not specific to any real-world happenings going on today. There are adult situations and adult language, but the game is not an erotic VN- just one that may be a bit too violent, suggestive, or profane for younger players or those with overly "sensitive" cultural or religious backgrounds. No overly graphic artwork- but lots of F bombs and talk of some gory murdery details.

For someone more casually interested in Vampire stories and interactive fiction- yeah. Get it on sale. Not sure I'd be willing to pay full price, since I am not a "hardcore" VtM fan. But for 9.1 hours for my first playthrough- I got my money's worth, and got an enjoyable experience that wasn't physically or mentally demanding. If you are looking for high action and quick reflexes-needed: this won't be for you. If you are looking for something that you can play in short sessions (save & exit at almost any time) and finish up at your own pace- it might work for you.

(Quick edit to clean up some typos/ autocorrect weirdness.)

column8:
This is not a "game" I don't understand how crap like this can be labelled as such, this a visual novel at best, just text and slides nothing more. Yet the amount they charge for this garbage is absurd.
I got this through humble bundle and I feel ripped off, you get one choice that affects the game, continue or don't that's it, its on rails the whole damn time you have no agency, nothing you do really changes much or matters, if you care about that sorta thing.
i only played it for the 100% achievements but now i just feel embarrassed to have this tainting my library, don't waste your time on garbage like this play a real game or read a book, it would be a better use of your time.
Do Not Recommend!

column8:
Even though this is the first one, I recommend playing "Shadows of New York" first, I did this on accident, but honestly I think it makes the storytelling more suspenseful since they're now in reverse chronological order. The negative reviews that point this game's abrupt end are true, but playing them in reverse order made the ending satisfying to me because I knew what came after.

I'm enjoying this series, but they're not without their faults. I have two main gripes and they stem from the same problem: The save system. Firstly, there's no rollback feature, so if you misclick or a dialog option wasn't said how you interpreted it, you can't go back to fix it. Second, there are dead ends in this game, and if you get one it deletes your save. I'm not sure how many there are, but I only have to get one to be worried about getting another. It does add to the tension as one wrong move could mean "Permadeath", but I don't to worry about loosing my bookmark and having to reread the entire book to get back to my place. Those drawbacks aside, I am genuinely enjoying this world, the characters within it, and even the politics that shape both.

I'm not a huge visual novel head by any means, but I love World of Darkness stuff. This is pretty solid, ESP. if you can pick it up at a sale price point. Interesting characters and story helps keep you immersed in the WoD and the narrative. It took me roughly 7 hours in total to experience my first playthrough then subsequent ones to try and delve the other dialog paths.

Sadly can't experience the new one, Shadows of New York, as it's still a buggy mess to this day and refuses to launch.

$2 for this on sale is an absolute steal, and if you're fortunate enough to be able to experience the follow-up VN, $3.08 as a bundle pricing is fair.

I highly recommend this if you're a WoD fan.

:copium: Bloodlines 2 gets finished.

column8:
I love Vampire the Masquerade stories. It has such a charm. And this game gets it right. The art, the text and also the sounds are on point. 

Illustrations are really good, although it‚Äôs few and reuses too much the images. Text is good, mature and feels like the experience of the pen and paper books. Sounds are simple but get the job done.

You can see it‚Äôs a simple project, but they‚Äôve managed to do more with less. It is worth it, specially for the story, although I feel like it would be better as a book.

Also, people complain about the ending. What do people really want? Save the world bu11shit? C'mon! Of course is not brilliant due to some clich√©s, but it way more close to what I want in a vampire story than other things out there that are praised for having good stories.

column8: Wonderful !

As a past fan of Vampire The Masquerade and having played titles such as Redemption and Bloodlines, I tried this game out of curiosity and it did not disappoint.
It is an interactive story, where the choices made take their toll, making the plot increasingly interesting.
I waited for the translation into my native language before playing it fully, and a good job was done about that.
If you like vampires and are a fan of Vampire The Masquerade, you might like this game, maybe give it a chance when you find it on sale if you find the full price too much.

column8:
When i was about half trough the game,i actually thought i would leave a positive review for it here later.
But the ending was just the most unsatisfying thing ever and as it turns out,my choices mean next to nothing.
Its more of a,,which train do you want to take to this ONE station?''kind of thing
And let me tell you this: I didnt like this station,at all.
It feels so rushed and out of place that i couldnt even comprehend what actually happened back then.

Its not just about the ending though.
When you eventually get your 2 comrades,they show up once to help you out,and then they arent relevant to the rest of the story at all.
Or what about loose ends?
There was this mission involving a priest and another dude...long story short,that,,other dude''was supposed to get punished/killed/whatever later,since i ratted him out.
But nothing ever came of it.
The,,hunger''?
Ez,never had any trouble with it and i was letting pass by quite a few opportunities to feed.

The first half was still great,but thats because i thought that all of the choices i made along the way,would actually turn into something later,which wasnt the case.
And the ending was the last straw,it felt like no matter what im doing,im destinied to,,lose''.
I know there is a sequel,but since my brujah boy isnt playable and its genderlocked to a female,i wont bother playing it.
Yea,hate me for it.

column8: O jogo tem uma hist√≥ria fascinante dentro do universo de VTM, a lore √© riqu√≠ssima e a experi√™ncia √© √∫nica.

Overall, it is an engaging visual novel with great visuals and atmosphere. The characters are interesting and exploration of their stories (or rather quests) is fun. I have the only problem with this game: the ending. It was so anticlimatic and there is supposed to be only one main ending, without variation based on your choices, which is pretty much a lost potential. I still recommend the game - in this case, the journey is more important than the destination I think. Especially if you're planning on to play the Shadows of New York too, which is supposed to have some characters from Coteries.

column8: Overall the experience of Coteries of New York, is an interesting VTM visual novel game.  Like many however I find the ending somewhat cheap and undermining the over all quality of the game due to the dissonance of the way it makes it seem like choices and which stories lines you follow/complete/partially complete should matter to how the final act plays out, which it turns out it doesn't.  VTM doesn't need to have happy endings per se, and is often a setting where there isn't a right choice, but if the game was going to have a singular ending that doesn't have true variations it would be a much more satisfying experience to not put an artificial timer on the number of days and let you play out all the side stories.  The most enjoyable ending though would have been the one where there were multiple variations on the final act, and in true VTM fashion even if your fledgling did accidentally mess up the grand scheme at play the alternative would be full of its own pit falls.

column8:
Echoing the other reviewers, this recommendation is a "yes, but..." deal. In short: I enjoyed it and don't consider the money ill spent, but I did get this & the sequel bundle for less than 6 euros, so the bar is low. Yay for the holiday sales. 

Yes:
+ The atmosphere kicks ass. The art is absolutely beautiful and the music adds to it.
+ While it throws all kinds of Vampire: The Masquerade terminology at you, it also explains the words well enough. I am not previously familiar with the game system, so I really needed the extra information, even if constantly checking every new term was a little bit disruptive to enjoying the story itself.
+ The world building of this game system is, as it says in the product description, genuinely rich, and the VN conveys is well enough.
+ The game does a good job of delivering the severity of the small scale daily decision of feeding vs. not feeding. I felt like I had to think when to do it, because often... it was an unnecessary risk. But at the same time: a necessary one. Mechanically, the hunger is truly interesting to deal with.
+ All the characters differ from each other and I genuinely liked my chosen coterie even though initially, I wasn't excited about any of the options.
+ The story got potential.

But:
- The big one: lack of player agency. There's barely an illusion of choice at best, and although you can somewhat choose how you do things, I don't think your decisions have any kind of true impact. From what I gather, even if you completely mess up making allies, you're still going to end up just fine.
- Relating to the first, I wanted to learn more of some things I never had a chance to learn more about. For example, the sire of the main character or the aspect of having human retainers / ghouls. (Why couldn't I have those?)
- The other big one: story phasing issues. When it gets rolling, it really steamrolls.

Also: 
- This is just a personal, silly note, but I would've liked to flirt with some characters, dammit. Vampires are inherently erotic creatures, after all... Nothing wrong with not dipping into dating sim, but hot damn I'd really have liked to sink my fangs into somebody and savor the moment for once. The entire process was reduced to some dirty quickies with random bums or granny dog-walkers in filthy alleys and public parks throughout the entire VN.

column8:
It's good. It's not perfect and there are definitely problems. but it's good enough to invest the hours into it. I was lucky to get in on sale for $3, and I feel like I got a great deal. The best parts were assembling your coterie, and the individual stories along the way. If you enjoy character stories, I think you would really enjoy this game. For me, as much as I enjoyed Hope's introduction and Tamika's character arc, I think the thing that really gripped me was Benoit. I would play an entire game about that Toreador, I think he's the best character in the story. 

However, this VtM game (like most VtM games with a couple exceptions) has the curse of inauthentic dialogue and forced badassery. Nothing like a few lines of 'heh nothing personnel kid i can kick your ass with a wet fish and a spindle' to take you out of the moment with an eyeroll. I thought the player character dialogue was fitting and well done (played as Ventrue), but a lot of the NPC script needed a little tweak. The Baron was probably the worst part of the game. Not for the fact that he was a bad dude, but because since he was only on screen for like 10 minutes the writers needed to make the players know he was a villain and resorted to SUDDEN AND INTENSE MISOGYNY. It was just very lazy. 

The ending disappointed me. Granted, this game is designed for multiple playthroughs and I will be doing those in the future... But there was all this hype RIGHT up until that final twist... And then it just deflated like a wet fart. It didn't offend me, but it made me shrug. I also think there were some inconsistencies with the more 'human-esque' capabilities of Kindred, but there's never been a definitive guide on them so it's up to interpretation.

In short, play this game for the journey and not the destination. Explore your options while you have them, pursue the individual stories, and it'll be well worth your time. Not sure if I would intro any VtM newbies to the franchise with this thing, but for long-time fans it's definitely a must play.

It not so easy to judge this VN (it‚Äôs not an erotic VN), because some things are very good and some are below medium.
Best thing is the atmosphere of the game, it totally got me. The story is exciting except for the weak end. The drawn graphics are good, but too often reused in the game.
At start you can choose between 3 different starting characters, but there is only 1 end (beside from dying early) . Normally it‚Äôs the opposite, you have 1 char and multiple endings. I made my first way to the end in 5h.
Most choices in the game don‚Äôt matter. 
You don‚Äôt have the time to do all side quests in 1 playthrough and you can‚Äôt save the game (only make a break). With this and with achievements the devs try to lure you into complete replays. Replaying the weak end three times isn't such fun.

Over all it‚Äôs a good game, buy it on a sale if you like vampire stories.

column8:
If you are really itching for a vampire visual novel game, I guess you can play this. But while the set up is interesting, nothing you do in the game really has any consequence to the overarching plot. Building your coterie is the main activity of the game and in the end it means absoluetly nothing. You cant even do every quest in a single run since the main story quests are limited and happen at set points in time.
The main plot itself also evolves way to quickly and at the end things come out of nowhere and basically just happen with no real resolution either. This game would have worked better as a novel without the illusion of reader/player agency.

Coteries of New York is probably the most suitable entry if you're new to VTM, as a person who played it as the first-ever entry to the franchise. It did well building the world, although there are some expositions dumps through the dictionary. But It is solely great for presenting the world itself, the corruption, politics, and society of the secret vampire world.

The only problem I have with this is just the ending, It's just horrendously rushed. I'm even shocked at the end like "what the hell ?".

It's an easy 7/10 for me, minus the end and no rollback feature, so good luck pressing ctrl if you missclicked a choice.

column8:
Take a while to read this visual game-novel, it's a great introduction to the story that unfolds in Shadows of New York, that you definitely should not miss. 

One might take it as a prelude of sorts, because of its focus on someone who is just getting to grips with their unlife into which they were plunged only recently and with no babysitting involved. It has a great, dark atmosphere that conveys the unforgiving nature of the World of Darkness and Vampire the Masqurade settings and involves some thrilling plot twists. It is worth experiencing.

column8: Á°ÆÂÆûÊòØÂæàÊñ∞Â•áÁöÑ‰∏ñÁïåËßÇÂèä‰∫∫Áâ©ËÆæÂÆöÔºå‰∏çÊÄé‰πàÂÖ≥Ê≥®Âê∏Ë°ÄÈ¨ºÈ¢òÊùêÁöÑ‰ΩúÂìÅÔºå‰ΩÜËØ•‰ΩúÁ°ÆÂÆûÁªô‰∫ÜÊàëËÄ≥ÁõÆ‰∏ÄÊñ∞ÁöÑÊÑüËßâÔºåÊé®ËçêË¥≠‰π∞„ÄÇ

To have a story driven game where your dialogue options never fully express what you are actually choosing and at the same time to not give the player a save / load system on demand is a quick way for a disaster.

Numerous times I have selected dialogue options only for the character to add context to the line, a context that I absolutely didn't want and wasn't expecting. At one time, this effect was so bad that the character actually did exactly the opposite of what I wanted him to do, leaving me dumbstruck. I have no desire to continue my story and suffering the consequences of not my choosing.

column8: Gioco fighissimo!!

It's an alright VNs if you're looking to get introduced to the Masquerade series and learn about the different vampire clans and experience what makes them so different from one another. Keep in mind, you'll be spending the majority of the time with these clans you selected to spend the night with, which was nice for the game to allow players to choose which story they would like to follow. However, Sophie's 'big' plan to utilise these clans isn't worth it and falls flat toward the end of the game, finishing too quickly before we get started. Plus, the clans you finish the story on and 1 of the 3 characters you selected and started playing don't appear to change the overall story, which was quite another disappointment. 

Even with this criticism, the visual Coteries of New York save it to the atmosphere being ominous, creative and district. Also, may I say attractive character design I could just stare at for a minute, and a mysterious feeling which all helped set mood vibe I never felt for other games before.

At the end of my first playthrough, I manage to finish the story of Gianni D'Angelo, (Nosferatu Clan), Tamika, (Gangrel Clan), and Hope (Malkavian clan), and I was really happy and intrigued with the way their story ended, much better than the main story. They're all well-written and pretty fascinating in their own ways, also, there are plenty more characters to explore the story of, so at least this game is replayable in that aspect. For that, I recommend this game if you want to get familiar with the Masquerade series itself, which I could only thank this game for at the end of the day.

column9:
It's an alright VNs if you're looking to get introduced to the Masquerade series and learn about the different vampire clans and experience what makes them so different from one another. Keep in mind, you'll be spending the majority of the time with these clans you selected to spend the night with, which was nice for the game to allow players to choose which story they would like to follow. However, Sophie's 'big' plan to utilise these clans isn't worth it and falls flat toward the end of the game, finishing too quickly before we get started. Plus, the clans you finish the story on and 1 of the 3 characters you selected and started playing don't appear to change the overall story, which was quite another disappointment. 

Even with this criticism, the visual Coteries of New York save it to the atmosphere being ominous, creative and district. Also, may I say attractive character design I could just stare at for a minute, and a mysterious feeling which all helped set mood vibe I never felt for other games before.

At the end of my first playthrough, I manage to finish the story of Gianni D'Angelo, (Nosferatu Clan), Tamika, (Gangrel Clan), and Hope (Malkavian clan), and I was really happy and intrigued with the way their story ended, much better than the main story. They're all well-written and pretty fascinating in their own ways, also, there are plenty more characters to explore the story of, so at least this game is replayable in that aspect. For that, I recommend this game if you want to get familiar with the Masquerade series itself, which I could only thank this game for at the end of the day.

column8:
6/10. Slight spoilers:

One of the core decorations of VtM‚Äôs setting has always been its web of connections. Those who try to stay free, independent, and even somewhat decent, get tricked, abused, exploited, and ultimately discarded, too naive to find required strength and support to stay afloat. On the other hand, those who are either pragmatic or ambitious, turn corrupt with time, no matter their original intentions. They become manipulative, power-hungry, and fake, always having a reason justifying the next line they step over.

The Coteries of New York plays with this idea, and turns it into the foundation of its plot. You‚Äôre used by many players, slowly unraveling your true purpose, and oftentimes believing you‚Äôre approaching victory - or at least, that you‚Äôre on the winning side. You seek connections, solve quests that seem to have more than one level of success (making you wonder if you missed anything, or if your partial success will hinder your further story), regret actions that seem to pull you away from a group that seems to be especially tempting for your character. 

And then, the game pulls the rug out from under you - not only you‚Äôve been played from the beginning, even the characters that seem to be invulnerable turn out to be but pawns in hands of powers you know hardly anything about. Many people mention the ending - and there‚Äôs only one real ending - feels random, undeserved, and underdeveloped, but I must admit that if there‚Äôs one RPG setting that‚Äôd perfect at telling a story about the illusion of agency and being locked in a cage of powerful organizations, it‚Äôs World of Darkness. Though it‚Äôs likely not something many people seek in games, and I wouldn‚Äôt blame anyone for calling such Visual Novel trash.

Simultaneously, the developers clearly struggled with deadlines and the budget. The ‚Äúrecruit your RPG crew‚Äù leads nowhere, the blood/hunger systems are at one point seemingly abandoned, some of the introduced characters feel detached and seem to have little to no purpose. While some scenes are creative, well-paced, and purposeful, others are terribly written, rather telling than showing, and filled with recycled sprites and backgrounds, clearly squeezed in to pad the runtime. I‚Äôd be surprised if it wasn‚Äôt the case that the developers were tasked, maybe even by their own ambition, to make a deep, powerful story introducing the player into the basics of VtM, but they simply ran out of the resources and had to throw some things together at the end to ship anything at all. 

One of the most consuming expenses were, likely, the three characters you can select as your protagonist. They have their own introductory scenes and graphics, and are sometimes mentioned in the game, but AFAIK they have almost no relevance for the story, and were likely abandoned midway-through after they had become a gigantic money sink. If there was only one, but improved, character, the rest of the game would likely receive more polishing as well.

In many ways, The Coteries are a failure, but if you‚Äôre willing to take it as it is, instead of what it clearly hoped to become, there‚Äôs some enjoyment to get from it. One side note - Coteries spend a lot of their time explaining the basics of their world, and if you‚Äôre already familiar with it, I think you can skip the game entirely.

column8:
The game is pretty interesting of you like visual novels with an element of choose your own adventure. The art is great and the subtle music adds to the atmosphere.

On a technical note. I had played for several hours with the black background that many people have complained about. I contacted the developers who never responded. My TV died and after getting a new one I decided to try the game again and the background art was now visible. So it must have been something to do with either my old TV or the HDMI cable I was using as I upgraded to a HDMI 2.1 cable for the new TV.

column8: I like this visual novel. Got it when it was on sale for about $5 or so, and I'm very happy with it. I'll get others in this genre and probably from this company too (I recall they have other stories in the Vampire theme) when I get through this one. I love some of the characters and I think the design includes a nice array of personalities. I didn't know what I was getting myself into with visual novels and interactive novels. The intro video and images are a good taste of what's in here. Oh and I love the red colour scheme of course, and the glowy and not-too-dark graphic style.

column8: Not thrilled with my ending, but... what did I really expect? This *IS* Vampire: the Masquerade after all. If you're a fan of the TTRPG, regardless of edition, this story is fantastic. If you aren't familiar with the TTRPG at all, it's still a good game and if you enjoyed it, you should check outthe TTRPG too!

column8:
I played Night Road and Out for Blood. I enjoyed both, felt like I had a number of options and my choices did affect the story. Got me in the mood for more Vampire the Masquerade, so played this. I wish I hadn't.

The game looks much nicer and I like the art. But, turns out the 'mechanics' of the game aren't...really there at all. And story wise, while I did like some of the characters, especially the Coetrie quest ones, there is no resolution and nothing you do makes any difference on the ending. The ending is abrupt, leaves far, far, FAR too many things unresolved, your Coetrie choices are pointless, and was overall thoroughly unsatisfying. Another review I read said if this happened at a gaming table, they would have left and never played again. I 100% agree. The ending ruined any positive feelings I had for this game.

Go into this with the perspective that it's not a game, you have no real choice, and maybe it will work as a novel. 
Or accept the idea that you lost the entire game by playing in the first place. 

I would recommend Night Road or Out for Blood. Going to check out some of the other games, after a break, as this game almost put the Final Death on my interest in Vampire.

S√≥ vale a pena se voc√™ t√° sangrando de vontade de jogar Vampiro: A M√°scara e n√£o t√° conseguindo.

Bom, entrando em detalhes, at√© que √© divertido por um lado. Al√©m de apresentar uma est√©tica interessante e uma narra√ß√£o imersiva fiel ao punk-g√≥tico (que ali√°s √© muito boa), o jogo mostra uma trama bem decente, pois captura o esp√≠rito do rpg: trai√ß√µes, compl√¥s, territorialismo, horror pessoal e situa√ß√µes sociais tensas s√£o pontos bem aproveitados. Contudo, realmente √© s√≥ isso que √© bom no jogo, sendo que voc√™ s√≥ vai aproveitar esses fatores bem o suficiente para valer a pena comprar se voc√™ tem interesse no universo do principal rpg do Mundo das Trevas, assumindo que voc√™ nunca o jogou antes. 

Continuando, o jogo tem mais pontos ruins do que bons. √â extremamente f√°cil, apresenta uma variedade de escolhas e consequ√™ncias rid√≠cula de estreita e gerencia o sistema de fome e disciplinas muito mal. Disciplinas s√£o os poderes sobrenaturais dos vampiros, e √© muito frequente que voc√™ seja obrigado a, basicamente, adivinhar como as disciplinas v√£o funcionar, pois h√° muita pouca informa√ß√£o pra tentar deduzir o que exatamente pode acontecer quando a disciplina X √© usada na situa√ß√£o Y, levando voc√™ a ficar bem puto ap√≥s ler um di√°logo ruim depois de fazer uma escolha que parecia razo√°vel. Isso tamb√©m ocorre com algumas outras escolhas que n√£o envolvem as disciplinas. Em alguns casos tal din√¢mica √© interessante, por dar um certo risco √†s escolhas, mas, outra vez, o jogo √© muito f√°cil e tem pouca variedade de escolhas; ele tende a n√£o te punir t√£o severamente por cometer erros e muitas vezes diferentes escolhas levam ao mesmo destino. O jogo d√° tr√™s possibilidades de personagens diferentes para uma jogatina, mas eu n√£o fiquei com vontade de rejog√°-lo, mesmo que a hist√≥ria seja medianamente diferente para cada um, pois o mundo e as quests ainda s√£o os mesmos e a variedade das disciplinas n√£o deve gerar muitas mudan√ßas por causa disso. [spoiler] Pra fechar com chave de cu, o final √© uma bela duma bosta, pois termina o jogo muito abruptamente sem encerrar propriamente a narrativa, com uma explica√ß√£o bem ruim. O fato de que o jogo aparenta ter mais de um final complexo s√≥ piora isso: ou voc√™ chega nesse final decepcionante, ou voc√™ simplesmente morre no come√ßo. [/spoiler]

Por fim, retomo o que eu disse antes: n√£o recomendo o jogo, a menos que voc√™ se enquadre na situa√ß√£o citada.

column8:
O j√°-dito primeiro: O sistema de save do jogo √© tenebroso e o final √© absurdamente insatisfat√≥rio.

√â bem interessante observar as pequenas mudan√ßas na hist√≥ria quando se est√° com um cl√£ diferente, apesar do rumo da hist√≥ria e o final (ruim, ressalto) serem iguais. Traz um tom diferente do sucessor - Shadows of New York - mas ao mesmo tempo √© percept√≠vel que essa flexibilidade √© a causa do final ruim. O trabalho absurdo que seria fazer 3 trilhas principais, uma pra cada personagem, √© √≥bvio, ent√£o foi feito um final gen√©rico, sem sal, fora de tom e fora de ritmo para todos. Ruim no geral.

Mas o estilo de arte, a ambienta√ß√£o e trilha sonora compensam, s√£o absurdamente bem feitos, uma √≥tima fonte de inspira√ß√£o para GMs do RPG de mesa. Personagens s√£o bons e cativam tamb√©m, o que torna as sidequests bem interessantes e o ponto alto da hist√≥ria em geral.

Jogue com a no√ß√£o de que o final √© insatisfat√≥rio, mas o seu sucessor faz um trabalho melhor nesse sentido. Em suma, a hist√≥ria principal √© um bom estudo do que N√ÉO FAZER em um jogo history-driven, mas recomendo ainda sim pelos outros aspectos do jogo.

I've only played around 2 hours but it's a not recommended. The save system is bullshit, i'am not a kid anymore. Don't do that again please.

(save system: you can only save and quit and if final death, it delets your save, so yeah have to click throught the entire game again and no way to "explore a little bit" the different paths)

I sometimes like to play the game like that, i sometimes like to explore a bit, i definitly hate when some control freak tell me how i have to play a game, as i said before, i am not a kid anymore.


edit: finished the game, story is ok but 90% of the time, your choice doesn't matter at all (hence the save system i think), no real branching and (spoiler) there is no good ending, so yeah :/ no choice and mandatory bad ending.

column8:
Hmmm. This is a "thumbs up" with a few caveats. I'll start with the things I didn't like:

1. The game took 5 hours to beat. For the level of plot it is trying to emulate, it needed to be double that time. The climactic moments seem too sudden, like you've been a vampire a week and suddenly you're at the final scene involved with power-players. 

2. There's not enough choice. There's dialogue choices and yes you can decide who to add to your coterie, but it still feels very rigid. 

3. Not enough clues, not enough politicking, not enough social maneuvering as one does in the tabletop games. Like, one minute you're [spoiler]threatening a reporter for the Kindred who is using you as a pawn[/spoiler] and the next minute [spoiler]you're meeting the bosses of the Anarch Movement[/spoiler] and then five minutes later [spoiler]the Anarch Baron has the Second Inquisition raiding your haven[/spoiler]. I'm sorry, what? No lead up to any of this. 

4. Building off point (3), the majority of the game is gathering your coterie, who wind up having nothing to do with the events of the game [spoiler]other than showing up briefly for three seconds before you rush off to the climax of the game[/spoiler]. You do all these cool quests building your Coterie, which is in the name of the game, for them to amount to a footnote in the game. 

5. Your Clan means nothing in this game other than what Disciplines you have. I didn't feel like I was playing a Brujah. I felt like I was playing a Ventrue who had Brujah powers. Woulda been dope if me and my Coterie had the option of actually joining the Aanrchs. As. They. Should.

Okay, so why the "thumbs up with caveats" if I didn't like these pretty major criticisms? Well... I still had fun for those 5 hours of game time. That's why we game, right? It's still a nice primer for Vampire the Masquerade, and maybe it will lead to more people playing the tabletop role-playing game (recommended), as it explains many of the themes of that game. I've been playing the TTRPG since it first came out, loving every incarnation of it (even the nWoD a lot of other people hated), and if I was going to start a Chronicle (for those people who are familiar with D&D, "Chronicle" is what you call campaigns in the World of Darkness) I'd show new players this game. All that was missing was the Sabbat (likely addressed in the sequel game, Shadows of New York...?).

So yes, the game has problems. But I still had fun for two evenings. Would I replay it as the other two Clans? I dunno. Maybe at a later date. It was fun, but not that fun, and definitely not nuanced enough where I wanted to see different outcomes to the game.

TL;DR: Game has some pacing and plot issues, but if you can get it for $3 it's a fun entry point into the World of Darkness, or a fun way for a veteran gamer to revisit the setting for a night.
column9:
Hmmm. This is a "thumbs up" with a few caveats. I'll start with the things I didn't like:

1. The game took 5 hours to beat. For the level of plot it is trying to emulate, it needed to be double that time. The climactic moments seem too sudden, like you've been a vampire a week and suddenly you're at the final scene involved with power-players. 

2. There's not enough choice. There's dialogue choices and yes you can decide who to add to your coterie, but it still feels very rigid. 

3. Not enough clues, not enough politicking, not enough social maneuvering as one does in the tabletop games. Like, one minute you're [spoiler]threatening a reporter for the Kindred who is using you as a pawn[/spoiler] and the next minute [spoiler]you're meeting the bosses of the Anarch Movement[/spoiler] and then five minutes later [spoiler]the Anarch Baron has the Second Inquisition raiding your haven[/spoiler]. I'm sorry, what? No lead up to any of this. 

4. Building off point (3), the majority of the game is gathering your coterie, who wind up having nothing to do with the events of the game [spoiler]other than showing up briefly for three seconds before you rush off to the climax of the game[/spoiler]. You do all these cool quests building your Coterie, which is in the name of the game, for them to amount to a footnote in the game. 

5. Your Clan means nothing in this game other than what Disciplines you have. I didn't feel like I was playing a Brujah. I felt like I was playing a Ventrue who had Brujah powers. Woulda been dope if me and my Coterie had the option of actually joining the Aanrchs. As. They. Should.

Okay, so why the "thumbs up with caveats" if I didn't like these pretty major criticisms? Well... I still had fun for those 5 hours of game time. That's why we game, right? It's still a nice primer for Vampire the Masquerade, and maybe it will lead to more people playing the tabletop role-playing game (recommended), as it explains many of the themes of that game. I've been playing the TTRPG since it first came out, loving every incarnation of it (even the nWoD a lot of other people hated), and if I was going to start a Chronicle (for those people who are familiar with D&D, "Chronicle" is what you call campaigns in the World of Darkness) I'd show new players this game. All that was missing was the Sabbat (likely addressed in the sequel game, Shadows of New York...?).

So yes, the game has problems. But I still had fun for two evenings. Would I replay it as the other two Clans? I dunno. Maybe at a later date. It was fun, but not that fun, and definitely not nuanced enough where I wanted to see different outcomes to the game.

TL;DR: Game has some pacing and plot issues, but if you can get it for $3 it's a fun entry point into the World of Darkness, or a fun way for a veteran gamer to revisit the setting for a night.

column8:
Writing style is nice, there are cool ideas in there (mostly around Hope) but the plot really isn't one of them. The atmosphere works and may be good to get a beginner into the WoD. But "playing" is somewhat painful. Decisions don't matter. The player has no significant agency. Even on the first playthrough i saw many troubles way in advance and was left with 3 choices how to fall victim to them anyway, shouting at my screen "why is there not option 4???" This is especially true for the use of disciplines. I thought multiple times "oh, i could use celerity/presence here... but there's no option for it." It's an annoying way of play to lose. For a novel, this may be ok, but If this game was my DM, I'd leave the table. Coming from Parliament of Knives I ask myself, why Coteries of New York is "interactive".
The ending took the cake, featuring a hefty discipline-plothole and a really lame plot twist (no spoilers here).

column8: This was my first time trying a video novel which took commitment getting past the corny nature of this style of game, but was well rewarded. The art and atmosphere is perfect for this vampire world and scratched an itch that Bloodlines 2 left behind. The first run through was good, the second is GREAT especially in seeing how the creators foreshadowed the climax throughout the entirety of the story. Goes to show that it doesn't take fancy rendering and graphic splashes to make a good game. Loved all the characters and the interactions and am looking forward to try the other games out too.

column8:
It was fairly interesting for a neophyte, great ambiance but it had no story. I felt railroaded and with no agency.
The whole reason we exist doesn't even make sense as you reach the conclusion.

It could've been a positive review but the story, which I consider the primordial element of a VN, was both nonsensical and didn't matter in the end. I feel bad for the other aspects that were well done but sabotaged due to that.

Strangely it made me want to play an actual Noire detective vampire story.

In many ways an above average visual novel on account of the writing, and for a VtM fan it hits all the right notes. Stops abruptly though, and doesn't really make you feel like you've had any say in the ending. It would have been good to have been more aware about the limit of evenings that you have. You can't complete all quests, for instance. A good story and solid design, but again, the ending is unsatisfying and your choices never amount to much in the end. This needs more than one ending and some kind of resolution. This is a story with only half of a third act. Baffling. Because of all this there is not really any replay value, and personally I don't feel like trying to play from the other two clans. Not a lot of point in trying to get the other achievments if you end up with the same ending. It's almost a great game, I enjoyed it up until the end. I want to give it a thumbs up but flaws are too great (although far fewer than the merits.) Many people gave it thumbs up, so let this review help you see if you'd be in the minority like I am.

No esperaba que me gustase este tipo de juegos, siendo solamente de leer y eso, pero me a encantado. La historia, los personajes, la ambientaci√≥n, etc... est√° realmente entretenido. 10/10

The story and art is good but mechanics are simply awful. No saves, only skip all, short variants of choices. I think that people really wanted to tell the story and just used what was easier to do not really understanding how visual novels work.

Start is good, art is decent, everything else is subpar. Your choices don't matter - even if inside the scene you will pick every single "compliant" choice, story will still treat you as if you were unruly. Feeding mechanic forces you to choose the feed dialogue options during the quests to not lose the game. Choice of the backstory does't matter. The whole plot can be summarised by a single line and the greatest intrigue is that (spoiler) prince and head anarch are allies. 

Just... don't play it.

O REAL problema do jogo √© sua mec√¢nica principal: os textos. Voc√™ √© obrigado a clicar, bal√£o por bal√£o, todas as falas que voc√™ j√° leu em gameplays anteriores. N√£o existe sistema de salvamento. Clicou errado? J√° era. A jogabilidade √© lenta e isso √© completamente proposital por parte dos desenvolvedores. 

Eu recomendo esse jogo somente para quem n√£o est√° familiarizado com o universo de Vampiro e tamb√©m para pessoas que desejam se "apropriar" de alguns personagens pra enriquecer as pr√≥prias campanhas de RPG. Fora isso, n√£o compensa jogar mais de uma vez. Talvez numa promo√ß√£o de 80% de desconto esse jogo vale a pena ser comprado.

O jogo √© muito bom. A hist√≥ria √© bem constru√≠da, a ambienta√ß√£o √© perfeita e os personagens s√£o bastante carism√°ticos. √â bem triste quando acaba, pois voc√™ fica com um gostinho de quero mais. Gostaria apenas que alguns personagens tivessem mais tempo de tela. Entendo que escolhas precisam serem feitas, afinal, n√£o tem como ficarmos cinco horas viajando na hist√≥ria de um √∫nico personagem. Mas, olha, eu bem que queria. Trabalho muito bem feito. Ah, n√£o posso me esquecer de dizer que a trilha sonora e as imagens s√£o soberbas.

column8:
Coteries of New York is remarkably sophisticated both in language as well as art style. Whenever I read through it, I feel enraptured by its artistic beauty and elegance. This effect is magnified by juxtaposing the fair and alluring to things grim and cynical. Fittingly, a perfect embodiment of such qualities is the enigmatic character of Sophie Langley.

Though the story in this game revolves around one character and another in its sequel, Shadows of New York, there is a different, overarching story. For that reason, only playing both Coteries and Shadows of New York makes for holistic experience. Only then is it possible to fully  appreciate this game.

column8: Sehr gute, durchdachte und immersive Storyline mit einzigartigen Charakteren (Stichwort Hard Boiled Nosferatu). Klare Kaufempfehlung f√ºr Fans von (d√ºsteren) interaktiven Text-Novels.

Mai stato fan dei succhia sangue, semplicemente preferisco altre creature del Monsterverse. Semplice. Ma non come spesso capita, mi sbaglio e di tanto.
Non conoscevo l'universo di Vampire the Masquerade e devo dire che tramite Coteries Of New York (CNY per semplicit√†) √® stata un'introduzione davvero interessante e anche spassosa. Con dei limiti ma andiamo con calma.
CNY √® una visual novel, o un libro game semplificato se preferite, tutto il gameplay si basa su delle scelte che possiamo fare a livello testuale e finita l√¨, se venite dai giochi Telltate saprete benissimo la sensazione che si ha dell'unico finale, nonostante le innumerevoli scelte compiute. Il finale √® sempre lo stesso e morire/fallire √® quasi impossibile. L'unico vero malus √® perdere la possibilit√† di reclutare i compagni, ma perso uno ci sono gli altri. Detto questo la storia √® bella e richiama alla perfezione le atmosfere e i temi dell‚Äôambientazione di Vampire, le immagini che accompagnano la nostra avventura sono suggestive allo stesso modo; per chi non conoscesse i termini vampireschi utilizzati c'√® pure un utile dizionario(semplice e chiaro nelle spiegazioni, meraviglioso). Si possono scegliere tre personaggi diversi e ognuno di essi ha delle brevi sezioni di storia uniche. La traduzione italiana non √® malaccio considerando che il testo inglese non √® facilissimo, ma ci sono degli errori abbastanza marchiani ma nulla che qualche patch correttiva non possa risolverlo ancora risolverlo.
P.s se cercate un gioco con i vampiri qui non lo trovate, se cercate una visual novel con i succhiasangue siete i benvenuti. Se proprio siete indecisi, aspettate i saldi.
P.s.s √® uscito anche un seguito Shadows of New York

[h1] RESUMO: [/h1] 

Um rec√©m-criado vampiro, completamente ignorante neste novo mundo, tem que sobreviver na cidade de Nova Iorque enquanto os vampiros mais velhos disputam por poder, riqueza e territ√≥rios.

[h1] GR√ÅFICOS/EST√âTICA: [/h1] 

√â um pouco dif√≠cil avaliar os gr√°ficos do jogo, porque no geral n√£o existe movimenta√ß√£o da c√¢mera, simplesmente √© uma cena fixa com pouco ou nenhum movimento. Muitos jogadores poder√£o achar negativo, mas a meu ver, n√£o h√° muito a fazer neste tipo de situa√ß√£o. √â uma Visual Novel e muito dificilmente se pode exigir muito, mas de certa forma, todas as cenas que nos s√£o apresentadas, apesar da falta de movimento, s√£o muito bonitas e super preenchidas a n√≠vel de detalhes e cor.

[h1] GAMEPLAY: [/h1] 

A gameplay √© bastante simples e de certa forma n√£o √© algo muito presente no jogo. O jogador tem que entender a hist√≥ria e ir fazendo as suas pr√≥prias escolhas, aproveitar oportunidades e decidir se quer ter uma abordagem mais calma ou agressiva ao longo do jogo. Os comandos baseiam-se somente em tomar decis√µes, e escolher que locais visitar ou que miss√µes fazer durante a noite. Acho que houve aqui um pequeno erro por parte da Draw Distance ou secalhar foi s√≥ estupidez minha, mas pelo que entendi existem situa√ß√µes em que mesmo que o jogador decida beber sangue, a ac√ß√£o √© feita mas continuamos com "sede" como se n√£o tiv√©ssemos bebido nada.

[h1] EXPLORA√á√ÉO: [/h1] 

N√£o existe qualquer tipo de explora√ß√£o, e de certa forma √© algo que faz realmente sentido, porque numa Visual Novel como esta, nunca se consegue implementar explora√ß√£o ou pelo menos fazer com que seja minimamente boa.

[h1] HIST√ìRIA/NARRATIVA: [/h1] 

N√£o quero entrar em grandes pormenores em rela√ß√£o √† hist√≥ria porque o jogo gira todo em volta disso, e estaria simplesmente a dar spoiler desnecess√°rio. Resumidamente pode-se dizer que toda a premissa gira em torno de guerras de poder e fac√ß√µes de vampiros. Cada jogador deve fazer as suas escolhas como melhor entender, que obviamente ter√£o influ√™ncia no rumo da hist√≥ria. O jogo aborda uma tem√°tica muito espec√≠fica por isso, n√£o √© um jogo para todos, mas sim para os mais interessados em Visual Novels e aventuras de vampiros. Achei uma hist√≥ria bastante boa, n√£o estava de todo √† espera, mas achei o final um pouco mau sinceramente, mas reparei por outras avalia√ß√µes que muita gente gostou do final, ou seja, s√£o gostos.

[h1] MULTIPLAYER: [/h1] 

Inexistente.

[h1] PRE√áO: [/h1] 

Paguei cerca de 3.99‚Ç¨ no jogo, o que para mim valeu a pena, mas que para outro pode n√£o valer. Vai depender muito do tipo de jogador e dos seus gostos.

[h1] NOTA FINAL: 8/10 [/h1]
Gran juego del que no te cansas de rejugar una y otra vez, la √∫nica l√°stima es que hagas lo que hagas el final ser√° exactamente identico

El juego NO es de accion, es de leer...
dicho esto, me parece una aventura buenisime, con personajes interesantes, y bien escrita
eso si, la traduccion chirria un poco, y no le pondria mas de un 5/10

column8: This was an interesting enough story, the first time around - but having played through with all three characters, it becomes clear, aside from some very minor dialogue differences, that the story is completely linear, which is a little disappointing (even if you want to be meta about how it fits into the overall narrative). It's an interesting concept, and I'm a sucker for a vampire game (heh), but the poor mechanic around feeding and the lack of impact of choice throughout meant this whole experience was a lot more like reading a vampire novel from the late 90's more than a choose your own adventure.

column8: Uma grande Novel, principalmente para f√£s da VTM. N√£o √© t√£o complexa quanto Heart Of The Forest, mas vale certo.

Le jeu se pr√©sente un peu comme un livre dont vous √™tes le h√©ros, ou visual novel.
L'univers de Vampire - la Mascarade est expos√© de mani√®re didactique. On retrouve donc les qualit√©s et les d√©fauts du jdr papier qui date des ann√©es 90, lui-m√™me fortement inspir√© des romans d'Anne Rice.
Si vous √™tes allergique √† white wolf, passez donc votre chemin !!

Pour les autres avec un peu d'indulgence et une bonne ( grosse )  dose de " suspension of disbelief", il y a de quoi passer un bon moment, le jeu √©tant agr√©able et court. On retrouve un univers tr√®s codifi√©, construit sur un certains nombres de principes ou conventions narratives. 

Un b√©mol cependant : la fin abrupte, avec un superbe deus ex machina qui envoie balader tous vos choix et semble d√©connect√©e de l'histoire principale.....  l√† aussi le c√¥t√© tr√®s lin√©aire rappelle les d√©fauts de l'√©dition papier.... Bref, on ne sortira pas des rails invisibles pr√©vus par le sc√©nar.
Dommage ! A prendre lorsque le jeu est en promo.

P.S : le deuxi√®me √©pisode a plus ou moins les m√™mes qualit√©s et d√©fauts que le premier, l'aspect d√©couverte en moins.

column8:
O jogo √© muito bom, a hist√≥ria √© intrigante, a trilha sonora agrega bem na imers√£o e tens√£o da experi√™ncia.
Recomendo a quem gosta do universo sobrenatural de vampiros, mesmo que n√£o conhe√ßa o RPG. O jogo apresenta os termos, explica seus significados, o que o torna bem amig√°vel a iniciantes. E pra quem j√° est√° familiarizado com o jogo de mesa, vai curtir as nuances, algumas sutis, de personalidades dos cl√£s que aparecem. 

N√£o espere um jogo de a√ß√£o e evolu√ß√£o de personagem. Este √© um jogo focado no desenvolvimento da hist√≥ria, onde voc√™ faz escolhas e elas impactam no decorrer. Possui cen√°rios e artes simples, mas belos e comp√µe perfeitamente com a proposta.
Os primeiros 40min de jogo s√£o bem parados, mas no geral o jogo tem uma hist√≥ria rica, personagens bem desenvolvidos e uma √≥tima ambienta√ß√£o.

Ran through my first playthrough as a Brujah.  The plot is deliciously true to VtM in both vibe and lore.  The art was lovely.  The music was spot on.

My only complaint would be that there isn't really a save option for you to be able to try different ways of handling a situation.  There's something to be said of being forced to stick by your choices, but there's nothing stopping someone from playing that way anyway.  Would just be nice to feel like I can see the various routes without having to play the entire game over again.

Something that's not really a negative, but would have been nice, would have been something to show our hunger.  The game does fairly well at letting you know you have to feed, but without a mechanic to monitor it yourself, it's harder to make those decisions like you would playing at the table: let it roll and take a chance, or take the opportunity to feed.  It's also unclear if using your power can potentially increase your hunger as it does at the table, or if they've ignored that mechanic - again, because of the lack of a hunger track.  Not having it didn't really hinder the game in any way, but something that would be nice to have in any future titles.

Overall, this was a very fun game and look forward to playing with different clans and with some different choices.

Overall it was a "Meh" experience. Sure, if it's on sale it's worth taking a shot at it, but I ended this game with more problems than good experiences.
For a visual novel, where the hell are the branching paths and endings?? This game has only 1 official ending (no matter which initial character you choose), so the choices you make really have 0 impact.
The beginning was tiresome, by the middle section things got interesting, and the ending was unexpected (in a good way, kinda?), but it really falls short when you realize that this game is:
[list]
[*] Short
[*] Choices do NOT matter
[*] Some bits of the story are confusing as hell and feel rushed
[*] There is no voice acting (at least in French)
[*] There are few animations, some of which are reused more than once in different situations/places
[*] The ending is abrupt and feels more like an excuse to sell you the other half of the game
[*] The coterie you create is not really that impactful
[*] This game ends with far too many questions left open; usually I like that, but given how shallow and short this game is, it bothers me more than anything since I'm not compelled at all to play the next one to perhaps find it out
[/list]

Welp, I only rate this game as "positive" because the overall Vampire lore is interesting and I paid really cheap, but I wouldn't really call this a game. It's better to call it a book with the illusion of choice.

column8: Promising beginning, stronger middle, and an abysmally disappointing ending. Though this game features strong characterization for most NPCs, it leaves no room for meaningful choices on the part of the player. The last act comes without warning, resulting in a number of unfinished story arcs, and railroads you to an ending where none of the "choices" you've made result in anything of substance. The plot of this game would have done better as a noir short film or comic than as a game where the player expects to have any impact on the outcome.

column8: Gute Geschichten aber einfache Pr√§sentation.

I do recommend this game, I think it was worth the heavily discounted price I paid. However beautiful the images and music are, the story just feels half assed. It's pretty short and lots of things painted as important would just never be mentioned again. The ending is hurt by this at most apart from being just total nonsense. I'm putting the thumbs up because I genuinely enjoyed the beginning and the companions' quests.

Gigantic potential, stomped on by budget or lack of time or both. I don't think it was talent that was missing from the mix and I'm eager to try another game from these developers. Hopefully one where they go all the way.

I got it on offer, and that's why I'll give it a thumbs up. 

Don't get me wrong. The story isn't bad! The art is fantastic too but... I expected more.

I liked the system of not being able to save-scum. I liked the characters and the writing. But it was painfully linear with few options to diverge from the railroaded path. There also seems to be no alternate endings.

And to me, that's kinda what a visual novel-game is supposed to be: Lots of branching choices and many many (many!) different endings to make up for the lack of gameplay.

Because that's what it comes down to. It's pictures with text on top of it. And you click your way through. 
This is FINE! But to compensate, I then expect it to be rich in the story-path  department.

This isn't. Not at all.

Conclusion
Story is great! But very linear. This game should have probably had 3 times the content with branching paths to warrant the full price-tag.

Would definitely pick up when it's on offer though.

A very pale shadow of Vampire the Masquerade: Bloodlines. 
This isn't so much a game as an illustrated (but not animated) choose your own adventure. Worse, beyond the second night, the choices you make don't matter rendering the game ultimately pointless. Add to the lack of music when Vampire the Masquerade: Bloodlines had a great soundtrack and the whole thing was a huge disappointment to me, I'm very glad I go this on sale and didn't pay full price.

column8: So despite not having more than a knowledge of the source material's existence, I decided to give the game a whirl because I dig adventure games...that and it was on sale for pretty cheap, so why not.  And I have to say, I'm glad I did.  The game's story is interesting, full of intrigue and some genuine surprises along the way.  After three playthroughs however, there wasn't a whole lot of variety, though there was enough differences between characters to not make it tedious to play through.  A few more branching paths or decisions that actually made a difference would've been nice, but despite being more linear than I'd like I still enjoyed my time with it.  Definitely check it out if you're a fan of text adventures or just want an intriguing story.  Obviously, if you want more action, you should definitely look elsewhere.

Lediglich die extrem gut geschriebenen Dialoge und Beschreibungen der Umwelt sowie des eigenen Gef√ºhlslebens als Vampir haben mich √ºberzeugt, doch noch eine Empfehlung f√ºr diese grafisch durchaus ansprechende Visual Novel auszusprechen.

Mas enfim, fiquei super imersivo na hist√≥ria, tanto que demorei muito pra terminar. Logo no in√≠cio eu j√° estava impressionado, mas um pouco triste, pois sabia que a hist√≥ria iria chegar ao fim e por isso, fui saboreando cada momento com calma. Demorei quase 18 horas pra completar somente a rota de um dos tr√™s protagonistas. Incr√≠vel. Os personagens s√£o super cativantes e o design deles e toda arte √© linda. Trilha sonora muito bem encaixada que te emociona e anima em diversos momentos. A escrita √© √≥tima e bem profunda, densa e filos√≥fica. As reviravoltas s√£o de tirar o f√¥lego. Eu sinceramente n√£o consigo pensar em uma cr√≠tica agora, pois estou em √™xtase! O universo de Vampire: The Masquerade se tornou o melhor pra mim! Apaixonado pelos personagens e seus dramas.

Parece um daqueles jogos de mesa cujo o narrador te induz s√≥ para um caminho.
No fim a √∫nica coisa que d√° para aproveitar √© os antagonistas D'√Çngelo e Tamika de resto, √© muito ruim principalmente o seu final que falta criatividade e n√£o te d√° outras solu√ß√µes, ent√£o n√£o perca tempo tentando jogar outras vezes para ver se muda!

column8: Although it's nice to have some graphics instead of just text compared to games like Night Road, the story is lacking. Severly. Your choices don't matter in the end, parts of the story are missing and you really don't get to do much in a night. There isn't a general place where you can go or choose between for hunting so you're constantly hungry.  I do have to say that some of the dialoge between you character and NPCs are rather good, but that's all I can say for it. Which is a shame, cause the game would probably have been really good had it been more fleshed out. This seems more like a half finished foundation as it is now, so unless it gets a big overhaul I personally do not recommend it.

The game is pretty fun, the story is interesting. The only problem is that the choices really don't matter. The ending is rushed and you have no impact on what's going to happen. It's more like a comic book than actual visual novel with choices. It's not worth the full price in my opinion. But on good sale (80%) it's fine.

column8: De las peores visual novel que e jugado las decisiones no tienen sentido ninguno llegue a un final como que traicione a la peliroja cuando siempre le fui leal y cumpli todas sus misiones un asco de juego con nada de carisma la verdad desepcion absoluta.

The presentation is absolutely outstanding; 10/10. Excellent artwork, gorgeous characters, atmospheric soundtrack that makes you feel like you're there. The characters are all fundamentally interesting and deep, they're not just cardboard cutouts. The plot and quests are also interesting and well-constructed, but as the plot progresses, you start to realize that there's only ever the illusion of choice. You can make *wrong* choices (it's possible to piss off another character and never see them again), but you don't ever really have complete freedom. This leads to a little bit of weirdness...

For example, there are times when a character will appear and the text says "This is bad. This is the last person you wanted to see." ...and I thought to myself "No! I want to see this person!" or the text will make it clear that a particular choice is bad and that you have to avoid it at all costs....but that's the exact choice I want to make. There's also a bit of weirdness where a character might show up, and the game acts like you've met them before and know who they are despite the fact that the character has never appeared in your game at all.

The absolute worst part is the ending (yes, there is ONLY ONE ending).
[spoiler]Your allies play no role in the ending whatsoever. It turns out that you were being manipulated by someone you've never met who's revealed as the true secret villain. The game acted as if it should all suddenly make sense, but it didn't. I had no clue what the villain was talking about, and none of it made any real sense to me. Anyway, you are completely helpless, nothing more than a bystander during the climax, and your side totally loses. It's implied that you're ultimately forced to become the villain's slave.[/spoiler]

Wow, that sucks. I get the message they were going with here. It's a dark world and you're just a fledgling and a pawn. But still, jeez. Turns out I definitely won't bother with a second playthrough just to be shoehorned into that absolutely bleak, terrible ending. Arguably the single worst ending I've ever seen in any interactive experience (visual novel or otherwise).

Nevertheless, I have to admit that the journey was better than I expected, even if the final destination was deeply disappointing.

column8: J'ai √©norm√©ment ador√© le jeu, tr√®s prenant et sombre! seul b√©mol, le manque de possibilit√© et la rigidit√© du sc√©nario. √ßa aurait √©t√© parfait si nos choix avaient plus d'importance dans le sc√©nario. Mais c'est un d√©faut fr√©quent de ce type de jeu. Je recommande si vous aimez le JDR vampire, ou si vous √™tes tout simplement adepte des histoires de vampires.

I was very pleasantly surprised by this game relative to the mixed reviews it has been receiving. The quality of the writing is quite excellent, and the plot is entertaining, tying together interestingly at the end. It's not a big branching narrative where your choices matter in a deep and enduring way, but on a more "micro" scale, your choices do make a difference in a way I found satisfying. Some things you do are remembered; you can fail scenarios by making a faux-pas, and so forth.

Things I found annoying were:

1) The save system. It's one of those fairly draconian systems that does its best to lock you into sticking with what you've done. I get it, but honestly, if a given player will have a better experience through save-scumming, I endorse just letting them do so. I had to restart once when (as above...) I did outright fail a scenario by picking choices that turned out to be very different from what their wording suggested. Nothing wrong with a bit of saving and loading.

2) The game's structure that forces you to replay in order to explore all quest lines. I barely ever replay games and hate being 'compelled' to in this manner. I don't need to see all outcomes in a single playthrough, but I do somewhat resent having an arbitrary time limit lock off certain quests altogether.

But I enjoyed my experience and will be looking forward to Shadows tomorrow. If you like VTM and good writing then check this game out.

column8: If you want to play this game, I suggest you buy it on sale, as I would be disappointed to have paid full price. It's very short, about 2-2.5 hours of gameplay per playthrough, although the value of doing several playthroughs isn't really that high - the ending is always the same, the quests are always the same, it's just a question of which NPCs you'd rather spend time on. The game is extremely railroaded, being a visual novel, which meshes strangely with the concept of a TTRPG and the freedom that should go along with it. The player characters are flat and one-dimensioned, and frankly very boring; the dialogue options don't offer much depth to them, and the opportunity to only ever ask or say one thing without the ability to savescum is extremely frustrating.  Other characters are a little more interesting, but not much. I also don't find the writing very good, although that is a question of preference.  I'd give it a 2.5/5.

Cette nouvelle graphique est plaisante dans son ensemble mais quelques points viennent assombrir parfois l'exp√©rience. 

Je vais commencer par ce que j'ai per√ßu comme n√©gatif.
Ma premi√®re impression n√©gative concerne l'introduction de notre personnage au monde des t√©n√®bres : c'est un copi√© coll√© de la version Vampire the masquerade bloodline. Bien heureusement il y a quelques nuances, mais le manque d'originalit√© se ressent dans les premiers instants du jeu.

D'autre part, certaines options de dialogues ne collent pas vraiment avec ce que le personnage va dire. Sans non plus que le sens soit oppos√©, il y a parfois un √©cart qui parfois n'est pas n√©gligeable. Exemple d'option de dialogue " Ouah! Trop cool ! Merci !", Et en dialogue le personnage remercie poliment. Donc si on veux √©viter l'aspect de "familiarit√© mal plac√©e", on est tent√© de choisir autre chose (alors que le perso ne montrera pas cette forme de familarit√© en s'exprimant).

Ensuite le choix des options de dialogues sont pafois un peu "wtf" de part le manque de nuances disponibles. Ce qui nuit √† la sensation de finesse de choix. 
Et g√©n√©ralement les choix sont d√©finitifs, par exemple si vous souhaitiez papoter et discuter de 2 options possibles sur les 3 disponibles, √ßa raye les deux autres d√®s que vous choisissez votre option de dial. Bref, cet aspect peut se faire sentir limitatif.

L'√©criture peut sembler manquer de profondeur, je le ressens aussi de par le manque de diversit√© de dialogues / histoire en passant d'un personnage √† un autre : les diff√©rences sont mineures. D'ailleurs seulement 3 repr√©sentants des clans de la Camarilla sont jouables ? Triste restriction, encore un d√©faut qui est de l'odre du manque de profondeur et d'√©criture.

Certains mots sont lamentablements traduits.

Les points positifs parce qu'il y en a quand m√™me :)
C'est en fran√ßais.
La musique vient parfaitement cr√©er l'atmosph√®re de lecture, √† aucun moment je l'ai trouv√© d√©rangeante. Bravo la B.O. !

Les graphiques sont beaux, les personnages plaisants √† d√©couvrir, admirer pendant la lecture. Tout comme les environnements.

C'est immersif, tr√®s vite on oublie certains d√©fauts, les personnages secondaires sont plut√¥t bien √©crits et plaisants √† d√©couvrir.

On a envie de savoir vers quoi le s√©nario va nous mener. Pas / peu d'ennui.

Conclusion: 

Un jeu dans la bonne moyenne dont je ne regrette absoluement pas l'achat. Mais en tant que fan de la liscence on aimerait voir un meilleur sens du d√©tail, encore plus de profondeur, plus de possibilit√©s et plus de choix.

Donc j'ai envie de dire que pour quelqu'un qui d√©couvre l'univers de la masquarade, c'est tr√®s bien. 
Pour les connaisseurs, il y aura forc√©ment des d√©ceptions plus ou moins grandes.

J'aurais bien aim√© qu'il y ai un mix de JDR + pouss√© que les simples choix de dialogues. comme par exemple que le personnage gagne de l'exp√©rience, puisse d√©penser des points pour personnaliser mieux son personnage, comme dans les pouvoir et les attributs, etc.. et qu'en fonction cela d√©bloque des options exclusives. (  exemple : option de dialogue/action disponible √† la condition de charisme 4 ou +). 
Bref, ce jeu est tr√®s convenable m√™me s'il avait l'√©norme potentiel d'√™tre une p√©pite 24 carats.

column8: RPG √© sobre ter v√°rios finais, e n√£o apenas um, independente do voc√™ escolha. 11 horas perdidas da minha vida, e mais algumas de empolga√ß√£o v√£

Modest visual novel with beautiful illustrations but often boring dialogue. On sale, under 10 euros it is a good buy, but no more than that.

Some subplots could also be interesting but the number of 'liveable' nights is limited, you have to hurry and it is impossible to talk to everyone. For the developers this should have prompted the player to replay the title but it is the exact opposite! The thought: 'I will have to do the same things 2-3 more times for a few lines of text' is discouraging.

Rule #1 of visual novels: don't rush.

Interesting story, competent writing and interesting characters.

Would be a clear recommendation, if not for the auto save after every line, combined with one save per character and dialog options which can f. up a story line.

Dialog works most of the time, but sometimes the selected dialog options leads to an unexpected (nearly always some kind of failure) event. Either because of game logic, or because a one sentence dialog options is a paraphrased summary of what you will do.

It's also frustrating to not be able to pick all the options and see what happens, so you're essentially forced to always pick the seemingly best option, while leaving interesting options aside.

My playtime is false, due to me playing this without an internet connection. I'm a big fan of the VTM universe and this game looked decent, despite its reviews. 

$20 for this game is an absolute joke. It's worth MAYBE $10. 

The characters and story itself are good, and so is the art. 
The problem lies with the fact that none of your choices have any major effect. There might be a slight change in dialogue, but after beating the game with all three characters, I can say that I didn't feel like my choices mattered at all. 
So yeah, if you're a big fan of VTM and you get this as a gift of on a heavily reduced sale, it's worth a play. But not for the price they're asking.

column8: I've never played or read anything VTM-related, but I enjoyed this game a lot. It's very well written with lots of different, interesting characters. I enjoyed it so much, in fact, that I was a little startled by the acceleration of events at the end and the abrupt ending. All in all, this was a very nice story game, though.

column8:
Game greets you with dumb dialog choices.... interesting visuals, music and UI, decent story pulls up the game up to a solid 7.5 out of 10. The only drawback is the choices that are quite often make non sense or are one-dimentional.

Still its a pretty good game for a discount! I wish it was longer but maybe devs will someday make a proper longer with better choices game - i will follow devs just in case.

column8: Cara, essa visual nove √© excelente at√© os 90% dela. Da√≠ ela te manda parar tudo e ver um final abrupto que tirou a vontade de jogar de novo. em resumo vc tem uns 15 ou 16 dias no m√°x, e a historia vai acabar ali e pronto, sugiro n√£o espalhar os npcs que vc vai conversar, foca em um pq sen√£o n√£o da tempo de ver toda a hist√≥ria deles.

This game has a lot of shortcomings.  It's less a Vampire: The Masquerade game and more of a submission simulator.  If you can stomach bending the knee enough to survive the beginning, things get more interesting and you are able to meet and work with/for a colorful host of characters.  The story is decent and pretty fun.  Just don't get this game thinking you're going to play how you want and have fun. You either do what the game has in mind for you to do, or it kills you.

column8:
Played through the whole thing in one sitting, and in my play through, it felt like what i did had an impact on the characters i interacted with.

from what i understand there is only one ending, but that being said, the journey to get there was fun! i was invested in the characters that I interacted with, and it felt like if i had a misstep it could all come crumbling down! 

It was a fun read with plenty of interesting decisions to be made! 

overall! a great way to spend an evening if you can get it for cheap!

column8: It's a wonderful visual novel that acts as a good introduction to both Vampire: The Masquerade (VTM) & the World of Darkness universe/world. I recommend it to any and all who are interested in VTM but have little-to-no knowledge about it.
column9: It's a wonderful visual novel that acts as a good introduction to both Vampire: The Masquerade (VTM) & the World of Darkness universe/world. I recommend it to any and all who are interested in VTM but have little-to-no knowledge about it.

column8: Nice writing, very immersive experience. But it seems that the designers didn't make use of the written medium's freedom. So the experience feels very linear and predetermined. I understand of course the desire to tell a predetermined story, but this feels more like one of those cases where this could just as well not have been a game where you make choices, since I as the player feel that they carry no real impact on the game. Removing the agency from the player is something I never felt good about and in my opinion this takes away from my desire to explore "the right choices to experience the end game".
column9: Nice writing, very immersive experience. But it seems that the designers didn't make use of the written medium's freedom. So the experience feels very linear and predetermined. column8: Para os f√£s de Vampiro a m√°scara e de visuals novels √© uma bela pedida.

Jeu finit √† 100%, il est assez court et tr√®s lin√©aire.
Peu importe le clan choisi ou les pouvoirs utilis√©s, vos choix n'ont aucune incidence puisque la fin sera toujours la m√™me.
L'histoire reste int√©ressante tout de m√™me.

Il s'agit d'un bon r√©cit d'introduction √† l'univers de Vampire: La Mascarade.

Les √©l√©ments comme la narration/les artworks des personnages/les personnages sont tr√®s r√©ussis, et nous plongent avec brio dans cet univers vampirique tr√®s sombre.

Quelques d√©fauts cependant (pas de grandes diff√©rences si on joue les diff√©rents personnages, sauvegarde automatique qui s'efface apr√®s une dead end, quelques petites erreurs d'orthographe par ci par l√†).

Je recommande,  l'univers de Vampire: La Mascarade √©tant diablement prenant.
Eu gostei

I finished the game with one of three selectable characters, in this case the Toreador. Beyond the type of game, all dialogues, which you may like or not, you must recognize a good atmosphere, good dialogues (which are the basis of the game ...), an intriguing plot until almost the end, well-made characters, at least at the beginning. But unfortunately the game has two big limitations: one is in the saves, only one slot and although it makes you save almost always when you want, with the save and exit option, it lets you load from wherever it pleases: if you make a wrong choice or you change your mind, it does not allow you to load from where you saved, perhaps on purpose to have the opportunity to see other streets, but it starts again later when the choice is made and you can not do anything about it ... So in practice it is useless. .. The other big problem, the worst, is that it makes you meet some interesting and well developed characters, with each of which you start an often intriguing subplot, but the game ends almost suddenly, and all these subplots remain in the better than half, if not less. Even the ending I didn't understand much ... It almost seems that there must be a sequel. In short, a great pity, an incomprehensible choice at the narrative level. 
Spoiler: The way to finish the side missions is to choose only two maximum three and complete only those. This means that to see them all you have to play at least three times, but since the plot is always the same, except for a few details, it is tiring having to read all that stuff three times ... Also the ending is always the same whatever you do.
