I wasn't sure what to expect but I really enjoy this. It's story based, with some problem solving. Pretty good if you don't mind reading.
column9: I wasn't sure what to expect but I really enjoy this. It's story based, with some problem solving. Pretty good if you don't mind reading.

column8:
A visual novel true to the lore of Vampire: The Masquerade, well written and detailed trying to capture the spirit of what this vampire world is about.

As visual novels go it is interesting both the main story and the side quests. Like many other visual novels it does not offer significantly alternative paths or choices that will allow a different narrative. However it does the job pretty well.

It could be a good introduction to the World of Darkness universe or for people like me who would like to be immersed again in the lore waiting for the release of Bloodlines 2 (provided that visual novels is your thing).

I was surprised with the orthodox approach of the game, the developers seem to be fans, and the game is very reflective of the vampire culture of the masquerade. Because of that I personally found the ending fitting and not that abrupt, it is clear effort was made to make a game that delivers the intrigue, ruthlessness and stagnation/conservatism of the vampire world and the ending tries to convey that.

column8:
Very well-told story that serves to introduce newcomers to some of the things that VtM 5th Edition can do in terms of a Vampire story.  The New York setting has a lot of potential, and I'm very glad to see these kinds of games coming out.

More please!  For now, I recommend people pick up both this and Shadows, but play Coteries first.  I await Draw Distance's next Vampire story with baited breath.

Hmm schwierig...am Liebsten w√ºrde ich dem Spiel eine neutrale Bewertung geben, was leider nicht geht.

Daher muss ich dem Spiel ein "eher Daumen runter" geben, als eine klare Kaufempfehlung. Warum? Nun an sich ist das Spiel echt gut: Die Charaktere waren mehr als unterhaltsam, die Storys zu ihnen abwechlungsreich und die Atmosph√§re sowie Soundtrack bombastisch. Nur gab es Dinge, die einem nach etlichen Stunden Spielzeit st√∂rten. 

Zum einen war meine √úbersetzung nicht immer korrekt und sorgte vor allem bei Entscheidungen zu Missverst√§ndnissen oder gegens√§tzliche Aussagen, obwohl ich es eigentlich nicht so gemeint hatte. Verwirrung und Frust pur.

Zudem waren einige Storyfade von einigen Nebencharas nicht "erf√ºllend" - man hat der Person geholfen, alles gemacht und unterst√ºtzt, wo man nur konnte...und dann wird man mit noch mehr Fragen zur√ºckgelassen. Es gab 2 Nebenmissionen, wo ich am Ende da sa√ü und nicht wusste...was zum Teufel die beiden eigentlich nun von meiner Zeit wollten oder was ihr Ziel war XD

Au√üerdem bin ich eine Romantikerin...es gab so viele Charas, mit denen man n√§her kam oder zum L√§cheln bringen konnte, aber Romanzen waren hier wohl Fehl am Platz. Das hat mich dann doch sehr entt√§uscht, da es den Anschein erweckt hatte...wirklich schade (ich will mein Qadir! >.<)

[spoiler]Aber das Schlimmste war wirklich das extrem entt√§uschende Ende f√ºr mich. Ich wei√ü nicht wie es den anderen Spielern ging, aber am Ende glich ich eher einem komischen Frosch, der vor Verwirrung den Mund nicht schlie√üen konnte. Nichts wurde zufriedenstellend erkl√§rt und absolut keine meiner Entscheidungen hatte auch nur irgendeinen Einfluss auf das Ende. Au√üerdem fand ich die Aufl√∂sung extrem niederschmetternd, da ich sooo gehofft hatte, dass man endlich frei ist und nach seinem Erzeuger suchen konnte...oder was wei√ü ich....Nur hatte ich kein Ende im Sinn: Vom Regen in die Traufe.[/spoiler]

Daher tut es mir leid, aber Spa√ü hat es gegen Ende wirklich nicht mehr gemacht: daf√ºr hatte ich zu viele Entt√§uschungen und unbeantwortete Fragen √ºbrig. 
Aber vielleicht bin ich auch nur zu anspruchsvoll xD Vielleicht gef√§llt es euch ja :)
Wenn ihr es probieren wollt, k√∂nnt ihr gern im Sale zuschlagen!

It's not a complicated game, but there are different options to go for and the story is engaging for the first few times. Extra points for lore references from the tabletop RPGs. For the price asked it's well worth the money.

Este juego me genera la necesidad de una tercera opci√≥n para las rese√±as, una m√°s neutral, no puedo decir que no lo recomiende, pero... tmp lo recomiendo a secas.
 Esperaba bastante de este juego por ser una novela visual de vampiros con unas visuales con estilo under/noire inspirada en un juego de mesa de rol.
 Para comenzar, las visuales me encantaron, muy buen estilo y dise√±o de  escenarios y personajes, con un juego de luces que le queda esplendido. Pero al avanzar el juego me di cuenta que no hab√≠a demasiadas im√°genes, y empezaban a reutilizar im√°genes de escenarios en vez de crear nuevos.
 Y uno pensar√°, lo importante es la narrativa en este tipo de juegos, Y POR SUPUESTO QUE SI. Pero tambi√©n en ese apartado me fall√≥, Una historia que empieza prometedora, presentando una sociedad vamp√≠rica encubierta con sus reglas y conceptos en medio de una segunda inquisici√≥n en Nueva York. Pero que de pronto se precipita en un final abrupto cortando todo lo que se ven√≠a desarrollando. El gui√≥n es bastante simple, sus di√°logos y decisiones tambi√©n, y por momentos roza el sin sentido.
 Sus 3 personajes iniciales son un mero cambio de personalidad y de fachada que en la pr√°ctica uno mismo debe rolear en las decisiones ya que disponen de las mismas opciones de di√°logos y ning√∫n cambio a lo largo del juego, todo discurre y termina de igual modo. No hay mucha variaci√≥n y eso que tuve que jugar varias veces el juego por sus logros, no hay personalizaci√≥n alguna. Aquello por lo que debe brillar este tipo de juego, la narrativa, gusto a poco me ha dejado.
 B√°sicamente me deja un sabor a puro potencial desaprovechado y llevado a una simplificaci√≥n con una historia acortada a parecer un mero capitulo introductorio de algo mayor... Shadow of New York? A√∫n no lo he jugado.
 Por √∫ltimo una aclaraci√≥n para la traducci√≥n al espa√±ol, agradezco que exista, pero es realmente molesto sus errores, principalmente de g√©nero; en un juego cuya narrativa se supone que debe ser el fuerte, genera un efecto de desimersion.

Not bad for a visual novel, but like other reviewers said choices have very little impact on the story.  I can't really recommend it due to the abrupt ending that pretty much leaves everything your character accomplished throughout the game rather pointless.  Only pick this up if you love Vampire the Masquerade and like visual novels, otherwise I'd skip this adventure into the world of darkness.

Assolutamente consigliato agli amanti del genere, ma anche a chi non ha particolari conoscenze dell'ambientazione.

column8: Not a bad game, great atmosphere for a Visual Novel. However choices in this game have no consequence and you get railroaded into the same crappy abrupt ending no matter what you do. Choice of clans and allies also makes virtually no difference to the story. The game unfortunately also has woke undertones to it (nothing major, but still noticeable). Lastly the game teases romance, but never actually delivers which is a major let down. All in all the game feels rushed, and lacks meaningful choices.

column8:
Sometimes, you just want to read a book.
This is a "visual novel", which means there's even less gameplay than a Telltale game. This truly is a Choose Your Own Adventure book, just in digital format. You get to choose your clan, and that choice will influence how the story unfolds, although I suspect the story goes the same (or similar) way(s) regardless of what choices you make (can't say for sure, though - only did the one playthrough).
If you are already invested in the world of Vampire: The Masquerade, you will definitely enjoy this story more. The writing is...adequate. It varies from good to serviceable, with some great characters. But if you feel like just enjoying an interesting story that you have some control over the outcome of, give this a shot.

column8: At√© agora a hist√≥ria t√° bem interessante.
Unterhaltsame, kurzweilige Grafik Novel mit Vampire The Masquerade Hintergrund.

Ich habe "Coteries of New York" (ebenso wie danach "Shadows of New York") tats√§chlich durchgesuchtet. Insgesamt hat man gut 12 Stunden Spa√ü mit diesem Teil (21 Stunden sind zusammen gekommen, weil ich das Spiel immer mal wieder pausiert und im Hintergrund habe weiter laufen lassen).  Ich habe das nicht oft, aber hier bin ich wirklich motiviert, noch ein oder zwei Durchg√§nge mit den anderen Charakteren zu machen. Es sind zwar nicht alle Clans spielbar, aber das empfinde ich insgesamt nicht schlimm. Es gibt eine gute Einf√ºhrung in die Welt der Vampire und der anderen Clans.

Meiner Meinung nach ist es f√ºr jeden ein wundervoll gestaltetes Abenteuer, der das P&P "Vampire the Masquerade" und dessen Welt mag. Ich habe bisher nur einen Durchgang gespielt mit dem Ventrue-Charakter, war aber schon hier positiv √ºberrascht, wie gut das Thema rund um politische und pers√∂nliche Machenschaften, Intrigen, Manipulation und letztendlich auch (Un-)Menschlichkeit hier eingeflossen sind. Die Atmosph√§re wird durch einen tollen Soundtrack und sch√∂n gestaltetes Artwork sehr stimmig. 

Das Abenteuer h√§lt eine Reihe von unterschiedlichen Entscheidungen mit unterschiedlichen Konsequenzen bereit. Es schafft es, den Kern von "Vampire the Masquerade" zu vermitteln: Das Vampir-Dasein besteht vor allem aus einem Kampf um die eigene Menschlichkeit und darum, sich in der Welt der Vampire zu behaupten. Wer hier viel Action und Hauen und Stechen erwartet, wird eher entt√§uscht. Wer aber herausfinden m√∂chte, wie es sein kann, ein kleiner Fisch in einem See voller Haie zu sein, der wird hier voll auf seine Kosten kommen.

It's not bad, but I was expecting some more from this game.
The visual are amazing, the soundtrack could be better, we desperately need an auto button, and each route could be a bit more different and engaging than what end up being.
It's short, not very long, get it on a sale.

Wer Vampire: The Masquerade mag oder Spa√ü an Story-Telling Games hat, wird hier ordentlich bedient.
Die gute englischen Texte erz√§hlen eine stimmungsvolle Geschichte. Die  verschiedenen Charaktere sind interessant. 
Leider kann man -je nach Verlauf- recht schnell zum Ende der Story kommen. Schade. Ich h√§tte gerne noch mehr von den Coteries erfahren.

[spoiler] Extremely disappointing ending. [/spoiler] I don't even feel compelled to play again as another clan. Before digging into this game I half thought I'd stall a replay over my Toreador loyalty, but turns out I just won't replay it because I don't really feel like experiencing this story again, the ending or the lack of agency it exacerbates(a little beyond what I'd already expect from a visual novel). Other than that, the atmosphere and visuals are great. If you want a better story AND great atmosphere and visuals, go for V:TM - Shadows of New York.

Excellent jeu dans la tradition de Vampire, la mascarade. Prenant, divertissant et bien √©crit.

J'adore l'univers du Monde des T√©n√®bres, conteur du jeu papier apr√®s √™tre tomb√© dedans via Vampire "The Masquerade Redemption" alors que j'avais environ 12 ans. Coterie of New York diffuse parfaitement l'ambiance (et le lore prodigieux) de Vampire, de ses querelles, de ses machinations d'esth√®tes exalt√©s, de corporatistes fourbes, de rebelles perdus. Tout y est, la sensualit√© morbide, la tension, les choix corn√©liens. A ce propos, le dictionnaire int√©gr√© au jeu permet au joueur novice de prendre conscience de la richesse de l'univers et c'est un aspect tr√®s int√©ressant et plut√¥t bien pens√© par les concepteurs.

Pour ce qui est du gameplay (et l√†, le dictionnaire prend tout son sens) l'impression est plut√¥t celle d'un bon "livre dont vous √™tes le h√©ros" que d'un jeu pour hardcore gamers. On lit et on choisit comment r√©pondre √† telle situation. On avance progressivement et on en apprend un peu plus √† chaque nuit qui passe tandis que le noeud narratif se resserre pour ne se d√©nouer qu'√† la fin. 
Si vous aimez les bouquins policiers et les vampires - et si vous aimez lire - ce jeu est pour vous, si vous voulez contr√¥ler toute l'histoire, passez v√¥tre chemin. 
Je l'ai termin√© en un peu plus de dix heures et il y a plein de choses que n'ai pas explor√©es. De fait, je sais que je vais y retourner et changer de clan - juste pour voir.

Only save type is non-optional line-by-line auto-save...? Seriously?

Another juvenile coded VN that will not get a full playthru until MANUAL SAVE options are made available. Most people do not like their time being wasted. Forcing from-the-beginning replays just to see a slightly different outcome is not endearing nor persuasive to earn me as a repeat customer.

BTW, death, death, death, death or 'the only option to progress along the railroad tracks' is not a choice. I may have actually enjoyed this if it had been sold as a Visual Graphic Novel Movie without pretend game options, at least there would have been more honesty, possibly entertainment, in that transaction and a lot less insulting the intelligence of the consumers going on.

column8:
Neutral thumb down here.

I am a huge fan of VTM as a setting, so I was delighted to see a story-driven game in the universe. The main story is well written, and the characters presented are interesting and endearing. This story fits the World of Darkness extremely well.

I would say to stick with one playthrough, though. The game is very much an on-the-rails visual novel. I found that my choices really didn't matter or affect the outcome at the end.  Compared to Detroid: Become Human, which I just finished, this felt pretty unfulfilling. I'd say, if you can get this as part of a bundle or on a super-sale, go for it, especially if you're into VTM or World of Darkness. Probably not worth spending too much time or money on, though.

The biggest asset of this game is excellent writing, vivid fleshed out characters and great visuals. Even though there is only one ending and ultimately your choices don't matter, it is still replayable and very enjoyable.
I went through it 4 times to play with all available characters and go through all small side stories.

column8:
I'm impressed. I usually don't like vampire stories but Coteries of New York is different. It is about vampires of courses but it's mostly about a secret society, it's hierarchy, it's politics and all its intricaties. I've tried Vampire The Masquarade roleplaying before but found it too overwhelming and complex. Coteries of New York however is a fantastic introduction to the World of Darkness. You're a fledling vampire and as such as a player get introduced to everything at a steady pace. It might mean that it's less interesting for people already familiar with VtM though. I can't be the judge of that. Storywise I'm not going to spoil anything but there's not that much to the overarching story. The individual shorter stories are worthwhile though and I expect the sequel to have a bigger and better overal narrative.

I used to think that a visual novel needs to be fully voiced for me to enjoy. Coteries has proven me wrong. When it's this good audiovisually, there's not need at all for voices. Visually it's different than other VN's and I like that. The sound always sucked me in (no pun intended).

Very well written visual novel, loved it.
Great addition in anticipation of the Bloodlines 2

Is a well written Vampire the Masqurade story. Best for people who already know the world. It makes it seem like your choices matter but they really don't. You can't really lose except in one early choice and there is only one ending, even though it seems like you're choosing factions as you go. There are a variety of side stories as you work your way through so that part would have some variety but overall just expect to be playing it once.
The music and minor animations on top of the regular visual novel format are well done. It would have been nice to have voice acting though.

column8:
A visual novel based in the Vampire the Masquerade universe.

A good casual game if you just want to flow with a story and decide your fate. It plays sort of like a choose your own adventure comic book with gorgeous artwork and haunting music. 

As a newly turned vampire, you are put directly in a political drama with conspiracy at its un-beating heart. You can choose from one of three characters; the Brujah called Eric, the logical Amanda of clan Ventrue, and Lamar the artistic Toreador (I wish there was a Malkavian character but I guess I have to wait for Swansong.). As you play through you uncover the mysteries of the undead world. You are a puppet amid an intense time for the Camarilla and Anarchs. I cannot say much more so you may uncover the twists on your own.

Play this game more like a book. Sit down and read through it and go with the words and form the situation in your head with the help of the art. This is not a game for those who love combat, this is a story.

column8: tres bon jeux !

I enjoyed this quite a bit. The story is melodramatic, and the writing variable, but I found the mysteries engaging enough to keep me clicking through the story enjoying myself. There is enough content that you'll need to play it twice through to see all of the side-stories, and you would need to play it even more often to see the various consequences of each of different decisions that are possible in all of the side stories. Your choices do matter quite a bit; though the main story progresses fairly linearly, you can prematurely end threads if you respond in certain ways, and the way people treat you varies considerably depending on your choices. There doesn't seem to be any cross-over between side-stories (i.e., decisions in one side-story don't affect others), but decisions to change individual stories in which they occur. I haven't played many interactive visual novels but, compared to those I have played, I found this to be very good.

column8: If you like visual novels, then this game will be right up your alley.  Overall, the storyline is good (could have been fleshed out a bit more) and the artwork is really good. What really makes the game are your Coterie recruit's quests. Fair warning, because of the game's main storyline, you will only have time to fully play through two Coterie recruit's storylines and two of the small side quests. But there are enough storylines in this game that you could easily enjoy another play though with a different starting character. As fun as this game is though, I would definitely wait until it goes on sale.

column8:
War ein tolles Erlebnis und ich f√ºhlte mich zum Teil sehr stark wie im P&P von Vampire. Grunds√§tzlich ist es halt recht kurz  und auch wenn man 3 Charaktere zur Auswahl hat ist der Wiederspielwert nicht unbedingt soooo gro√ü. 

Die Deutsche Lokalisation kann sich gr√∂√üenteils sehen lassen, abgesehen von ein paar kleineren Rechtschreibfehlern sind mir keine groben Schnitzer aufgefallen, die Dialoge wirken geschliffen und die Story fesselte zumindest mich sehr schnell bis  zum Ende das - zumindest in meinem Durchlauf bitterb√∂se war.

Meine Empfehlung: Wenns im Sale ist und man gerne liest zuschlagen, f√ºr den Vollpreis denke ich kann man auch noch warten weil eben 13 Stunden trotzdem Schnell vorbei sind.

I really wanted to like this. I'm giving it a thumbs down because I don't think I'll recommend this game to a friend any time soon, though ideally I'd give it a neutral score if it was possible.

You might want to play this if you're a die hard fan of VtM, love the art and ambiance, which it does deliver, or if you want an easy 100% achievement game. Buy it when it's on discount, preferably when it hits another "historical low" sale. If you buy for full price your disappointment will be immeasurable and your day will be ruined.

If you're going to play this you might want to skip the rest of the review as there will be spoilers. Also, I feel like ranting. Here goes.

The game feels short. It takes 5, maybe 6 hours to complete with one character. In comparison, free version of The Life and suffering of Sir Brante took me 3.5h to complete - and that one was just a demo.

The story and writing generally didn't entice. True, there were moments when I was actually getting into it, but they didn't last. Most storylines seemed to follow a pattern of having an interesting premise, a middle full of making questionable sense & clich√©s, and an unsatisfying ending. My experience was all over the place - there was some boredom, some immersion, a few curious moments, some tediousness, & a bunch of cringe.
Sometimes it felt like maybe there was something more there at one point, but it had to be cut for whatever reasons. Take, for example, the stories of the Stalker or Benoit, which seem to be fillers in case you utterly fail to recruit people into your coterie. The first time I went through the Stalker storyline I barely got into it and bam - "latest obsession" achievement popped, story complete. It left me with a feeling of "what just happened", and that didn't change even as I replayed the bit in order to become the stalker's "bitter foe". She (the stalker) has no role other than this annoyance of a subplot and a tiny theatrical snip (pun intended) in the end, where she could've been easily replaced by just about any random vampire and it would have made no difference. Am I supposed to think "oh she's a Malk so... whatever?" and just roll with it? 

And Benoit... what was that even? Most of his questline felt like word salad, the ending with the priest was awkward. Why am I suddenly looking for absolution? Why am I trusting Benoit and listening to his "trust me bro" religious/lore ramblings when his sadistic ass can't seem to even begin to process his own hypocrisy? Oh no, he's self-aware and that's just the Beast talking, so it's okay, I'm sure God can compartmentalize. I mean, he's supposed to have had numerous conversations with the priest, to the point of revealing himself as Kindred. Not much is explained, so I can only guess that no genuine wisdom or faith got through to him? I understand the desire to bring forth a moral dilemma, but the way it was implemented made it feel pointless and unnecessary. Oh, & the notorious vampire hunter in a wheelchair? Okay, would've made a tiny bit of sense if for example they were part of the Reporter arc finale. Or if I could notice them during the Gangrel Inquisition attack. Give me something tangible in order to fear them, please, instead of the narrative just telling me to. Without any tie-in, the scene with 3 menacing alleged vampire hunters in the cathedral felt like a parody. 

If you played Bloodlines, you might remember Malkavians and especially their murdered Primogen with some fondness - the way he was utterly insane, with no regard to human life, but also... kinda relatable? Malks are supposed to "see" through the real essence of things, which this game also mentions. Well, apparently in this day and age they run a plethora of social network bots with sheer power of DID and mine crypto, trying to own the internet while bashing the non forward compatible boomers, I mean Elders. 'Seeing the essence' was minimized to Hope's 'vibe check' based on how I was gonna react in a set-up and moderate her chat. Surprisingly, no mention of TikTok, which actually would've been appropriate if you think about it. Whatever happened to Nosferatu l33t hackers and their Schrecknet? Oh, that's all pass√©, they only use high tech to watch snuff now.
All the memeful buzzwords are here for you to relate to, btc, twitter being the 'Cliff notes' of politics, Epstein, even the "you're finally awake" Skyrim joke. Made me wonder if they'd imply something like Theranos being a front for vampires to harvest blood doll samples (they didn't go there, wonder why), & I half-expected the Toreador artist character to dabble in NFTs.

Look, I can understand that work was put into this, everyone's a critic, to each their own and maybe I'm just a picky visual novel consumer. Some people will definitely enjoy this game. In fact, I did too, to a point. Things did get interesting. Briefly. Just before you get catapulted into the finale. Here the main story plot twist can be summed up as "Nobody expects the Second Inquisition!" followed by a Scooby Doo-like reveal of the evil guy behind the scenes. Except he gets away with it, in spite of you (or is it thanks to you?) meddling kids.

I think it's pretty noticeable when elements of the plot are being used as an excuse to mask writing solutions. Oh, she's a Malk so the story doesn't really have to make sense. Or, see, this guy has actually adopted this clich√© detective persona, so we crammed every overused detective line we could find in here, it's not the other way around. (That being said, I actually liked the murders storyline the most, I just couldn't shake this impression)
Perhaps the biggest problem with the narration is that it often tells you how you perceive things and how you feel. It does a poor job of actually building you up to it. Here, reader, this is a mystery, so go on, feel mystified. This here disabled lady is an experienced vampire hunter, I swear on me mum. Go feel threatened. Yeah, but it doesn't feel mysterious or threatening, it feels like something's missing, like it doesn't make "enough" sense... Shush neonate, you so silly. Haven't you figured out that you're in the middle of a fanfic yet? 

And yeah, I played this knowing my choices wouldn't matter much. That's why when the Ventrue blood quality weakness was revealed (I skipped the blood bag & thought that Elysium blood would've been higher grade, so it was a bit of a surprise), I thought that that was neat, maybe I'd have to mind the feeding choices. Well no, not even this matters, whichever feeding opportunity you pick or skip later on, they're all miraculously compatible with your tastes.

In the end I gave up, called my next character "Doodoobird" and... suddenly things got much more fun. "Welcome to the Camarilla, Doodoobird" "Ah, Doodoobird! You're the talk of the town. Here to join the anarchs?" Yes! Yes I am. I shall solve all your problems and sire much progeny. Also, Doodoobird is a much goofier nickname than pornoscollector, & I reckon Hope would approve.

Alrighty, rant over. 

Was this all just an intro for the next game? Will the next chapter focus on you breaking a blood bond? Will it ponder the question of what's holy or unholy, explain the entanglement of the priest, wrap up the whole "fate" discourse neatly? Well, even if it will, sorry, but I think I'll pass.

Frankly, if you want to experience the World of Darkness, you might rather get VtM:Bloodlines to run on Windows 11, it will be well worth the hassle.
column9:

Buy it when it's on discount, preferably when it hits another "historical low" sale. If you buy for full price your disappointment will be immeasurable and your day will be ruined.

column8:
Coteries of new york is an interactive novel about Vampires in the Wolrd of Darkness. It is beatifuly drawn with very nice music to add. A lot of people find the story dissapointing, but I think it serves as a nice introduction to the World of Darkness for Vampire the Masquerade. 
Although all choices lead to one specific end I personally don't mind because it is a pre-written story after all. Though I do understand why, the deely familiar with Vampire, player may find it underwhelming, I think it's a nice, small game that can give one a very clear perspective on the Camarilla and the Machiavellian schemings of the Ivory Tower.
I will agree with those that suggest buying it on a sale. The actual price is a little too much for the product offered.

A visual delight as far as interactive novels go, Coteries does feel like a rushed narrative, giving you what only seems like a taste of interesting characters and scenarios. A game like this should be aiming for a more immersive experience, I feel, and I found myself hoping for even some DLC content that never was. Despite the bit of an unsatisfying taste it leaves in the mouth by the end, I do vaguely recommend it as a basic stepping stone to VTM the world, or as inspiration behind your own campaign setting. Much more worth the price if its on sale or as part of a bundle.

column8:
Starts out well, but ends abruptly.  The characters are well thought out and the locations felt real to NYC.
As a native, NY is a fantastic locale for the world of Darkness.  It is the after all the city that never sleeps.
I played Brujah and was able to get through the game in 6 hours, of enjoyable play.  The story is a rail road and the combat lacking so it's a bit more like interactive fiction than a game.  For WOD fans or those running a WOD TPG, this title provides some nice story hooks.  It's also a nice intro for those unfamiliar with Vampire the Masquerade.  That said, the climax comes quickly and could have been developed more.

column8:
A choice based game where your choices don't matter. 

The good - 
Some of the characters are well written, the writing is generally of a high quality, and the artwork can be absolutely beautiful and does a great job capturing that "world of darkness" mood

The bad - 
Some of the characters are very poorly written or just incredibly cringy, but worst is that none of your choices really make much difference as to what happens. I played through the game two times to confirm that, trying to make opposing choices in the second playthrough, and the game I got was basically identical to the first. 

But, it gets even better than that. Not only do your choices not matter, the game goes out of its way to point that out to you in the ending, almost like its mocking you for thinking anything you did would have some kind of impact. It has to be one of the worst most unsatisfying endings I've seen in a game like this.

Final thoughts -
While making meaningless choices a feature of the game feels to me like cheating the player, it can sometimes be forgiven if the narrative is strong enough to stand on its own. This one isn't. Overall, while there are some positives to recommend this, they're far outweighed by the negatives

column8:
I'll try to make this as spoiler-free as possible!

So- I binged coteries of New York only to be met with a VERY sudden finale that is simultaneously a cliffhanger. Turns out none of your choices actually really mattered in the end, you'll always be met with the same conclusion. There were SO many loose ends and unanswered questions, NPC's having voice lines that make it seem like you either missed a major event, or as if what they were referring to, was cut from the game entirely. 
Here and there the game teases some possible/bonds with characters (romantic and otherwise), but even if you see them through to the end, most of them do not have an impact on the finale at all. 
The plot gets driven forward much more rapidely than one would be aware of and will foreshadow possible events and re-appearances that will never take place. The game is then cut off by an entirely new big bad evil guy, seemingly out of nowhere. Said BBEG offers you an ultimatum that one will never actually get the chance to answer.. 

All in all:
The game feels rushed and unfulfilling, while only giving off the facade that your choices will have any impact in the long run. Multiple interactions with various characters actually felt involving but seemed to be what should have merely been the foundation of their routes, leading one to believe that there's so much more to achieve.

column8:
Coteries of New York es una aventura gr√°fica basada en la ambientaci√≥n de Mundo de Tinieblas. Las decisiones que tomes influyen en mayor o menor medida en la historia: pueden matarte, conseguirte aliados o enemigos, o hacer que veas una versi√≥n u otra de las diferentes l√≠neas de di√°logo a descubrir que hay en el juego. Lo que le a√±ade cierta rejugabilidad al juego.

Aun as√≠, el inicio y el final es pr√°cticamente id√©ntico en todas las partidas. Por eso te recomiendo que te centres en terminar dos o tres historias concretas; ya que no tendr√°s tiempo de hacer m√°s en las 15-16 noches de duraci√≥n que est√° programado autom√°ticamente para durar el juego. Y corres el riesgo de no terminar ninguna si empiezas muchas diferentes. 

El arte, la narraci√≥n y la m√∫sica ayuda mucho a ambientar las partidas. Adem√°s algunos de los personajes secundarios tienen personalidades o giros en sus tramas muy peculiares. Si lo encuentras bien de precio y te gusta Vampiro, o sientes curiosidad por este tipo de aventuras gr√°ficas, te lo recomiendo (cada partida son unas 4-5 horas). 

Adem√°s los logros son bastante f√°ciles de sacar, aunque necesitar√°s un m√≠nimo de cinco runs (algunas incompletas) para conseguirlos todos.
Bom jogo. Poderia ter finais alternativos, mas √© bom para ambientar no Vampiro 5a edi√ß√£o

column8: I love VtM, but it seems to be a franchise more obsessed on cash grabbing than anything else today. I know White Wolf has always published books at the speed of light, but it feels to be a lot worse today. I wish they put more effort into these games. This game does shine at certain things, but the extremely linear story does not work here and just serves to annoy the player. The soundtrack is amazing though.

column8: A Hist√≥ria √© interessante, poderia ter um pouco mais de op√ß√µes e ser um pouco menos linear.

Coteries of New York

	Around the time that the first real gameplay footage of Vampire the Masquerade: Bloodlines 2 emerged out of Paradox Software‚Äôs dark haven to give long-suffering vampire gamers a taste of their long-awaited meal, we were treated to an unexpected first course in Vampire the Masquerade: Coteries of New York. This visual novel by Polish indie-devs Draw Distance allows the player to select an undead New Yorker from one of 3 clans, and attempt to survive the hidden dangers of the Big Apple‚Äôs supernatural underground.

	The term ‚Äúvisual novel‚Äù is sometimes thrown about pretty loosely, but this is about as pure an interactive storybook as you will get: unlike Bloodlines there is no free roaming in New York City, no weapons or power-ups to collect, and no big boss fight at the end. You simply read through the story and occasionally get a chance to affect the outcome, such as deciding whether or not to use your vampiric powers (different for each character), as well as choosing the opportune time to feed. At your disposal is a glossary of useful VtM terms as well as a conversation log; players who pay careful attention will usually be able to make a choice with a positive outcome. These types of games live and die by the writing, and aside from the occasional spelling error and odd word choice, the story on display should be sufficient to immerse the player in their surroundings. So too does the dialogue allow these undead characters to come to life in convincing fashion.

	All in all, CoNY takes about 10 hours from beginning to end, with a little bit of replay value depending on which characters you decide to meet, though unfortunately the overall ending does not change. The developers have hinted at additional content and updates in the future. Whether or not you want to spend the $20 to buy the game mostly depends on your feelings on the genre; however, fans that do take the plunge will find a solid, if brief offering. (3/5 skulls)

column8:
I wish there was a neutral option for reviewing honestly
After finishing the game with whoever you've picked at the start you come to realise that...your choices really are irrelevant. You can be an ass, you can be helpful - the dialogues stay the same and the ending is not impacted by your actions.
Weird introduction to the VtM universe for me, I dunno. The art and music are amazing and at least I learned the lingo, but the little impact of the choices you make really put me off.

column8: Kurz, aber kurzweilig. Nach der ersten Story habe ich tats√§chlich Lust, die anderen beiden Charaktere auch noch zu spielen. Klare Empfehlung f√ºr verregnete Sonntage. Und Achtung - in dem Spiel geht es zu 95% darum die Geschichte anhand ihrer Dialoge zu lesen, zu 5% etwas zu entscheiden. Also Interaktion ist d√ºnn, Story aber sehr unterhaltsam.

Anyone who looked at my profile can tell I'm a big vampire fan, and as I have not played any previous Vampire: The Masquerade games, Coteries of New York being my first and a visual novel at that. It is an interesting take on the vampire myth, and help me to understand this world better for when Bloodlines 2 is released.

In short, Coteries of New York is a story about a newly converted vampire coping on how to be one in the first two weeks, at the same time making allies and enemies, and trying to gain favors.

My only complaint about this game is there's no auto-skip on seen texts, to the next choice for those wanting to complete all the Steam achievements so they have to manually click enter for every text.

Un roman visuel bien fichu qui permet une tr√®s bonne introduction √† l'univers de "Vampire la Mascarade".

- On se plonge rapidement dans l'histoire 
- Le rythme des √©v√©nements s'encha√Æne, et on a pas le temps de s'ennuyer
- L'ambiance visuelle, auditive et la narration (aussi bien le sc√©nario que l'√©criture des dialogues, en d√©pit de quelques fautes d'orthographe) sont tr√®s r√©ussis et fid√®les √† l'univers du Jeu de R√¥le
- Chacun des trois clans jouables a son charme, peu importe celui qu'on a choisi

Les moins :

- Toutes les qu√™tes ne peuvent √™tre termin√©es en une seule partie, ce qui est frustrant √† la fin de la premi√®re et oblige √† jouer les autres pour tout d√©couvrir,
- Le syst√™me de sauvegarde ne permet pas de recharger un dialogue et pour exploiter toutes les possibilit√©s il faut se retaper le jeu en entier
- Une seule fin possible, et en dehors de quelques alternatives, tout cela est assez lin√©aire : les choix que l'on fait ont au bout du compte peu d'impact sur le d√©roulement des √©v√©nements

Absolutely, if you happen to enjoy Vampire: The Masquerade's tabletop universe and don't mind playing characters with preset personalities. The story is good, even if it feels a bit on rails. The choices don't always trigger different dialogue and there's no quick save option, so trying to see everything takes a bit.

I personally really dug the artwork and am just a fan in general of getting to poke around in lore that I've enjoyed from other sources.

column8:
It autosaves every line of dialogue, and there's no way to manually save. So, despite the linearity of the story, I'd argue that your choices do matter. Because once you make them, you're !@#$ing stuck with them unless you'd like to start again from the beginning.

This isn't a good thing.

Unlike every other visual novel on the market, text doesn't advance on mouse click. You can't click just anywhere on the screen. You have to click on the tiny little "Continue" arrow beneath the text box, which is a third the size of the continue button I'm seeing on the store page screenshots. This is a minor QoL issue which amounts to making this thing kind of a pain to read.

In spite of these issues, I was enjoying the writing. Up until I came to the realization that there's a set time limit to the story. It overwhelms you with quests and sidequests and expects you to do multiple playthroughs if you want to actually experience all of it.

Time management could be a fun feature... but then you realize that there's no save system, and they expect you to re-read those same scenes again and again by being very precise with where you leave your mouse pointed.

I can't. I just can't. I'm !@#$ing done.

If you're interested in the setting, play Bloodlines. Don't bother yourself with this trite.

Vampire The Masquerade - Coteries of New York √© um romance visual com uma experi√™ncia narrativa com fic√ß√£o interativa ambientada no universo de vampiros onde ir√° apresentar a luta pelo poder entre duas fac√ß√µes vamp√≠ricas a Camarilla e os Anarchs banhada pelas luzes noturnas da Grande Ma√ß√£. Nisso temos uma escolha dentre tr√™s personagens predefinidos para jogar como Ventrue, Toreador ou Brujah que nada mais √© umas das 13 Classes dos vampiros (bem que poderia haver mais classes de vampiros para jogar com o que conhecemos no jogo sobre cada um deles), entretanto, dependendo da sua escolha de Cl√£ temos um modo de vis√£o diferente do jogo atrav√©s dos eventos a partir de uma perspectiva distinta, por√©m como as noites meio que s√£o "limitadas" por contas das miss√µes da hist√≥ria principal e n√£o secund√°rias, √© preciso jogar o jogo mais de uma vez para ver as secund√°rias de como seria a participa√ß√£o ou o desenvolvimento se a sua escolha fosse tal coisa escolhida o que √© legal at√©, uma pena √© que mesmo eu jogando com diferentes personagens o final da hist√≥ria permanece a mesma... s√≥ modifica umas coisas das miss√µes secund√°rias como dito anteriormente.
Relatando ainda mais sobre o jogo voc√™ interpreta um(a) vampiro(a) rec√©m-transformado(a) em Nova Iorque, com isso conhecemos mais sobre a hist√≥ria dos vampiros, religi√£o, a besta, os poderes, as classes e encontramos NPCs (outros vampiros, sangues-fracos, carni√ßais, humanos e etc) e obviamente conhecendo mais sobre a Camarilla e os Anarchs.
A hist√≥ria em si √© curta, mas com o desenvolvimento dos NPCs faz com o que o jogo se torna um pouco longo, gostei dos gr√°ficos, dos cen√°rios, das op√ß√µes de escolhas, das trilhas sonoras e se curtem romance visual recomendo o jogo.

column8:
3rd attempt at writing review... steam keeps crashing.
One of the least visual and more novels I have seen.
Basically, this is someone wrote some fanfic.
They then said the fanfic needed something. So they then added some graphics. Then they had a text story with pictures...
The idea then struck, Let us make this story "interactive".
after two hours in... I was still waiting for a "meaningful" choice.
Most choices are three variants of the same theme. So the reason to even choose that is to slightly alter the narrative. Oh, you used physical force vs power? Results similar. Narrative slightly changed.
If you are going to do a visual novel, at least make it seem more like the old choose your own adventure games... and less like I am just choosing things that do not matter.
I was interested in the topic, so gave this more time than I should have...
Save the money and just do a web search for Vampire the masquerade fan fic....

 , 0 personal experience. Choices are pre-determined and don't matter, and there is  only 1 ending which you can't change.

column8: Assez captivant on s'accroche jusqu'a la fin !

This game is atmospheric and gorgeous, and has some really good characterization and writing that is very friendly to those new to Vampire the Masquerade. That said, the story falls apart completely toward the end. The ending comes abruptly, doesn't tie things together, and doesn't make much sense, even though I played through the game with all three characters, having choosen different routes each time, which, mind you, makes very little difference in the end. So yeah if you're just willing to enjoy the ride, going through the individual quests while being prepared for an ending that probably EVERYONE who plays the game will find unsatisfying - go for it, especially if the setting is to your liking. The sequel I enjoyed much more, and this game can also be cool to have played before that one, just for a bit of more background.

I'm pretty tepid on visual novels, so I can't say whether this was a "good" one. But I do think Coteries of New York is an excellent introduction to Vampire: The Masquerade for anyone who's interested in the universe or in playing the tabletop game. As you progress, you'll naturally build a pretty solid glossary of basic V:TM knowledge, which should make stepping further into this dense world a little bit easier.

haven't played visual novels until this time. just passed the first bag of blood playing toreodor.

pros:
‚Äì nice visuals
‚Äì and music

cons:
‚Äì for now not that many lines for character you play; I guess, some options won't change much too and the others are obviously stupid and lead to a conflict/last death.
‚Äì some music (stranger/predator-looking guy) is too darn repetitive, short and has obvious start and ending; bothered a lot. hope I won't hear it again, but I guess I will
‚Äì would be great to see more visuals like in the scene where you drink the first girl dry as toreodor; more pics of characters in their different moods. damn, the game's production is already cheap due to its genre, just pay a little extra to your artists.
‚Äì also would be great to hear more stuff like starting an engine and closing a car's door. also won't cost you much, but it would be a lot better immerse-wise
‚Äì I'd like to hear at least introduction lines of the characters I met, voiced. I guess, there won't be 100 of them, so it's not that much work to do too.

for now I'm pretty much enjoying it, just because I like the WoD lore, but I'll left a negative mark so the devs may improve on their future WoD games.

column8:
Coteries' manages to tell a story right at home in the World of Darkness: It is another story about a fledgling - recently embraced - having to deal with the push and pull of all the older, more experienced Kindred of New York. They're embroiled in the usual politicking, largely playing their part as a pawn in the schemes of the Elder and try to simply carve out an existence in the modern nights, as well as the Camarilla. Pretty standard fare for VTM videogames, but a solid starting point nonetheless. Plus the entire machinations of the plot are equal measures ridiculous and intricate, making it (as said above) a story fitting in with the settings over all themes and tone.
A small letdown is the protagonist though. Yes, it is admirable, that most of the characters in the world refer to them by using gender neutral pronouns, allowing for the fledgling to be, whoever the players wants them to be in this regard (I expressly want to praise this choice!). The problem is their lack of characterization, because excluding the opening narration (the life they leave behind) no real character for them is developed throughout the entirety of the game. This way, the game succeeds in making them into an avatar for the player, allowing to interact with the fictional world and manipulate it. But at the same time, the protagonist isn't really connected to this world, until the plot kicks in, There is no sense of their ideals, their ethics or rational in decision making is conveyed ... because these are nonexistent. The fledgling isn't a character, they're first and foremost "Player One".
The other Kindred make up for this lack of character with the protagonist somewhat, but the story never finds its rhythm, no matter how many twists and turns it takes - maybe because of them. It lacks cohesion, barrels through its few nights at way to high a speed, while missing the chance to build tension. The conflict comes leaping out from behind the curtain, then bows out again and you almost see it shuffle its was back. You wait for the next moment, when "something happens".
All in all, it is still an enjoyable stay in the World of Darkness, the art is stunning and the tone is generally strong. Don't expect a masterpiece and you'll have a few hours of intrigue in the company of the New York Kindred.

I went in and bought this game ignoring every criticism and check it out for myself. At first I didn't mind on how linear and repetitive everything is, but as the final act came to a close I felt really disappointed. The game has strong points though, the story was ok but the execution was horrible. I don't know if I should not reccommend this to anyone or let people see for themselves.

For those wanting to try the game out, just play Night Road and Parliament of Knives. You'd have more satisfaction playing them and sale or not, your purchase feels completely worth it.

[h1] This is another case of wishing Steam reviews had a neutral option. I recommend Coteries of New York, but only if it's at least 50% off. Anything beyond that discounted price is not worth it, even if you're a massive WoD fan. [/h1]

If you're unfamiliar with the lore, this is a decent introduction to Vampire the Masquerade V5. The writing is pretty solid throughout and the presentation, both in terms of visuals and audio, does a phenomenal job capturing the brooding atmosphere of the World of Darkness. Sadly, that's about where the positives end.

Under the veneer, I was immensely disappointed at just how linear of an experience this was. Of course, the illusion of choice and consequence only breaks on subsequent runs, and I can't, in good conscience, deny that I really enjoyed my time on that first playthrough.

If you're craving something that has more reactivity and multiple endings, I highly recommend Night Road and Parliament of Knives, the latter being my personal favorite, at least at the time of this writing.

I really love the World of Darkness universe. I love Vampire Masquerade. I love the table top, the buggy game fro the 2000s, the art, the music, everything. I even enjoy visual novels and choose-your-own-adventure games. 

I just can't recommend this game/visual novel. I do not like playing as a pre-made character. Maybe I'm spoiled from the other Vampire Masquerade titles. I just can't immerse myself in the story, unless I can create my own character. 

If they alter this game/visual novel to include character creation, then I will try this again. Even pay full price.

column8:
ORIGINALLY WRITTEN = 09-14-2020:

2 weeks ago, played through Vampire: The Masquerade - Coteries of New York (PC/Steam).

For those that never played a VTM game, this feels like a solid introduction to that universe, as it teaches a lot of the lingo, terms, politics, and stuff that goes with that franchise. No voice-acting and the backgrounds were somewhat static, even though some had movement of characters, stuff in the background, etc etc - which, in a sense, reminds me of Myst; but everything looks in a "hand-drawn" style here mostly.

You have some decision-making to make, though it does seem like...it's like TWD Telltale and the journey might be different, more so than anything. Some characters and quests, I never even got to.

I really liked the writing and characters here - but felt things wrapped up a bit too quickly here, by the end. It's as if the publisher told them to wrap stuff up....and they did so.

Took about 5 hours or so to get through this visual novel.

column8:
I am disappointed. I was looking forward for this game, hoped for strong story. My bad. Now I am not sure how to "play" it...  WHEN does the first interaction occur? 
It could be some video sequention, so at least I don't have to neverendingly click click click click on the same symbol which means "show me another two sentences"... you know, when I read books, I have more text on one page so it is not annoying to read. And also books are cheaper. Or maybe I am not understanding at all. I clicked about 50 times in one long monologue, which leads me to nowhere. OK, RPG means role playing game, but in this app (not game), you can't play, so it is more click-to-read-another-text. Now I go to read some online novel, cuz scrolling whole screen is kinda better then click every one-two sentences. Maybe I will give it another try, but I really miss some SPACE or ENTER option to skip to the next dialogue.

Got to Night 14 on my second attempt with 3 people recruited already when my character got offed because I decided not to drink blood at every opportunity the game offered. So the game decided, I should kill a random person on the street and then get murdered by some specialty kill squat. Let's just say, I'm not going to play through all that again (even though you can use CTRL to skip through the dialogue super quickly). Thank you for wasting my time.

column8:
I'm going to give this game a firm yes with one caveat - not at full price. The game is too short to justify $20. Maybe if the story was a little less linear to open up additional playthroughs but not as it stands. It'll take you around 8-10 hours and once your done the only real reason to replay is for achievements or to experience one of the other selectable clans. I got it for $5 and view that as a bargain. $10 would be fair. $20 is too much. 

Coteries of New York is a visual novel but don't expect a sprawling storyline with a multitude of endings. The story is going where it's going, there are various routes there but it's going to end up where it does regardless of your actions. In the context of the overall world and what you are in Kindred society it wouldn't make much sense any other way. The game makes it clear again and again that you're just a pawn in this grand political game. A particularly stubborn and driven pawn but still a pawn. 

The story is well written and the characters are all intriguing. I probably will replay it again just to dive a little deeper into the other characters in the game that I didn't have time to fully interact with during my first game so I suppose that's another potential avenue of replayability. Overall, it was a fun experience, a great introduction to the World of Darkness if you're unfamiliar and worth experiencing (again, just not at full price.)

There is one glaring issue though and if you've read multiple reviews you're probably noticing a theme that's about to continue. The ending. I don't really care that my decisions don't influence it much - again it makes sense in context and it would be a little weird if you could, honestly. The problem is that the end doesn't feel like an end. It's basically a cliffhanger which wouldn't concern me much if not for the fact that a "sequel" is essentially out now and it doesn't allow you to continue your story. It continues the story of this overall world that is being built but not YOUR story and that is disappointing. Like some bizarre writing ADHD they had a great set up for a mesmerizing continuation of a very interesting story and were just like "nah, we're gonna do something completely different instead." 

I still enjoyed the game thoroughly and would still absolutely recommend it at the right price but I would be remiss if I didn't make note of that fact.

column8: I was leaning towards giving this a good review through most of the game, till the end. The writing and characters kept me pretty well hooked throughout. It's a series I've heard about but never really looked into. Delving into this world, there was some interesting concepts and lore to get into. Actually hooked me enough that I played late into the morning after a long shift. The UI isn't the best, missing a few features these types of games usually have. Quick save is kind of nice to have for example, sometimes it's hard to gauge what tone your character will take with a line you chose. Nice to have the option to go back if your character angrily yells a line of dialogue you were expecting to be a joke. Multiple save slots are good in case you want to replay but not redo totally from the start. Stuff like that. It's a very slimmed down VN game, nothing new/extra to it, and it's missing some features typical of the genre. So, for a good portion of the game I was fine with all that, and actually quite liked certain aspects. Then towards the end it really started to pick up pace, and I realized it's likely going to reach the end, very soon, too soon it feels like. I didn't really get much of the side missions done, only two in my "coterie" I guess. There's this big story moment that happens real quick all the sudden, then I'm left trying to figure how my character is going to make it out of this just totally F'ed situation. And, the game ends. Cliffhanger. ...I just don't get why this is a thing people do for anything. No one likes it and it just leaves a bad taste. I'm sure there's reasons that can be provided for why people consider it reasonable to do this, I don't accept it at all personally. I guess I'm just done with this series now, don't want to invest anything further just to get strung along. I would have said $12 was worth it for the first part, but the ending just flipped me totally around on that. Best to get when it has a large cut in price, with the understanding you're paying for a story sans the ending.

column8: Wasn't really into VNs but this one kept me glued to it all the way through, thanks to good writing with a fair amount of player interactions (including choosing your character ... wish there were more to choose from). A pleasant surprise all round. Just a pity its sequel switched writers and fell horribly flat.

column8:
*reccomendation is for vtm fans, i dont think non-fans will get much out of this*

Took me a couple tries to really get into this one and while its overall enjoyable, it feels too unfocused and unevenly paced for me to call it a standout. Protags feel pretty meh outside their unique clan moments, the ending is pretty awkward and rushed (kinda a theme with vtm games). The coterie members and the Sheriff are all pretty cool though, especially Hope. Some cool moments and sidequests, and the standalone expansion Shadows of New York certainly builds off tjis in a way that makes it worth playing first, but I can't really reccommend it to anyone not already into VTM. If you are into it, then it can be pretty fun and certainly quick. Def worth playing if shadows interests you.

7/10 Pretty decent for VTM fans, but too unfocused and nothing really stands out well enough to reccommend without caveats.

column8: The other critiques about a linear plot structure are true, but I find that there is a good amount of replay value based on the amount of characters you can interact with during the game. I really enjoyed the game, at least.

column8:
This game had a lot of potential - the writing is well-paced and the characters have personality. There's a variety of Clans you get to interact with and it's a good starting point for people who know absolutely NOTHING about VtM (there's an in-game dictionary, even). That being said, there is literally zero replay value to this game. Despite having achievements for finishing the game as three different clans, you are literally playing the same story, word for word in many parts, for the entire game. Nothing you do has any impact, the game just sort of pushes you along to the inevitable ending. There are a few points where you can die early on, but instead of having chapters you can replay, you have to start the ENTIRE. GAME. AGAIN.

This means tapping through each choice and conversation again, especially if you don't realise (like I didn't) that the CTRL key allows you to high-speed skip to the next dialogue choice (which will rarely offer you alternative events) until your third or fourth attempt at the game. It is good for achievement hunters as the achievements are all fairly easy to get, but if you don't care about achievements, this game can be played through, once, for the story. 

Weirdly, all of the characters get called 'them' despite having obvious masc or fem presentations - you don't get to design your character whatsoever so the idea that they left the pronouns open as though you could choose is a bit weird. There is plenty of LGBT+ content which is shown in a neutral-positive light rather than trying to raunch it up or make it a moralistic tale which is refreshing.

There's absolutely no way to bond with any of the characters beyond a working relationship as you form your Coterie. You will occasionally be able to use powers at predetermined instances (which again, have little effect on the story, don't look cool or provide you benefits). There is no levelling in this game, no progression, and no actual combat. I would say this game is less an RPG and more of a visual novel. 

Rating it as a video game... I am still struggling to figure out what the 'game' aspect of this game is. Rating it from a visual novel angle, I would read more by the same author because the quality of writing and pacing is good and the political intrigue of the Camarilla is something that I enjoy immensely. The ending of the game feels more like a "to be continued" than an actual ending, so I am anticipating a continuation to the story in some way. Still, if you're looking to PLAY an actual GAME, this is one to avoid.

column8:
Se siete amanti del gioco di ruolo, che esso sia cartaceo o live, che siate amanti del mondo dei vampiri in generale poco importa, adesso che il gioco √® in italiano dovete fare vostro questo gioco e sviluppare la vostra esistenza (o non esistenza) nel clan Brujah, Ventrue o Toreador. Avrete daventi un gioco che ricalca quella che potrebbe essere una sessione di Vampiri nella quale il vostro destino √® gi√† segnato..o forse no?
https://youtu.be/xhcAo9tIyLs

*Pollice giallo

Chiariamo subito: √® una visual novel, o un libro game semplificato se preferite, quindi tutto il gameplay si basa su delle scelte che possiamo fare a livello testuale e finita l√¨, tra l'altro a prescindere delle nostre azioni il finale √® sempre lo stesso e morire/fallire √® quasi impossibile. Detto questo la storia √® bella e richiama alla perfezione le atmosfere e i temi dell‚Äôambientazione di Vampire, le immagini che accompagnano la nostra avventura sono suggestive allo stesso modo; per chi non conoscesse i termini vampireschi utilizzati c'√® pure un utile dizionario. Si possono scegliere tre personaggi diversi e ognuno di essi ha delle brevi sezioni di storia uniche. La traduzione italiana non √® malaccio considerando che il testo inglese non √® facilissimo, ma ci sono degli errori abbastanza marchiani.

In conclusione se cercate una storia ambientata nell'universo di Vampire: The Masquerade questo √® il racconto che fa per voi, se cercate un videogioco passate oltre.

column8:
El juego est√° bastante bien, hasta que llegas al final, que te lo meten con calzador en mitad de la historia, a prisa y corriendo y... ¬°porque s√≠!

Era la primera aventura gr√°fica (aunque no s√© si, mas que aventura, es m√°s una historia gr√°fica puesto que parece que poca importancia tienen las decisiones o di√°logos que escojamos en el devenir de la misma) y me estaba gustando mucho hasta que, en mitad de la misma y sin venir a cuento, el juego decide que la historia tiene que acabar en ese mismo momento... 

Da igual que lo elijas o no, el juego est√° hecho para que dure solo 15-16 noches y ya, punto. Debido a esto, me parece que tira por la borda todo el resto de la historia que consigue meterte en el papel de un neonato (aunque se hecha de menos que exista un registro de personajes y hechos que has conocido para que puedan ser consultados en cualquier momento).

En resumen, buena idea, nefastamente ejecutada.

Si lo compras de oferta, por menos de 5 euros y sabiendo esto, puedes arriesgarte. Si no es el caso, me parece una tomadura de pelo pagar m√°s por este juego.
beautiful art and music but depressingly short.

column8:
I started this with positive review because I did enjoy my time with this game, but ultimately it's overpriced. It's worth picking up for 5 bucks if you are interested in the IP or vampires in general. It's definitely not a bad game, just expensive.

The writing is pretty good and the story is enjoyable. I played through the game in one sitting because I was genuinely engaged. But i'd hesitate to call it anything resembling a branching visual novel. Your character choice only impacts the opening scene and the ending is set in stone. The middle of the game is simply a matter of selecting who to talk to each day to advance each characters personal plot. 

It all works fine and I enjoyed it, but it's all an illusion of freedom or control. The choices can be highly effective from an emotional standpoint, but mechanical they don't mean jack.

But from a technical standpoint, this game is pretty bad.
- The storytelling looks cheaper than most free mobile games with a tiny text box and 1 character portrait at a time.
- Even VNs in the 80s had better input options. This requires you to click on a tiny arrow and felt like a cheap mobile port.
- There's no auto-advancing text, unique gallery images for key events, 
- You can't save, so if you make a misclick you need to restart the entire game

There are mentions of "Hunger", the "Beast taking over", and "being discrete" but they never seemed to come into play. It really felt like they promised mechanics from the RPG but never actually used them. 

While this absolutely isn't a bad game, I find myself looking back and recommending VtM: Night Road instead. While it lacks the graphics and sounds, the experience was far more interactive and meaningful.

column8: While I tend to love all things VtM, and I generally enjoy the "interactive novel" genre, there are inconsistencies in the writing that ruin Coteries of New York for me.  Take this review with a grain of salt. I'm really pedantic about stuff, and none of the things that bother me are akin to major plot holes, or anything of the sort, but it's obvious that a team of people worked on this game, and none of them communicated. The thing that bothers me most is that there's no way to go back and change a conversation without restarting the entire game. This seems like a huge oversight, but if things like nonsensical conversation options and typos don't bother you, you'll probably have fun.

column8:
So, I lost my save game because I accidentally clicked on New instead of Load in the main menu and despite aborting with Esc, it did just overwrite my ONLY save game. Who designs a game like that?!?

Unfortunately, this is just the top of the iceberg of what's all wrong with this wannabe visual novel. Be it the crappy interface or the cheap side story structure. Naturally, facial expressions also were too much work and voice acting also doesn't exist. It's also baffling that the creators probably never read a VN before creating this, because even the most basic things like auto-play or skip are missing. And why do I have to click a tiny pointer to progress the story, if the rest of the screen has no other mouse interactivity?

Overall, the interactive backgrounds are probably the only thing where some effort was put in, and even those vary strong in quality. Avoid at all cost!

I like that you have a choice of clans in this one, but I liked Shadows better. I feel like they split the effort of detailing the protagonist and you wound up with more of a silhouette/stand-in than a character with interesting capacity for expressing the attitudes you suggest they have, like Shadows' Julia.

Still, you aren't locked into just one clan, so you can get a bit of a wider sample.

It's also kind of cool how you basically have to replay to see everything: it takes a few runs before it's totally redundant.

My biggest gripe is that there is only one ending, and anything you do (other than get yourself killed early) will ultimately and inexorably converge to that ending.

It still provides good flavor for Vampire: The Masquerade.

Why is this a game and not just a free mobilephone app? 
You just read and click on options and in the end it doesn't even matter... 
*Linkin park starts playing*

-ending: rushed, weird and worst of all: unchangeable
- choices don't matter
-  sometimes the option you pick does not match with the outcome
- Hope's quest line: I could feel my brain cells dying
- no replay value: I've played it with a female and a male character: no significant difference
- no romance (Come on, give mama some sugar at least...)
- the game rushes you for no reason, you can't even finish all quest lines
- no voice acting
-no animations
- most characters lack depth
- very short

+ overall idea with the secret vampire elite
+Qadir
+D'Angello
+ art works

It's just *so* railroady. When the literal only appeal of your game is a text narrative with some looping animations, at least have some kind of branching story. Literally what is the point of giving the player choice when ultimately they're only allowed to pick one specific option? I can buy a decent book for cheaper, even when this is on sale.

It's also got some horrendous grammar and characterisation (not very good for a visual *novel*, let alone one based on an RPG system) and ridiculously bad graphics options that don't work properly. If this is supposed to get people into World of Darkness, consider me thoroughly unsold. Maybe license your property to people who aren't terrible/lazy at their job.

column8:
I feel really sad writing a negative review for this game because I largely had a fun time through it. 
The characters were relatively well realized; the art work is delightful and the story kept me engaged. 
But the ending... Its such a weird ending. Its not a bad ending per se; It does fit the tone of the world to some degree but my gripe comes with the fact that there's really no way to change it. 
All of your choices throughout the story don't mean anything in the long run because you end up at the same place again and again. Sure, you can become friends with certain characters and you can antagonize others. That's all fine and good, but when I'm asked to make choices, I'm assuming that I can try and make the best choices I can for my characters and this visual novel's solitary ending tells me that's not possible.
It breaks my immersion in the worst possible way because I realized that none of my choices matter and I wasn't even doing anything. It left a painfully sour taste in my mouth. I think this story might have been better suited as a novel or something; maybe a podcast-story type thing. Not a game. 
I'm only thankful that I got this game in a bundle, so I didn't pay full-price for it and I got other games with it. I wouldn't recommend it, unless you're a super big fan of this universe and the game comes on a significant discount.

column8: What a waste of time and effort. The "story" is little more than a tutorial style intro into VtM. The characters are shallow, there is no point in building your coterie as it only appears in 1 scene and has no effect on the story, and then the end is just a railroaded bit of nonsense that feels like the end of Mass Effect 3. Dont pay full price for this game/short story/slideshow.

Brujah dostaje moc wp≈Çywania na emocje innych i wzbudzanie zachwytu albo strachu (Prezencja), nadnaturalnej szybko≈õci dzia≈Ça≈Ñ (Akceleracja) czy nadludzkiej si≈Çy (Potencja). Atutami Ventrue bƒôdzie tak≈ºe wspomniana Prezencja, ale tak≈ºe narzucanie woli mocƒÖ silnej natychmiastowej hipnozy (Dominacja) oraz wyjƒÖtkowa twardo≈õƒá i niewra≈ºliwo≈õƒá na obra≈ºenia (Odporno≈õƒá). Toreador dostaje moce Prezencji, Akceleracji i jako wyr√≥≈ºniajƒÖcƒÖ Nadwra≈ºliwo≈õƒá czyli wielokrotnie czulsze zmys≈Çy oraz trafne przeczucia. Dodatkowo ka≈ºdy ze wspomnianych klan√≥w ma swoje s≈Çabo≈õci, ale najmocniej w grze daje siƒô odczuƒá wybredno≈õƒá w temacie spo≈ºywanej krwi u Ventrue. Nie odczu≈Çem nerwowo≈õci Brujah czy zauroczenia piƒôknem/brzydotƒÖ u Toreadora.

U≈ºytek mocy kosztuje nas krew i zmusza do konieczno≈õci jej uzupe≈Çniania, w przeciwnym wypadku mo≈ºemy ulec wewnƒôtrznej Bestii i napa≈õƒá oraz u≈õmierciƒá przypadkowego ≈õmiertelnika. G≈Çodna postaƒá ma te≈º ograniczone opcje dialogowe, bo ciƒô≈ºko zachowaƒá spok√≥j bƒôdƒÖc opanowanym ≈ºƒÖdzƒÖ krwi. Poznamy, ≈ºe jeste≈õmy tego bliscy po ≈õladach krwi w polu naszego widzenia. Tracimy te≈º tƒô cennƒÖ substancjƒô, gdy odniesiemy spore obra≈ºenia w wyniku niefortunnych wydarze≈Ñ czy decyzji.

Fabu≈Ça zaczyna siƒô zupe≈Çnie inaczej dla ka≈ºdego z protagonist√≥w, acz dalsze losy sƒÖ ju≈º identyczne - czyli mo≈ºemy r√≥wnie prƒôdko sko≈Ñczyƒá nasze istnienie, co wkroczyƒá do spo≈Çeczno≈õci Kainit√≥w bez szwanku na ciele. Umys≈Ç to insza inszo≈õƒá. Pierwsze noce zajmie nam swoiste szkolenie w temacie polowania oraz mo≈ºliwo≈õƒá poznania innych Kainit√≥w o podobnej nam randze w celu po≈ÇƒÖczenia siƒô w tytu≈ÇowƒÖ koteriƒô: grupƒô wampir√≥w pomagajƒÖcƒÖ sobie wzajemnie, choƒá niekoniecznie z czystej sympatii - czƒô≈õciej z racji wsp√≥lnoty interes√≥w.

W zale≈ºno≈õci od tego jak rozegramy spotkania z naszymi potencjalnymi towarzyszami mo≈ºemy zyskaƒá cennych sojusznik√≥w. Nasz wyb√≥r jest pomiƒôdzy: Tremere - wampirzym magiem krwi Agatonem o naukowym zaciƒôciu i kiepskich walorach spo≈Çecznych; wysoce ekscentrycznƒÖ hakerkƒÖ Hope z klanu Malkavian, kt√≥ra naturalnie jest zaburzona psychicznie; detektywem D'Angelo z klanu Nosferatu czy dzikƒÖ TamikƒÖ od Gangrel. Do≈ÇƒÖczenie do koterii bƒôdzie wymaga≈Ço pomocy w rozwiƒÖzaniu ich obecnych spraw (czasami mocno osobistych) i zyskaniu sympatii. Nie uda siƒô jednak zwerbowaƒá wszystkich czterech os√≥b z racji tego, ≈ºe g≈Ç√≥wna linia fabularna bƒôdzie nas poganiaƒá oraz pojawiƒÖ siƒô jeszcze inne poboczne wƒÖtki w historii, kt√≥re mogƒÖ ujawniƒá ciekawe informacje na temat lokalnej spo≈Çeczno≈õci Kainit√≥w i ich przedstawicieli.

G≈Ç√≥wna czƒô≈õƒá fabu≈Çy wrzuca nas w sam ≈õrodek miasta targanego konfliktem pomiƒôdzy CamarillƒÖ a Anarchistami - dwoma najwiƒôkszymi organizacjami zrzeszajƒÖcymi Kainit√≥w (czyli wampiry, je≈ºeli kto≈õ nie zna terminu). Dopiero fina≈Ç wyja≈õnia jaka jest nasza rola i dlaczego w≈Ça≈õciwie zostali≈õmy Przeistoczeni i trudno odm√≥wiƒá mu zaskoczenia. Jest naturalnie sp√≥jny i logiczny, uderza nas niczym ciƒô≈ºki obuch. Niestety, jest tylko jedno ostateczne zako≈Ñczenie - inne sƒÖ zwiƒÖzane ze ≈õmierciƒÖ na poczƒÖtku gry.

Ca≈Ço≈õƒá zr√≥≈ºnicowania fabularnego dotyczy w≈Ça≈õciwie tego z kim zako≈Ñczymy grƒô i jakie wƒÖtki poboczne domkniemy. Mo≈ºemy nawet nie mieƒá nikogo w koterii, acz to wymaga niema≈Çego trudu z naszej strony - i zasadniczo to najbardziej wymagajƒÖce osiƒÖgniƒôcie. Gdybym o tym nie wspomnia≈Ç - awykonalne jest uko≈Ñczenie wƒÖtk√≥w pobocznych za pierwszym podej≈õciem, bo uniemo≈ºliwi nam to nie czekajƒÖcy na naszƒÖ opiesza≈Ço≈õƒá wƒÖtek g≈Ç√≥wny. ZaletƒÖ tego rozwiƒÖzania jest, ≈ºe przechodzenie gry innƒÖ postaciƒÖ nie bƒôdzie monotonnym odtwarzaniem tych samych krok√≥w i pozwoli spojrzeƒá na niekt√≥re postacie innym okiem.

Postacie sƒÖ nietuzinkowe i warto finalizowaƒá zwiƒÖzane z nimi fragmenty scenariusza. Nawet nudna czy pozornie jednowarstwowa persona mo≈ºe skrywaƒá w sobie co≈õ zaskakujƒÖcego: czy to ≈õladowe resztki dobroci, g≈Çƒôboko skrywanƒÖ wra≈ºliwo≈õƒá albo wyszukane metafizyczno-eschatologiczne podej≈õcie do egzystencji wampira. Nawet zwyk≈Çy reporter z tabloidu zaskoczy nas w dalszym toku rozwoju wydarze≈Ñ.

W grze przygrywa adekwatnie uzupe≈ÇniajƒÖca obraz muzyka, kt√≥ra dobrze synchronizuje siƒô z obrazem i tempem obecnej akcji. Szkoda, ≈ºe nie do≈õwiadczamy czƒôstego w VN ud≈∫wiƒôkowienia kwestii m√≥wionych przez postacie, ale nie mo≈ºna mieƒá wszystkiego, nawet wiecznego ≈ºycia jako wampir.

Gra posiada kilkadziesiƒÖt osiƒÖgniƒôƒá, czƒô≈õƒá wymaga od nas ponownego jej ko≈Ñczenia - akcja pƒôdzi do przodu nie czekajƒÖc a≈º sko≈Ñczymy bawiƒá siƒô w nawiƒÖzywanie przyja≈∫ni czy pozornie niewinne interakcje z innymi napotkanymi postaciami czy problemami. Najtrudniejsze osiƒÖgniƒôcie ju≈º zosta≈Ço przeze mnie wspomniane wcze≈õniej. A, gra zapisuje tylko gdy chcemy wyj≈õƒá z gry, wiƒôc nie ma mo≈ºliwo≈õci powrotu do momentu sprzed podjƒôcia decyzji! Teraz ju≈º wiecie dlaczego ko≈Ñczy siƒô jƒÖ parokrotnie?

Tytu≈Ç polecam ka≈ºdemu mi≈Ço≈õnikowi ≈öwiata Mroku, kt√≥ry ostrzy sobie zƒôby na kolejnƒÖ ods≈Çonƒô cyfrowego ≈öwiata Mroku RPG.  Mo≈ºe nie wykarmi wewnƒôtrznej Bestii, ale uspokoi jƒÖ do czasu premiery...? Polecam te≈º osobom chcƒÖcym siƒô zapoznaƒá z realiami tego nietypowego uniwersum. Nie jest konieczna znajomo≈õƒá poprzednich gier z cyklu, acz jest jedno odniesienie do Vampire: Masquerade - Redemption, ciekawe czy wiele os√≥b wy≈Çapie kt√≥re?

column8:
A favor: 
- Explica de forma bastante sencilla el mundo de Vampiro. 
- Personajes interesantes.
- No tienes que darle vueltas a qu√© poder subir de rango.
- Va de vampiros.
- Aparece un pj Malkavian.
En contra: 
- Le falta una introducci√≥n al uso de los poderes que tu pj tiene en particular (al menos para la gente que no conoce este mundillo). Se puede jugar sin saberlo, ojo, al fin y al cabo es solo darle un click. 
- Puede que te quedes sin poder jugar todas las misiones secundarias.
- No sabes c√≥mo desbloquear algunas posibilidades en cuanto a los poderes.
- Solo tres clanes a elegir: Brujah, Toreador y Ventrue.
- Aparece un pj Malkavian: caos, caos, caos.

Definitely worth a playthrough if you're into VTM, VNs or just vampires in general.  I enjoyed my time with it and completed the game with 1 of the 3 available characters. Really loved some of the characters, but it felt like the ending chapter was a bit too sudden. Other than that, it's good, especially if you're looking for a game to play over a weekend or during halloween.

column8:
To make a "Visual Novel" Story short, this "World of Darkness" outing is a blood and soulless Production. 
(NO PUN INTENDED)

The Dialogs are time consumingly written in Tweetlength with no depth or insight. NONE of your "interactive" choices matter. You just hit the "enter" key over and over again.

The longer you play the more annoying become the character designs, no destinct charateristics - everyone has the same empty look. The Background noises make you go crazy after 10 minutes.

The Story is at best "mild" and at no time you are going to care about anyone in this Visual Novel. 

I normally don't talk about pricing but especially for 20 bucks, this game is way overpriced. 
"Vampire: The Masquerade - Coteries of New York" gives you the absolut bare minimum to pass as a Visual Novel.

For anyone who seeks an entry into "Vamprie The Masquerade" or a nice "World of Darkness" Game you will not find either here. 


I have not completed this game nor will i ever. This Game has wasted it's potential and there is no excuse for that.
I am beyond dissappointed.

Buena novela gr√°fica donde se representa bastante bien el juego eterno de intrigas, manipulaciones, traiciones, etc. del mundo de tinieblas.
El modo en el que dices las cosas, las acciones que realizas y el uso de los diferentes poderes vamp√≠ricos tienen sus consecuencias.
La historia es interesante y, para los no familiarizados, explica bien la diferente terminolog√≠a de la sociedad vamp√≠rica. Por otro lado no es que sea muy largo y la rejugabilidad de queda escasa.
Para el precio que tiene, recomiendo comprarlo en oferta.
