column8:
Quite the enjoyable game - however it feels like it ends too abrubtly. I expected more from a game with that pricetag. Still I'll probably play around with it a bit more. Perhaps there's more to the game than I've seen in the first playthrough.

Edit: Nevermind. There isn't any more to the game. You're left with a way too open ending (that you can't change btw), and with absolutely no way to explore the seemingly interesting characters. Honestly it's sad. It makes for a nice first playthrough, but it has next to no replay value.

"C'√©tait une nuit sombre, c'√©tait une nuit avec une lune rouge, c'√©tait l'une des nuits o√π des choses impures sortent du sol, une de ses nuits, au dessus de New York, qui faisait que nul ne serait √† l'abri. La Gehenne √©t√© la, la Pyramide Tremere √©t√© tomb√© et les humains partent en chasse √† nouveau."

Vampire la mascarade. Je l'ai d√©j√† dit dans mes autres √©valuations sur Steam, est un univers que j'affectionne. (J'ai la V20 et la V5 chez moi. Ainsi que Dark Age. Et Requiem. Et Immortel. Et Damn√©s... et... bon, je suis un fan de vampire). Quand j'ai entendu qu'un jeu vampire la mascarade sortais, j'ai fait la f√™te. Puis j'ai vu que c'√©tait un visual novel. j'ai aussi fait la f√™te, car je suis un grand lecteur.

Qu'avons nous la ? Un Visual Novel enti√®rement en anglais, sans cr√©ation de personnage, avec juste trois character disponible : Un Toreador, un brujah et une Ventrue... moui... pas convaincu.

je lance le jeu, dubitatif de la qualit√©, malgr√© tout. Et..... MIRACLE. J'adh√®re. Voici pourquoi :
Tout d'abord, c'est un visual novel qui dispose de m√©canique travailler. 
Jauge de sang ? Absente en terme classique, mais votre vision deviens rouge quand la soif vous marque. La b√™te peut vous submerger si vous vous assoiff√©e et la... c'est le drame, pour l'humain, vous et votre humanit√©.
Les pouvoirs ? disponible dans les conversations, √† certains embranchement.
La chasse ? Difficile et dangereuse.
Les combats ? Une succession de choix.


L'histoire peut-√™tre r√©sum√© ainsi : vous √™tes un nouveau n√© sans sire, qui se retrouve √† devoir dealer avec la politique Anarch et Camarilla. Classique, mais efficace

Mais ce qui marque √©norn√©ment, c'est l'√©criture des personnages, chaque Kindred que vous rencontr√© √† du Background √©crit derri√®re, ce sont des vampires, mais chaque vampire √† une personnalit√© enti√®re et chacun d'entre eux √† des id√©es sur ce qu'ils doivent faire.

En bref, je recommande.

I've never really liked the Visual Novel genre of gaming, but being a Vampire the Masquerade lover i decided to give it a shot, and I am so glad I did! The game captures the atmosphere of the WoD perfectly, with a visual art style that really screams 'darkness' without it feeling 'edgy'. The music which really immersed you in the world, and even made me wonder occasionally if it was straight out of Bloodlines 1. The story is engaging and kept me on the edge of my seat, enough so that I finished my first playthrough all in one sitting, and it cannot be stated enough how nice it was seeing well written characters that didn't stick to the usual clan stereotypes.

Even if you're not keen on the story style, if you're a fan of VtM, I cannot reccomend this enough. I'm already looking forward to my next playthrough!

column8:
Oozing with atmosphere this well written story creates an interesting cast of characters which prop up an intriguing narrative. There is some really great sound and music and sprinkles of animation which really helps to make the world feel like a living breathing thing.

Its important to understand that this is very much a visual novel first and if you expect a high degree of customisation for your character or even dialogue choices this game may disappoint. It will often prompt you to make a decision but will also allow itself to fill in dialogue which I felt myself wanting to choose to help make the character I'm playing as more my own. 

Overall If your looking for a world of darkness story this I believe will satisfy that craving. Certainly a thumbs up for me so far and I'm looking forward to closing out the story of this game!

column8:
If you or people you know need an introduction to [b]Vampire: The Masquerade[/b], this VN is perfect as it is able to relay in a natural way [i](and in my opinion way better than every other medium I've see thus far)[/i] how it is and feels to enter the World of Darkness and specifically Kindred society.

While it's true that visual novels not to everyones taste, you should give it a try - especially if you're planing on buying Bloodlines 2. The soundtrack is exelent, the background art is nice and gloomy and the writing is [i](from what I've see after ~6 hours)[/i] is above average if not even very good [i](in comparison to other VNs)[/i]... The   atmosphere is simply: On point.

Although... Release was already post-poned one week to polish the VN more, yet I still encountered a good amount of typos aswell as interface glitches [i](text was assigned to the wrong character)[/i] and more often that not different soundtracks overlapped each other.

All in all, especially for that steep price for a VN, it's only [b]1/2 thumbs up[/b] from me.

No autosave (take note), and railroady dialogue where there is obviously only one correct answer and the result of the other options is death and start over. All of which would be forgivable if the writing and art were any good or at least created an interesting atmosphere. Anyway, I died after half an hour out of sheer boredom, and nothing in that experience made me want to try again. Keeping in mind I normally enjoy visual novels and V:tM. Make of that what you will.

Hope new Ending for Each clan,but have a feeling,they all are routed to same ending...

Maybe change review when i have did most of the game,and all Clans are played.

column8:
Don't expect a full rpg, it's a visual novel with some player choice. The atmosphere is great though, and I would recommend this to anyone who played tabletop V:tM before.

Also, this would be a great introduction to someone who wants to start tabletop V:tM, I will make sure anyone who asks me to ST a tabletop game plays this beforehand to get some information about the setting.

column8:
Buy this on a deep sale. Whilst I enjoyed it and it thoroughly captures the essence of what makes VTM such a fun setting, it's also very short and ends abruptly.

A couple glitches here and there like a name and portrait appearing when that person isn't talking, there's also instances of disciplines that my character doesn't have being available to use. 

The ending is very bad. It's almost not an ending and it happens just as the story starts to ramp up, prior to that everything is setup and exposition. 

I feel like you'll only enjoy this if you love Vampire the Masquerade.

column8:
I know it says I've only played three hours so far, but a fun fact about that is that I played those three hours without a pause. I'm hooked on this game.
When it comes to VtM I'm a huge fan, having read a ton of the guide books, both old and recent, of course loving the classic Bloodlines game, and I even have the Malkavian logo tattooed on my leg.  So it goes without saying that when it comes to Vampire content, my expectations, and standards, can be high. 
But this game nails it. Is it going to break the visual novel genre wide open? Is it the BEST Vampire content of all time? Nope. But what it sets out to accomplish, it accomplishes with flying colors. Coteries of New York wants to let you play an interesting Vampire campaign, full of the political games and interesting characters you except from it. It lets you decide how to play the politics of the different Sects, and how you deal with the various characters you meet along the way, giving you tons of freedom and so tons of replayability. 
The atmosphere, character art, and backgrounds are all lovely, all fitting together very well. This combined with a great soundtrack that sets the mood of every scene without getting reptitive, is a recipe for success.

Whether you're a Vampire veteran, or a newbie who wants to dip their toe into what it would be like to play an actual campaign, Coteries of New York is worth checking out.

column8:
I mean honestly it's not bad. I personally don't really enjoy visual novels...like...at all. But even with that I know a good game when I see one. Now this game is just a visual novel. Don't expect anything different or anything inovative. It's not. It's just another visual novel. But it's a damn good one. It has its ups and downs like most games and I have a video going over a lot of them (link below) if you wanted to see the game in action and get some insight from someone whose been playing games for over 20 years. 

I think for its price, for what it offers, and for what it is that this game is worth your money if you're interested. If you like vampires, this series of The Masquerade, or if you like visual novels then you'll get exactly what you're looking for here. I hope you enjoy!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yTYYXtcD8E8&feature=youtu.be

hit the title screen and went "wow. this soundtrack really screams Remember VTMB!?"  
hit new game. only 3 clan choices. Brujah, Ventrue, Toreador. none of them are exactly my cup of tea, but hey what are you gonna do.  
get into the mess. wow this is Really VtM. they super nailed it.
and then the soundtrack rears back up and i swear to god its just a song from VtMB. i can't place it but i know i've heard it, and wow does it make you realize how much a soundtrack helps build a feeling. 

so far it's a really good visual novel, and it's a Really good VtM game.

column8:
Just finished my first playthrough at 4 hours in and I gotta say... eh?

I wont call it bad, its actually really good. Its just the story itself felt like there was a decent amount going on in the background while you scuttled about, yet... maybe it was just my clan choice (Which there were only 3 to choose from, sadly) but I felt slightly limited in my decisions. 


Blood didnt really feel like a precious resource. Yea, you had a limit but the limit felt a little too high. I did notice I got locked out of certain dialogue options and possibly more of what I was looking for, but at that same time, I never hesitated to use a discipline and never came close to 'the beast'. The one time I did 'get close to the beast' felt like it was a scripted. 

All in all, I got 2 more playthroughs to go through, but its a thumbs up for now.


Edit: Okay, so I decided to listen to a friend and chose the same character, but this time rush through the game using different options than what I selected the first time around. 


ITS ALL THE DAMN SAME. No matter what you do, no matter who you side with, the game ends on the same note. Atleast bloodlines had 2 endings, both of which came as a massive shock to the player. One of which punishes your hubris, and the other has you walking away like a badass that you truely became. This game basically throws everything youve done out the window with a thin veil that tells you "oh, you did well. your decisions matter!" But they DONT. Even if you skip all the side quests and dont get any friends, the game wont game over you. Instead it plotarmors you because you need to be alive for the ending. You heard me right, A VTM game PLOT ARMORS the player, in a table top setting where  most campaigns have you dying at simply talking to some person you thought was a hobo rudely, the game will save you no matter what you choose. After trying for 50 minutes of rapid clicking through options and trying to get myself killed, once the execution scene passes, ITS LIKE YOU CANT DIE. You can be as disrespectful as you want and only get a slap on the wrist.

Beautiful, dark, and uncompromising.
I love the World of Darkness universe even though it makes zero sense.
This is a visual novel style game with great art, great sound and a well written story.
You get to make some choices and there are definitely multiple paths through.
Very cool.

column8:
Vampire: The Masquarade as a Visual Novel

The world, setting and tone is all fantastic, but you're immediately let down by the fact you can only choose between Ventrue, Toradoar or Brujah. As someone who favours Malkavian and Gangrel that's a letdown.

Then comes the choices, they just don't matter... You can choose something, but around a second encounter the game just acts as if you choose something else and find yourself hold a conversation which makes no sense.

The ending just happens, whatever friends you made or relationships to made doesn't matter in the least.

Forget the fact that [i]Vampire: The Masquerade - Coteries of New York[/i] is a visual novel, as it [i]really[/i] knows what the setting is all about. From the world, to the characters, to the absolutely fantastic setting and handling of the franchise's deep lore, this is really a Vampire: The Masquerade game done right, and one that‚Äôs highly replayable. There are a few flaws here and there, like how forgettable the plot at hand is, or how the paths don‚Äôt diverge as much as one would want them to, but this is such an engrossing, and deeply atmospheric experience that it doesn‚Äôt really matter.

[b]Cubed3 Rating:[/b]
[b]8/10[/b]
[url=http://www.cubed3.com/review/5715/1/vampire-the-masquerade-coteries-of-new-york--pc.html][b]Read Full Review Here[/b][/url]
